column24: Excellent Staff Could Not Fault
column28: Lambton Suite.. Beautiful Room  Faultlessly Decorated & Maintained
column37: Amazing Dining Experience  Tasting Menu Was Such A Novel Idea To Be Able To Try Foods & Combinations We Would Not Have Ordinarily Tried! Compliments To The Chef & All His Staff!
column46: The Young Lady On Reception The Afternoon Of The 20Th Of June  Very Friendly & Attentive..  All Of The Restaurant Staff On The Evening Of The 20Th When We Dined For Professional  Friendly & Courteous Service
column50: Nothing At All Could Have Been Improved Upon!
column51: Can't Wait To Rebook & Pay Another Visit! Such A Beautiful Getaway From Reality.. Very Special :)

column24: I Had A Problem With The Online Booking Form On Your Website And Had To Ring Up To Make The Booking. The Hotel Was Fantastic And The Restaurant Was Superb. Your Staff Are Outstanding And Couldn't Have Made Us Feel More Welcome.
column46: Unfortunately I Did Not Get Their Names But The Young Lad Who Welcomed Us On Saturday Evening Was Very Friendly And Could Do Not Enough To Help Us And Your Bar Manager Was Very Friendly  Attentive And Gave The Whole Place A Very Happy Atmosphere.

column24: Very Welcoming And Friendly
column28: No
column37: Atmosphere A Little Stale But Otherwise Good
column51: Breakfast Was Slightly Disappointing As The Fried Egg Was Under Cooked But Otherwise Was Lovely

column50: Tea And Coffee In Rooms.

column28: I Was Above The Bar And Could Hear The Jazz Music Base Traveling Up. However This Did Not Continue When I Was Trying To Sleep And Did Not Disturb Me In The Morning Either.
column50: When The Pastries Ran Out At Breakfast I Would Expect Them To Be Replaced To Cover The Whole Of Breakfast Time.

column28: Fitzwilliam Suite. Robes Are Expected In Such A Hotel And Certainly In A Suite  This Is The Only Addition I'd Recommend. Wifi Reception Was Also Very Poor In Suite  Worked In Corridor And At Door But Not In The Bedroom With Any Consistency Or Speed.
column37: Food Was Outstanding  Particularly The Halibut  One Of The Best Fish Dishes I've Ever Had. The Seats Were Not To Our Taste  Didn't Really Allow You To Get Your Legs Under The Table (Just A Minor Point).
column46: Bar Man On The Night Was Very Good - The One With The Beard!

column24: We Found The Hotel Easily And Were Warmly Welcomed On Arrival. The Email Asking About Dinner Reservations Pre Arrival Was Sent Promptly And Therefore Stress Free.
column28: Room 20. The Shower Was Fabulous.
column37: Would Certainly Recommend The Restaurant To Others.
column51: We Had A Wonderful Stay At The Talbot And Would Look Forward To Returning In The Future. We Had An Excellent Stay And Could Not Fault The Service We Received.

column28: Room 16-I Suffer With Allergies- An Option To Choose A Non Feather Pillow Would Have Been Great ( If This Service Is Available I Wasn't Aware)  Room Was Very Well Cleaned Indeed- Excellent Standard Of Cleanliness
column37: As A Yorkshire Couple We Found The Portions Just A Little Too Small- Had There Been A Potato Or Vegetable Side Available It Would Have Been Perfect. The Waiting Staff Were Excellent  Professional  Friendly  Knowledgeable With No Hint Of Snootiness
column46: All Members Of Staff We Encountered Were Equally Friendly And Seemed Genuinely Pleased To Be There.
column50: Some Nibbles In The Room Perhaps? E.G. Crown Inn  Bawtry (4* Rated) Have A Hamper Of Yorkshire Products In The Suite. Other Touches Such As Bathrobes/Slipper For Use In The Room Are Often Found In Similar Rated Hotels
column51: We Stayed At Yorebridge House The Evening After We Stayed At The Talbot And It Highlighted Just How Efficiently Run The Talbot Is. Your Staff Were A Pleasure To Be Around.The Breakfast Was Also Excellent. Two Tiny Criticisms Are That At Breakfast Lots Of The Salt Pots Were Empty-I Had To Swap Mine Twice By Taking Off Another Table And My Neighbouring Table Also Had The Same Problem. The Other Thing Was That The Dining Chairs Don't Fit Under The Table Which Is A Bit Awkward :O)

column24: Thank You. All Of Your Staff Made Our Anniversary Stay Very Special And Memorable. We Really Couldn't Have Asked For Anything More.
column28: Thank You For Upgrading Us. A Remarkable Suite.
column37: Would Definitely Recommend The Diners Club As An Inexpensive Way Of Experiencing The Quality Of The Talbot.

column51: I Think The Secret Escapes Package Was Meant To Include Tickets To Visit Castle Howard But Did Not Receive These But Forgot To Mention It.

column24: My Only Complaint Was That Prior To Our Arrival  I Had Rang And Emailed The Hotel Requesting A Copy Of James Martins Latest Book To Be Signed And Left In Our Room As A Surprise Birthday Gift For My Partner. On Checking In And Being Shown To Our Room This Request Had Not Been Carried Out  Resulting In Me Having To Nip Back To Reception To Ask For The Book. The Girl Was Apologetic And The Book Was There And Had Been Signed As Requested  But No Note Had Been Left As To My Instruction. Also When I Booked The Hotel A Bottle Of Champagne Was Included In The Price  I Presumed That This May Have Been Left In The Room For Our Arrival Too  As It Had Not I Thought It May Have Been Brought To Us At Dinner. When The Waitress Took Our Orders I Had To Ask For The Champagne And Explained It Was Included In Our Package. Although This Was Not A Problem  May I Suggest That When A Guest Books A Package With Champagne Or Extras That They Are Asked When And Where They Would Like These To Avoid Any Embarassment.  Overall Our Stay Was Lovely And My Boyfriend Thoroughly Enjoyed His Surprise Birthday Treat.  Friendly Staff  Beautiful Hotel  Amazing Food  And The Weather Could Not Have Been Better!!!
Very Kindly Received An Email Regarding Booking Time For Dinner
column28: Only Improvement Would Be A Dvd Player And/ Or Satellite Tv
column37: Dinner Was Really Good  If A Little Unorganised At Times!
column46: All The Staff Were Really Good
column51: A Little Dis-Organised At Times But Really Good In Other Areas

column37: The Waiting On Staff In The Restaurant Were Very Professional With A Friendly Manner.

column24: We Arrived Late - Just Before Midnight. The Night Porter Was Friendly And Efficient And We Were Offered Drinks Straight Away.
column28: We Had The Lambton Room. The Sofa Was Nice And The Bed Large And Comfortable. The Shower Was Also Very Luxurious.
column51: The Grounds  Hotel And Room Were Absolutely Fantastic. We Would Most Definitely Stay With You Again And Have Already Strongly Recommended You To Several Of Our Friends. Your Staff Were All Friendly And Helpful And Made Us Feel Very Well Looked After. Our Cream Tea And Meal In The James Martin Restaurant Were Delicious. Can't Wait To Come And Stay Again!

column37: The Incredibly Rude Resident Complaining Very Loudly Behind Our Table Failed In Her Bid To Ruin Our Meal As When Asked To Move We Were Quickly Given Another Table At The Rear Of The Room And A Sincere Apology From The (I Think) Restaurant Manager That Evening And A Very Welcome But Unexpected Complimentary Drink Each  Dealt With Very Well.
column46: Restaurant Manager And Whoever Else Waiting Staff Ref Previous Page Regarding The Not Very Happy Somebody!

column28: We Were Very Appreciative Of The Room Upgrade
column37: Service Was Inconsistent  Maitre D' Had A Couldn't Care Less Attitude And The Waitress Was At A Loss As To What To Do When Told The Lamb Dish Varied From Medium Rare To Well Done And Dry.
column50: Not Had To Hunt For Staff To Serve Us At The Bar After Waiting For 10 Minutes

column37: I Am Pregnant And The Chef Was More Than Happy To Cater For My Dietary Requirements. Really Pleased With Our Food Selections. Excellent Standard Of Food And Service.

column24: There Wasn't A Concierge Available At Check In To Help With A Very Heavy Suitcase Up The Stairs!
column37: A Couple Of Minor Points: On The First Evening We Hadn't Had A Chance To Order Our Wine When Our Starters Arrived And On The Second Evening Despite Ordering Wine And A Jug Of Water At The Same Time As Our Food They Didn't Arrive Until After Out Starters Had Appeared Meaning Our Food Was Getting Cold While The Wine Was Being Tested And Poured.  It Did Seem At Times To Be A Lack Of Waiting Staff.
column50: A Biscuit With Hot Drinks Ordered To The Room Would Have Been Nice And Also On An Evening A Turndown Service With Small Treat Left Always Makes Me Feel Special!

column37: Lack Of Ambiance In The Dining Room And For A High Quality Hotel Our Food Was Rather Bland And Tasteless. Afternoon Tea Was Delicious Tho

column24: For This Class Of Hotel The Staff Could Go That Extra Mile. This Would Ensure The Service Is In Line With The Spectacular Design/Interior Of The Hotel. It Really Does Make Such A Difference If Staff Are Sincerely Striving For Excellent Customer Service  Rather Than Giving The Impression Of 'Just Doing Their Job'. Service Has To Be Of International Standard - Not Just The Best In Malton.
column37: As Per Previous Comments The Staff Need To Strive For Higher Standards Of Customer Service. It Makes All The Difference.
column46: Francesca Was Very Helpful In The Initial Booking Stages.
column50: Increase Quality Of Customer Service
column51: A Gorgeous Hotel - An Asset To Malton

column28: I Was Disappointed With The Standard Of The Room. It Was A Nice Room And Well Maintained But I Have Paid A Similar Price At Other Hotels For A Much Better Appointed Room. It Did Not Feel Luxurious. In Addition Rubbish Had Been Left At The Door Of The Room By The Cleaning Staff
column37: The Food Was Fabulous But I Was Surprised By The Limited Nature Of The Menu. My Friend Is Vegetarian And Only Had A Choice Of 1 Starter And 1 Main. For Breakfast The Kitchen Had Run Out Of Some Items E.G. We Ordered Crumpets (Plural) But Only One Crumpet Was Left And Served.
column51: I Feel That The Hotel Trades On The Reputation Of James Martin - And The Food Was Amazing But The Room We Had Did Not Live Up To The Billing Or Price. Having Said That We Did Have A Lovely Time Overall.

column24: I Did Leave A Telephone Message Asking To Be Contacted Regarding My Booking  But  Never Received A Response.
column28: Room 2: Very Pleasant And Warm Weekend  The Rear Door Was Wedged Open So We When Outside To Enjoy The Weather  Some Seating And Possibly Tables Would Have Been Lovely To Have The Use Of.
column51: In General A Very Pleasant And Enjoyable Stay  We Will Be Returning.

column37: I Was A Little Disappointed With The Meal To Be Honest. I Had The Salmon  Which Was Very Salty. In Terms Of The Food  With James Martin Being Executive Chef I Was Expecting The Food To Be Proper Hearty Yorkshire Cuisine So Was A Bit Underwhelmed By It.
column50: Staff Were Attentive But Not Efficient. E.G. Waiting 25 Mins For Our Cream Tea Order.
column51: I Waited At The Bar For Over 20 Minutes To Be Served On The Afternoon Of Arrival. Similarly I Waited 5 Mins To Be Seated For Breakfast.  I Was Appalled To Hear A Member Of Staff Be Told To 'Shape Up Or Be Sacked' For Merely Taking A Drinks Order In The Bar To The Wrong Table. While I Appreciate The Need To Discipline Staff And Maintain High Standards Doing This In Front Of Customers Is Unacceptable!

column28: Lovely Large Rooms. One Let Down Was That No Bedding Was Provided For The Travel Cot That We Had Booked.

column24: Staff Were Helpful And Efficient When Making The Booking  Respondign Rapidly To E-Mail. Very Pleasant And Welcoming On Arrival.
column28: Room 22 - Lovely Spacious And Quiet Room With Good View.  It Was A Little Warm But We Don't Get Such Warm Weather Very Often.
column37: Food Of A Consistent High Standard On Each Of Our Four Visits.  Excellent Selection Of Dishes Using Local Ingredients  Good Portion Size. Far Above The Standard Seen In Most Luxury Hotels.
column46: Restaurant Staff Particularly Professional And Attentive While Maintaining A Discrete Distance.  Reception Staff Welcoming And Helpful.  Bar Staff And Maitre 'D Very Friendly.
column50: No

column24: We Stayed At The Talbot To Celebrate Our Three Year Anniversary And We Had A Wonderful Time. Great Food  Friendly And Very Helpful Staff And A Great Atmosphere. The Lady Who Showed Us To Our Room And Checked Us In Couldn't Do Enough For Us And The Bar Staff And Waiters Were Professional But Welcomed You With A Relaxed Personality. Overall A Great Experience. I Have Strongly Recommended You To My Parents. They Never Go Away And Are Strongly Considering It So Our Comments Must Have Been Positive!
column28: Maybe Tea/Coffee Making Facility. I Know That Tea And Coffee Was Delivered When Requested But T Would Have Been Nice To Make A Cup Of Tea First Thing In The Morning.
column37: Maybe A Choice Of Side Orders To Complement The Main Meal. However I Did Request A Side Order Of Potatoes And This Was No Hassle At All To The Waiter.
column46: There Was A Man Who Worked Behind The Bar Who Made Us Feel Very Welcomed And Relaxed.

column28: Room 21. Some Lights Didn't Work. Not A Complaint But Just Wanted You To Be Aware.
column46: The Younger Members Of The Team At Dinner Time. They Were Fab.
column50: Older Team Members Could Smile More :)
column51: We Had A Great Stay And Would Definitely Come Again. It Was Lovely  Thank You.

column24: No One At Reception On Arrival  Had To Wait Approx 5-10 Mins To Check In
column37: We Noticed Other Diners Were Being Given 'Complimentary' Champagne After Dinner But We Were Excluded From This. We Still Enjoyed The Overall Experience But This Did Make Us Feel Less Important/Special

column28: Room 20.  I Was A Bit Surprised There Was No Minibar.  Other Than That I Thought The Room Was Great.

column24: We Had A Very Enjoyable Stay. Unfortunately When We Arrived For The Wedding At About 2.15Pm The Room Was Not Ready  Which I Was A Little Surprised About  So We Had To Freshen Up In The Toilets. Our Bags Were Taken Straight Up There But We Didn't See The Room Until The Wedding Wound Up At 3Am. It Was Such A Nice Room And We Regretted Not Being Able To Avail Of It Earlier In The Day.
column46: Two Bar Staff Attended The Bar Until 3Am On Saturday Night. They Were Friendly  Patient And Good-Humoured Throughout And Showed No Sign Of Trying To Hurry Us Out. I Thought This Was Exceptional.
column50: The Room Not Being Ready Was The Only Disappointment  Everything Else Was Flawless.

column24: The Original Price Was Incorrect But The Reception Amended That Without Fuss.
column28: It Was Very Hot Which Detracted From The Experience.
column51: Put Portable Fans In The Room For The Summer Months.

column24: Professional And Friendly; Prompt And Helpful Response To Request For Early Check In.
column46: The Waitress On Duty On Monday 26 August (I Didn't Get Her Name  But She Had Dark Hair And Glasses) - Friendly And Accommodating. All The Front Of House - Particularly On Sunday 25 August.
column51: Thoroughly Splendid - Would Definitely Stay Again.

column24: Loved Every Minute
column28: Loved It!
column37: Loved It!
column51: Keep It Up!

column37: The Food Was Some Of The Best We Have Eaten In A Long While With The Fish And Lamb Both Being Exceptional.  We Would Have Liked To Have Been Reminded Of Each Course As It Came To The Table  Just To Remember What We Were Eating. It Was Wonderful And I Would Recommend The Food To All!
column46: The Bar Manager Was Very Professional And Made The Occasion Even More Special.
column51: I Could Not Recommend The Experience Highly Enough.

column28: The Bathroom Is Small Considering The Rate Is Over Â£155 For A Nights Stay.
column37: Had Breakfast And The Smoked Salmon Scrambled Egg Was Disappointing.  There Is Hardly Any Salmon In It And The Dish Is Generally Under Seasoned.

column50: Having To Hold The Button Down On The Hair Drier Was Hard Work When You Have Long Hair Like Mine The Big Tassle Thing On The Room Key Seems A Little Dramatic Had No Where To Out The Key Whist At The Wedding Its Not Handbag Friendly But At Least It Will Never Get List!
column51: Felt The Hotel Was Extremely Noisy A Lot Of Bumping And Banging In The Night Was Woken Up At 7 By Someone Dropping Crockery. Other Guests Doors Woke Me Up Banging Closed I Am A Heavy Sleeper And Was Glad To Go Home And Get Some Sleep. I Felt I Paid A Lot Of Money To Be Kept Awake Overnight. I Understand That There Are Tasks To Be Undertaken And You Have No Control Over Other Guests But This Is The Worst Hotel I Have Stayed In For Its Noise Levels

column50: Iron In Room

column24: Wedding At 12  Could Not Book Into Room Until 11.30 And Had To Get Ready For Wedding In Another Guests Room That Had Stayed The Night Before Aswell. When Weddings Are Booked Guests Should Beable To Get Into Their Rooms To Get Ready  Guests From Night Before Should Have An Earlier Booking Out Time. Honestly The Only Negative Of The Stsy But Its An Importsnt One.
column37: Fantastic Quality Of Food  Very Tasty

column28: The Lamps Did Not Work But We Only Stayed One Night So Didn't Complain .
column37: Amazing!!!!!!

column24: Part Of The Reason For Choosing The Talbot Was The Reputation Of The Food.  I Had Asked Whether Advanced Booking Was Necessary For Lunch On Sunday.  I Was Told It Wasn't  Only To Find A Few Days Short Of My Stay That It Was Not Going To Be Possible To Secure A Table.  I Could Have Booked Two Or Three Months In Advance Had I Been Given The Correct Information.
column46: When I Arrived Back From The Wedding We Had Been To  I Took A Wrong Turning In The Hotel.  The Two Employees Who Corrected Me Of This Did So As If Talking To A Child. 'Is Everything Alright  Sir?' 'Do You Know Where You Are Going  Sir?' 'Do You Remember Your Room Number?'  'What Is Your Name?'  Smirking And Being Condescending To A Drunk Guest - Whilst Rude - Would At Least Be Understandable  And In Any Case Forgotten By The Guest In Question.  Being Condescending To A Sober Guest  Who Has Just Driven Back  Is Less Understandable  And Isn't Forgotten.  So No  I Won't Be Coming Back Again.
column50: More Professional Booking Process And More Courteous Staff

column15: Jay Rayner Restaurant Review In Observer
column24: Lovely Warm Welcome
column28: We Were Lucky To Get An Upgrade To The Houghton Suite Which Was Amazing!
column51: Looking Forward To Making A Return Visit!

column28: We Found The Room (23) To Be Very Warm  We Opened The Windows And This Let Some Cool Air In But The Bathroom Felt Very Warm As No Window. The Room Was Absolutely Beautiful Though  Had The 'Wow' Factor!
column46: The Maã®Tre D Was Fantastic  Was A Problem With The Wines We Ordered And He Offered Us A Better Replacement At The Same Price - An Example Of Excellent Service.

column24: The Staff Were Extremely Professional But I Feel Stopping The Bar Meals Ar 7Pm Will Put Me Off As A Business Traveller...
column37: I Asked About Wine Recommendations To Match With What I Was Ordering  I Was Told 'I Dont Really Know That Much About Wine'.   Waiting Staff Should Not Write The Menu Description (In Case People Ask) On Their Hand - This Is Not Good. Use A Notepad If Required?  This Was A Minor Niggle/S Other Than That The Service Was Excellent.
column50: I Have Stayed Twice And The Printer Has Not Been Working - Please Fix!
column51: Great Hotel  Good Stay.

column37: The Food Was Magnificent! This Was The Main Reason We Booked This Stay To Celebrate Our Anniversary.

column24: Fantastic Experience  We Really Enjoyed Ourselves!

column28: Lovely To Have The Dogy Welcome Things. Main Light Didnt Work (But Was Fixed Quickly) And One Bathroom Light Flickered. Nice Spacious Room
column37: We Stayed For 2 Nights And One Of Us Was A Vegetarian. Would Have Appreciated More Choice Of Vege Dishes And Butternut Squash Risotto (From Lunch Menu But Offered To Me As Alternative Vege Dish For Dinner)Was Perfectly Pleasant But Not Up To Standard Of Rest Of Food.

column28: Room 21. As Mentioned On Check Out  This Room Is Close To The Staff Room Which Meant We Were Disturbed Early In The Morning. This Did Not Spoil Our Stay Though.
column37: Food Was Wonderful And The Staff Were Very Polite And Friendly. Maybe Try To Reduce The Number Of Staff Serving Each Table As We Had 4 Different People But All Were Very Nice And Could Not Fault Them
Great Customer Service! Very Professional - Good Knowledge Of The Menu Too. The Food Was Beautifully Cooked And Great Quality  Especially The Lamb (We Had The Tasting Menu).
column46: One Particular Waitress Was Really Kind And Friendly - I Overheard Two Separate Groups Of The Other Guests Commenting About  How Lovely She Was As Well. (I Didn't Catch Her Name  But She Did Mention That Her Partner Was The Sous-Chef In The Restaurant - I Hope That Helps To Identify Her Because I Would Like To Thank Her For Making Our Restaurant Experience Even More Enjoyable!)
column50: The Final Account Was Inaccurate As We Were Charged For A Coffee When It Should Have Been Included In The Tasting Menu - But As Soon As I Pointed Out The Mistake The Lady At The Desk Apologised And Immediately Rectified It.
column51: We Really Enjoyed Our Stay  And Would Definitely Stay There Again If It Was Within Our Price Range. We Will Be Keeping An Eye Out For Travelzoo Vouchers In Future As We Would Love To Come Back!

column50: I Should Have Booked An Extra Night!
column51: My Mother And I Really Enjoyed Our Stay. The Staff Are A Credit To You  All Friendly And Very Welcoming.  I Am Very Much Looking Forward To My Next Stay.

column28: Myself And My Husband Didn't Find The Pillows Very Comfortable As They Were Too Soft. Otherwise It Was All Excellent.
column37: It Took Quite A While For Our Wine And Water To Arrive  After That Everything Else Was Served At A Good Pace. We Didn't Get Our Treats With The Coffee  But These Were Delivered To Our Room  Along With Some Free Fizz And An Apology Which More Than Made Up For It.
column46: The Girl On Reception Was Very Pleasant And Helpful And Also The Lady At Breakfast Was Very Nice.
column51: I Would Love To Come And Stay And Eat With You Again - I'll Just Have To Save Up For It!!

column28: 25 - The Ceiling Lampshade Looked A Little On The Cheap Side And Would Have Been Nicer Not To Look Up To A Lightbulb In Bed. Otherwise  Lovely
column37: We Ate Lunch In The Drawing Room  Lovely Atmosphere. We Did Have To Send Back A Portion Of Chips Though That Were Almost Raw Inside!
The Tasting Menu Was Absolutely Delicious And The Service Spot On. Thank You

column46: Duty Manager/ Restaurant Manager Following Up A Minor Problem In A Courteous  Proffessional And Reassuring Manor. Promoting Very High Standards For The Talbot
column50: Really Thinking Hard For Something- Would Be To Provide A Small Biscuit With The Tea/Coffee Served To The Room  But This Was Not Essential
column51: Thank You And All Your Staff For A Lovely Stay With High Standards & Quality Assurance Throughout Our Stay. Whilst Out Walking In The Ground We May Have Seen Staff Smoking Out Of The Back Of The Kitchen - For Some This Could Be Off Putting & Maybe A Little More Descrete Would Be A Way To Improve  But Again I Only Mention This Lightly

column28: Immaculate Room
column46: Thank You For Accommodating The Late Request For Crisps!
column51: A Lovely Start To Our Engagement Weekend...Thank You!

column37: Ordered Room Service - Butternut Squash Risotto.  Although The Room Service Itself And Presentation Was Of A High Standard  I Unfortunately Didn't Enjoy The Food.  It Was Far Too Rich And Oily And Could Only Eat Half Of It.
Although The Lamb Was Amazing  I Should Have Ordered A Side With The Lamb....
column46: I Couldn't Single Out One Individual  Everyone Was Amazing.
column50: Meeting The Chef. I Always Feel That When The Food Is Such High Standard It Is Nice To Meet The Staff. We Would Have Also Loved To Have Met James Martin.
column51: Thank You For Everything  Tessa & I Look Forward To Returning Very Soon.

column24: A Porter To Assist With The Luggage Would Be Welcome.  Your Front Desk Staff Helped Me  But It Would Be Better If Someone Was Available For That Sort Of Thing As I Noticed Several Couples Struggling Up The Stairs With Their Luggage.
column28: Lovely Bathrooms.
column50: Not A Thing.
column51: Excellent All Around.
Checking In Was Fine  But Checking Out Seemed To Take Longer Than Expected And That Was With Just 3 People Waiting To Check Out All At The Same Time!

column24: No At All Stuffy. Very Friendly.
column51: We Really Liked The Tea Being Brought To Your Room Rather Than Naff Little Kettle And Uht Milk.

column24: The Receptionist And An Other Openly Discussing A Guest Bill  She Had Spent 20 Mins Going Over The Bill With Customer To Establish If He Had Been Over Charged   Think This Had Been Mentioned On Trip Advisor. Pleased To Say We Had No Issue On Check Out.  Having Learned After Booking That Is Was Malton Food Festival   I Rang To Ask About Parking   Was Told By Reception That No Provision In Place For Residents Found This Most Concerning. However When We Arrived A Very Helpful Gentleman Directed Us To Park In A Disabled Space Until Another Became Available.
column28: You Should Be Very Proud  The Cleanliness Is Immaculate  I Admit I Am Very Particular.
column37: We Where Seated On The Right Side Of The Bay Window  Red Wine Splashed On Wall/Radiator. Small Point But Only Criticism.
column50: Had To Ask About  The Champagne That Was Part Of The Anniversary Offer We Had Booked.
column51: Pity James Martin Didn't Attend Food Festival.

column37: Dining Experience Was Not Rushed Which Was Great
column51: I Booked This Evening Stay With You For My Parents As A Gift. My Husband And I Had Stayed With You Last Year And Had A Fantastic Couple Of Days.  Our Only Upset Last Year Was On Checking Out We Spent Some Time Debating An Incorrect Bill With A Queue Of People Behind Us.  We Put This Down To Teething Problems As You Had Only Just Opened.  As My Parents Stay Was A Gift I Had Rang A Couple Of Weeks Before Their Stay To Settle The Account. As You Can See From The Survey They Had A Relaxing And Enjoyable Stay With You But I Was Very Disappointed To Hear That On Checking Out They Were Presented With The Full Account To Be Paid.  My Parents Had To Spend Some Time Convincing The Receptionist That This Account Had Already Been Settled.  It Is Quite Disappointing That After A Wonderful Weekend This Was Their Last Memory. We Hope That The Next Time We Stay With You This Situation Has Been Addressed

column28: The Room Was Spotless And Lovely. I Would Have Liked A Shower Cap Having Long Hair. The Bathroom Was Nice And The Shower Wonderful
column37: The Staff Where Very Nice And Friendly. The Food Was Exceptional. We Will Definately Dine With You Again.
column46: The Barman (Sorry Forgot His Name But He Was Young With A Beard) - Was Very Friendly.
column50: The Bar Could Have Used Some Music On The Night Just To Add To The Ambience But It In No Way Detracted From Our Enjoyment.
column51: We Had A Wonderful Time Celebrating Our Anniversary And The Stay Was Perfect.

column28: I Would Have Liked Tea /Coffee Making Facilities Although We Did Receive Fresh Tea Very Quickly Upon Request

column24: Lovely Hotel  Food Was Fantastic As Was The Room And The Free Upgrade Was A Bonus :)
column28: Room 2 - Beautiful Views
column37: The Food Was Outstanding

column24: Had A Fabulous Stay  Thank You To All Of You! Just To Let You Know  I Forgot To Tell Reception That The Hair Drier Didn't Work. (It Wasn't A Problem As I Had Mine Anyway).

column37: Yum!
column46: Everyone Was Equally Friendly And Lovely.

column28: Given Upgrade To A Suite  Very Nice

column15: Also Driven Past And Viewed From The Train.
column28: Haughton- Very Large Living Area. Lovely Bathroom And Shower. Nice To Get Ready For The Day.
column46: An Ironing Board Delivered To The Room Immediately. Cream Tea Scones Delivered Still Warm. Deliscious :-)
column50: No
column51: We Love Staying At Exceptional Hotels And This Is One Of The Best.

column28: We Heard A Lot Of Road Noise In Our Room No 25 This Spoiled Our Nights Sleep
column37: We Were Sat Beside The Music Docking Station Which Was Placed On The Floor Beside Our Table  Which Made Conversation Difficult. The Dining Room Would Benefit From A Better Music System That Is Not Intrusive To Guests

column50: The Waitress Who Took Our Order For The Evening Menu Was Not Fully Appraised Of The Menu And Could Not Advise Fully On The Starters.  As A Result I Chose Something Not Entirely To My Taste.  That Said This Was A Small Issue And The Overall Quality Of The Meal Was Excellent.
column51: On Checking In We Were Offered A Free Room Upgrade  Which Was Most Welcome And Was An Excellent Start To Our Break.  Many Thanks.

column24: I Booked A Four Poster And Roll Top Bath. When We Arrived We Were Told We Had Been Given An Upgrade And Then We Were Shown To A Room Which Had A Double Bed And Normal Bathroom. I Explained Immediately What I'd Booked And We Were Given A Lovely Room After A Slight Wait
column28: The Bath Plug Was Missing Which I Reported. After Waiting 30Minutes I Got A Shower As We Had An Appointment To Attend. No One Did Contact Us About Our Missing Plug. Room 16. We Did Find It Hidden Behind A Pipe On The Bathroom Floor Too Late To Use The Bath Unfortunatly For Me.
column46: All Staff Were Very Nice. I Was Disappointed I Couldn't Take A Bath As I'd Been Looking Forward To It. Hence Booking A Particular Room.
column51: The Staff And Hotel Were Lovely. I Booked The Night Away For My Husbands Birthday And Was Disappointed The Facility's I Booked We Didn't Get To Use. You Don't Think To Check For A Bath Plug Till You Go To Run A Bath...

column46: Steve In The Bar And Charlotte In The Dinning  Please Refer To My Tripadvisor Review.

column28: No Bathrobe And Slippers
Large Room And Suite - Very Pleased
column50: Just So You Dont Forget (!) I Have Paid For A Copy Of The James Martin Slow Cook Book To Be Signed And Sent On To Me...
column51: It Is Sad That Such A Minor Matter Put A Damper On The Weekend  But I Had Ordered Your Box Of 'Hand Made Luxury Chocolates' For My Wife As It Was Our Anniversary (These Were On My Booking Form And Charged On My Receipt) - These Were Not In The Room On Arrival But When I Enquired A Box Was Duly Provided. As They Were Only Provided Just Before Dinner My Wife Did Not Open Them Until Our Return To Home - I Was Very Dissapointed To Find That This Was A Box Of Thorntons Chocolates That I Can Buy Myself For Â£5  Not The 'Luxury Hand Made Chocolate Experience' I Was Led To Believe And Paid For.. As I Say  Minor But Dissapointing None The Less.

column24: Fantastic Waiting Staff In The Restaurant Really Friendy
We Had A Fabulous Day But Sadly On Arrival We Were Not Acknowledged Or Welcomed By The Receptionist . Checking In Another Couple No Eye Contact Or ' I Will Be With You Shortly ' Etc Was Made.
column28: Lovely Penhaligons Toiletries But No Shower Gel. Asked At Reception But Nothing Available.
column37: Wonderful Ambience In Restaurant. Only Little Thing Not Offered Bread Before Dinner Although Other Tables Were. We Asked And It Was Rectified And A Sincere Apology Made

column51: Fantastic! Something Abit Special About This Hotel. Very Peaceful- You Will Be Seeing Again Soon

column24: We Received An Email Regarding Booking Our Evening Meal Time Within Minutes Of Booking The Hotel  Excellent Swift Service
column28: Room 2 Langdale. The Room Was Luxurious And Spacious And Cleaned To An Extremely High Standard
column37: Happy Friendly Cheerful Helpful Barman
column46: Whole Team Were Superb  Welldone.
column50: No.

column28: Tea And Coffee Facilities As You Have To Pay Tray Charge
column37: Excellent Staff At Dinner
column46: Evening Dining Room Staff And The Chef!
column50: No
column51: Excellent Hotel In Terms Of Quality And Service

column37: There Was A Young Man In The Restaraunt Who Looked After Our Table For The Evening  His Customer Service And Attitute Were Excellent  Very Friendly And Knowledgeable  He Even Suggested A Wine (Which Was Excellent) When The One We Ordered Had Run Out.
column50: Tea And Coffee Facilities In The Room Would Be Nice.  Snacks Behind The Bar Wouldnt Have Gone A Miss.

column37: There Was A Slight Mix Up With Our Dessert Order Which Took Nearly 45 Minutes To Arrive  However When The Mistake Was Realised By The Staff We Were Given An Apology And A Complimentary Glass Of Dessert Wine During The Last Part Of The Wait. We Understood Mistakes Happen At Times And The Way The Issue Was Handled When Apparent Was Very Professional And Sincere.
column46: The Young Man Serving The Bar Was Very Friendly And Also Informative On The Drinks Selection  Especially The Gins On Offer. However All Members Of Staff We Encountered During The Stay Were Friendly  Smart And Courteous.
column50: We Personally Would Have Preferred To Have Tea And Coffee Facilities In The Room Instead Of Having To Order Our Hot Drinks From Reception. This Is Simply For Convenience When We Fancy A Cup Either At Night Or Early Morning.
column51: Room 1 Was A Little Noisy From Footsteps And Creaks From Room Above And Also Flushed Toilet Or Sink Water From Above Room Could Be Heard Clearly And A Little Disturbing Whilst In The Room. Both Were Not A Huge Issue For Us During The Stay  But Would Like To Make You Aware Of The Points.

column28: The Remote Control Was Missing From Our Room And The Bathrobe From My Mother's Room  But These Were Brought Up To Us Soon After Calling Reception.  We Were Surprised Not To Have Tea/Coffeee Making Facilities. At The Time We Were Told That Any Tea/Coffee Ordered To The Room Was Complimentary But As Of This Week Is Â£3.50 Pp - This Would Have Impacted The Enjoyment Of My Mother's Stay.
column37: We Were Not Presented With The Wine List And Needed To Ask For It Having Already Eaten Our Starter.
column46: The Staff Were Extrememly Helpful And Went Above And Beyond When Looking After Our Dog  Even Walking Her Around The Grounds A Couple Of Times When We Had Dinner In The Restaurant And Looking After Her On Reception When We Ate Breakfast. This Made A Big Difference To Our Stay And Meant That My Mother In Particular Was Able To Relax Knowing That The Dog Was In Good Hands.

column24: We Thought The Setting Was Great. I Had Booked To Stay For My Wife's Birthday So The Complimentary Upgrade Was Fantastic. The Reason For Choosing The Hotel Was The Restaurant And We Were Not Disappointed By The Tasting Menu. We Had A Great Time  Thanks!
column28: We Thought The Fragrance Of The Body Lotion And Shower Gels Were Very Luxurious.
column37: Nice Ambiance With A Nice Arrangement Of Tables. Having A Good Space Around The Table Allows For A More Intimate Dinner.
column50: No  We Had A Great Time!

column24: The Room Was Fantastic And The Champagne Was Brought To Our Room Superbly Chilled. Excellent!
column51: This Was Our Second Visit And Can't Wait For The Next One!

column37: The Meal Was Lovely But We Both Felt That Towards The End Of Our Meal After The Main Course The Service Slacked Off. Rather Then Dealing With One Of Two Waitress/Waiters We Had Several And Felt That The 'Locals' Were Getting All The Attention And Service While We Felt Like We Was Just Left And Had To Keep Asking For Things Rather. This Will Not Stop Me Recommending This Hotel But I Just Thought You'd Like To Know. Also I Did Ask For A Birthday Messgae To But Put On His Dessert  Which Never Appeared Either ;O(
column46: Apart From Some Of The Staff In The Restaurant ;O( But Most Of The Staff Were Excellent.
column50: The Birthday Message For My Fiance.
column51: I Think I've Said Everthing And Again  I Would Like To Say That We Enjoyed Our Stay. Thank You ;O)

column24: The Staff Were Very Friendly And Helpful
column46: Everybody We Had Contact With Was Polite  Helpful And Professional.
column51: We Had A Very Enjoyable Stay And Look Forward To Returning.

column28: There Were 4 Of Us Staying As We Could Have Done With More Towels - Enough For 4 People.  Also  The Sofa Bed Was Not Really Appropriate For The Ages Of The Children In It - 9 And 12.  I Had Stated Their Ages At The Time Of Booking.
column37: The Food Was Great But The Service Was Quite Slow And We Felt A Little Forgotten In The Other Dining Room.
column46: The Manager Was Excellent  As Was The Man Working In The Bar.  The Woman On Reception On Friday And Saturday Evening Was Not Very Helpful Or Welcoming.
column50: I Enquired About The Free Champagne Offer Which We Had Seen Advertised On The Website But Was Told That It Only Applied To The Anniversary Offer.  This Is Not What It Said On The Website And I Don't Think This Was Well Handled.
column51: The Bill Was Not Accurate But Was Satisfactorily Resolved When We Raised It.

column24: Only A Small Thing We Had Email Confirmation Of A Non Road Room For Quiet.  And We Where Placed In Room 19.  We Came Home Shattered Because Of The Road Noise Stopping Us Sleeping Because All Windows Where Open Due To Hot Weather.
column28: Noisy  But What Can Be Done?  The Hotel Is On The Road.  One Small Thing  The Edge Of The Shower Screen Is Covered In Black Mould.  Otherwise It Was Spotless.
column37: Allergies Well Catered For And This Is Why We Have Recommended You To Other Friends With Allergies. They Have Now Stayed Also And Would Do So Again.  The Only Different Thing To Our Previous Stays Was The Flow Off Service And The Standard Of Food.  It Varied Considerably The 2Nd Evening And We Both Sent Dishes Back To Be Completed With All Ingredients. Plus The Halibut Was Swimming In What Felt Like Salt Water And Was Not What Was On My Menu The 2Nd Evening  Which Was A Shame As I Had Chosen It Again Because It Was So Excellent The 1St Evening.  The Chef Agreed And Apologised.  First Night Was Excellent As Always The 2Nd Not So  Chicken Was Bland And Lacked Something Of Flavour To Lift It As Did The Lamb. The Mustard Seeds Had No Flavour And It Was Sad To See Other Guests Expressing Their Disappointment In The Drawing Room.  Although All Agreed Staff Were Wonderful.  We Had To Ask For Cutlery On Both Evenings As Did Others.  Which Of Course Was Promptly Brought. The 2Nd Evening We Had To Ask For Cutlery For 3 Of The Dishes.  As I Say The Seamless Flow And Forward Thinking Was Missing On This Stay.  Considerable Wait For Drinks On One Evening Also.  It Seemed As If The Hotel Could Not Cope As Well With A Full House.
column46: Ali At Breakfast Is Excellent She Is Good At Noticing And Not Needing To Be Asked For Things Or Reminded. Friendly And Attentive.  An Excellent Member Of Staff.
column50: Just Little Things That Have Been Previously Mentioned.  Regain The Seamless Forward Thinking Flow That Staff Had In The 1St Half Of Your Opening Year.  Things Have Slipped A Little. We Noticed The Difference When Jeremy Was Absent.
column51: We Will Of Course Continue To Recommend And Stay With You And Hope That The Next Visit Will Be Back Up To Scratch As The Previous Visits Were.  The Staff Are Still Friendly But It Wasn't Quite As Professional As The Previous Stays And The Flow Was Missing Which Meant Asking Repeatedly For Things.  Drinks  Cutlery  Castle Howard Tickets (4 Separate Times) And Other Little Things Such As Quiet Room Requests Which Were Agreed By Email From The Hotel In May But Upon Allocation Not Done.  Most Things Where Rectified Of Course.  But Not Having To Ask Or Remind Was Always Part Of The Luxury Expected At The Talbot. I Sincerely Hope Our Comments Have Been Constructive. We Look Forward To Our Next Stay Being Back To Its Former Standard.

column46: During Our Dining The Staff Was Excellent

column28: It Was A Well Decorated Room  We Were Upgraded And Both Rooms Were Very Nice And Comfortable.
column37: The Monkfish Had Sold Out And Looking Back I'm Glad Because The Braised Beef Cheek Was The Best Thing I Have Ever Eaten! Second To None! The Staff Were Great And All Said We Had A Fantastic Time!
column46: The Girl Serving Us Our Evening Meal (Girlfriend Of The Chef) Was So Friendly And Attentive  Couldn't Have Been Better.
column50: We Were Unsure If The Tea & Coffee You Provided Would Be At A Cost Or Included In The Room. Hardly Worth A Mention.
column51: All I Can Say Is How Much We Enjoyed It  How Much We Have Recommended It  And How Much We Would Like To Come Again! Thanks A Lot!

column37: The Decor In The House Is Looking A Bit Fuddy Duddy And Needs A Bit Of A Revamp. The Dining Room Is Also Very Quiet And Lacking In Atmosphere. The Waiters And Waitresses Didn't Seem To Do Much In Terms Of Clearing Away Glasses From The Bar  Or Outside. We Sat Outside Until The Late Evening And The Champagne Bucket Was Still There At 10.30M The Next Morning. Breakfast Tables Weren't Cleared And Were Just Left. The Staff Just Seem To Huddle Together Either In The Bar And At The Lecturn In The Entrance Of The Dining Room Rather Than Using Their Iniative To Do Some Work!
column46: The Staff Weren't Particularly Friendly - Or Visible And It Took A Lot Of Hanging Around To Actually Get Someone To Take Notice Of You.
column50: The Building From Outside And The Grounds Was Stunning And Our Room (23) Was Lovely. However The Breakfast Was Very Disappointing And It Really Seemed Like The Staff Were Very Inexperienced And Not Really Enamoured About Their Jobs - Hence Not Being Attentive Or Clearing Away.
column51: It Was A Very Expensive Weekend And I Feel A Little Let Down By It. You Need To Work Harder At Greating A More Welcoming  Friendly Ambience

column37: Excellent Meal And Strong Service. I Use The Experience Of Dining At Swinton Park As The Benchmark Which Was Exceptional Service. The Talbot  Although Excellent Did Not Quite Match This Standard  Hence The Score Of '2'.
column46: Your Bar Manager Was Very Friendly As Was The Young Man Who Served Us In The Restaurant On The Evening Of The 11Th.
column50: For Your Hotel It Would Now Be About The Nuanced Additional Little Touches That Would Provide The Enhancements. The Room Facilities At The Woodlands At Sandsend And The Discrete But Very Attentive Service At Swinton Park Would Be Good To Consider And Emulate.
In The Restaurant Someone Pouring The Wine Would Have Been Nice  As The Food Being Such A High Standard I Kind Of Expected It.
column51: Overall A Very Pleasant Stay.

column24: When We First Arrived The Girl At The Desk Initially Ignored Us And Then Seemed Flustered When We Requested Her Attention. She Was Dealing With People Leaving But A Smile Would Have Been Appreciated! When We Returned Later To Check In She Was Very Friendly And Helpful.
column28: 20. We Would Have Preferred Tea And Coffee In Room. We Were Also Only Provided With One Toilet Roll And Ended Up Using Tissues. Also The Shower Head Needed Cleaning As The Hard Water Build Up Meant The Water Sprayed Out In All Directions Till I Wiped It Myself.

I Stayed In Room 8  Although The Room Was Nicely Decorated  It Was Quite Stuffy Due To The Hot Weather. It Would Have Been Good To Have A Fridge In The Room For Cold Drinks. I Also Found It Annoying The We Had To Request For Tea Or Coffee Rather Than Having The Facilities On The Room So That We Could Help Ourselves.
column50: Classed As A Luxury Four Star Hotel  I Felt That Certain Aspects Were Missing. As Previously Mentioned  Tea/Coffee Facilities  A Fridge In The Room. One May Have Expected A Gym Or Pool.

column28: The Rubber Seal On Shower Screen Was Coming Off. Room Should Have A Fridge. I Repeatedly Asked For The Window Lock To Be Taken Off So We Could Open The Sash Windows More Frequently But This Never Happened. The Room Should Have Air Conditioning Anyway At This Price Range.
column50: Newspapers Should Be Complimentary - Or If You're Going To Charge You Should Make This Clear When Offering. Breakfast Buffet Table Disappointing - I Wouldn't Eat This At Home Let Alone In A Hotel. (Juices Fine)

column15: Hotel Of Choice For The Wedding Party
column24: We Requested An Early Check-In  And Although The Room Was Not Ready When We Arrived  Were Kept Updated As To Progress. We Checked-In A Little Early  And Were Made To Feel Welcome And No Trouble.
column28: The Room Was A Bit Smelly When We Entered  But We Informed Reception And We Didn't Notice Any Smells When We Returned Later That Night.
column37: We Only Had Breakfast. We Were Keen To Have Dinner At The Hotel  But Did Not Have Time To Do So.
column46: The Receptionist When We Arrived (A Young Lady)  Was Particularly Helpful  Despite Having To Deal With A Few Guests Who Arrived At The Same Time.

column24: Very Helpful  Even Rang Back Prior To Our Visit To Inform Us Of An Extra Room Becoming Available For Our In Laws.
column37: It Made Our Stay To Have James Martin Come Out And Speak To Us During Service  A Lovely Touch.
column46: All Staff Seemed Genuine And Friendly.
column50: Nothing Was Missed From Our Service During Our 2 Night Stay.
column51: Keep Up The Good Work And Remain Guest Orientated.

column24: No
column28: Our Original Room (17) Was A Little Disappointing  But We Were Very Kindly Provided With A Free Ungrade To Room (25) Which My Wife Was Particularly Pleased About. That Said  Bath Robes And Slippers Were Missing From The Room And When We Ordered Coffee For Our Room  It Failed To Appear.  However  We Didn't Mention Anything As We Felt Very Lucky About The Upgraded Room.
column37: Many Thanks For A Lovely Visit.
column51: We Enjoyed Looking At The Walled Garden.
Service Can Be A Bit Slow  Especially At Breakfast Time.

column24: We Arrived For Lunch At 11.30  With A Midday Booking. We Were Left To Our Devices. It Would Have Been More Welcoming To Be Shown A Lounge Where We Could Sit. We Found The Bar. We Were Left To Carry Our Own Drinks To The Table. They Should Have Been Carried For Us.
column28: The Rooms Were Exceptional  And The Reason We Would Stay Again
column37: The Main Dining Room Was Booked For A Private Party So We Were Seated In The Atrium. This Was Unacceptable As We Were Celebrating A Special 60Th Birthday. When Booking We Had Specifically Asked To Be In The Main Restaurant . The Serving Staff Were Surly And Aggressive. They Seemed To Resent Bringing Water  Bread Rolls And So On And Had To Be Asked On Several Occasions. We Weren't Brought The Wine List Until Part Way Through The Meal. We Were Very Disappointed And Upset As The Wine Is An Important Part Of A Celebration Meal. We Wouldn't Plan Another Special Meal With You On The Basis Of This Experience.
column46: The Reception Staff Were Great  As Were The Staff Who Brought Tea And Coffee To Our Rooms. However  The Waiting Staff At Lunch Were Atrocious.
column50: Yes - The Service At Lunch Needs Serious Attention.
column51: We Would Stay With You Again On The Basis Of The Rooms  But Would Not Plan A Special Meal With You

column28: We Stayed In The Watson Suite  Room 12. It Was A Lovely Room  However We Didn't Have Any Coffee/Tea Making Facilities Provided In The Room.
column37: I Found The Bar Staff Very Knowledgeable And Friendly.
column46: Yes  The Young Man Behind The Bar. He Served Us Drinks And Also Offered Some Advice As To The Types Of Drinks You Offered. He Was Very Pleasant And Patient.
column51: It Would Be Nice To Have A Better Area To Sit Outside Rather Than The Two Tables Located Next To The Car Park. There Are Lovely Views Which Could Be Appreciated More With A Better Seating Area In Nice Weather.

column24: I Am On Holiday At The Moment But I Will Be Putting My Complaint In Writing When I Return.
column50: Yes
column51: I Will Put My Complaint In Writing When I Return Home. We Visited On 1St August We Made A Complaint That Night & We Left Early On The 2Nd Before Breakfast Because We Wanted To Stay No Longer. We Complained Fully To Reception As We Checked Out  We Were Told We Would Receive A Telephone Call But As To Date We Have Not.  I Will Be Contacting Travel Zoo For A Full Refund.

column28: Room 1 Disappointed With Wet Room Everything Wet Had To Dry  Floor And Toilet To Use Afterwards.
column46: All Staff Great And Very Accommodating With Our Dog.
column50: Just The Wet Room .
column51: Excellent All Round Great Staff Great Service.

column24: Restaurant Food Fantastic  But Service A Little Lacking.  Lots Of Apologising From The Staff To Various Diners And Service A Little Slow At The Bar

column28: I Would Have Preferred To Have Tea And Coffee Making Facilities In Our Room
column37: The Dining Chairs Are Rather Uncomfortable As I Could Not Get It Under The Table And So Had To Sit Forward All The Time. Proper Dining Chairs Would Be Much Better.

column24: My Partner  Along With The Assistance Of A Male Member Of Your Staff At The Door Carried The Luggage Into The Hotel Whilst I Followed On A Few Moments After Retrieving Something From Our Car.  My Partner Was Already At The Reception Desk  Which Was Attended By A Young Lady And A Young Man In A Waistcoat  Neither Member Of Staff Looked Up Or Acknowledged My Arrival With A Hello Or A Smile.  As We Had Arrived Early (1.30Pm)  We Were Advised That We Could Leave Our Luggage And  Return Later.  We Did This And When We Returned The Young Lady  Once I Initiated Conversation Was A Little More Friendly. I Think The Staff Overall Could Be A Little More 'Smiley' (Not In An Obsequious Way).
column28: Norton Room 27.  Lovely Large Room And Very Comfy Bed With Lovely Linen.  Not A Huge Issue  But The Curtain Pelmet Was Hanging Down.  Tea And Coffee Making Facilities Would Have Been Appreciated.
column37: The Food And Ingredients Used Were Of A Good Standard And Everything Tasted Delicious.  However  Being From Yorkshire When Your Menu Describes The Lamb Served With Pomme Purã©E  We Would Have Expected More Than Just A Stripe Of It Under The Lamb.  The Dessert Described As 'English Strawberries' (Plural) Was Also Disappointing In Being Just One Strawberry (Singular) With Some Sorbet.  The Staff Were Friendly  Especially The Two Young Ladies  However Once Again If Your Intention Is To Aim At Exceptional  Then More Emphasis Should Be Placed On Training Staff To 'See' The Little Things I.E. When Your Wine Glasses Need Topping Up Or Pouring Wine Correctly So That It Doesn't Drip Or Offering An Aperitif Or Wine Whilst Choosing Your Meal.  We Also Requested To Take Coffee In Your Bar Area Following The Meal And This Never Arrived  Despite Requesting The Bar Tender If He Would Mind Chasing This Up  In The End We Gave Up On It And Went To Our Room.  The Staff  Although Nice Young People Could Do With Looking A Little More Groomed And Not Have Shirts Hanging Out At The Back Or Biro Pens Stuck In Their Hair When Serving In A Restaurant.  The Atmosphere In The Restaurant Seemed A Little Quiet And People Seemed To Be Almost Whispering To One Another In Order Not To Be Overheard By Other Diners.  There Was Music Playing   Albeit Very Quietly And I Think It Could Just Do With A Bit More Atmosphere  Maybe More Muted Lighting.
column46: The Barman Was Very Pleasant.  Sorry Don't Know Her Name But The More 'Mature' Lady With Dark Hair And Glasses Serving Breakfast Was Very Nice And Welcoming.  The Staff Just Need To Smile More And Look Like They Actually Enjoy Their Work.
column50: Smiled More And Been A Little More Welcoming In All Areas!  Served More Adequate Portions Of Food In Line With The Menu Description.  Just A Little More Efficiency Generally Needed.
column51: The Grounds Were Lovely And The Cooked Breakfast Was Very Good.  Great Coffee!

column15: I Work At Cooper Mini In Malton
column50: No Not At All
column51: Just A Point I Would Like To Make  We Went Downstairs For A Drink Before We Went For Our Evening Meal Sadly It Was Somewhere Else  My Wife And I Ordered A Drink And Unfortunatly My Wifes Drink Was Spilt All Over Her By The Waitress It Was A Total Accident And She Was Clearly Very Upset By What Had Happened. My Wife Was Also Quite Upset As We Were Going Out The Hotel For A Meal And Then Drinks Afterwards Her Dress Was Clearly Damaged By The Coke All Over It And We Didnt Have Any Other Clothes Apart From This Everything Was Brilliant And We Will Come And Stay Again. Regards Dale Scott Brand Manager Cooper Mini Malton

column24: Hi  We Stayed At The Talbot Last Night. We Were Impressed With The Grandness Of The Hotel But Disappointed By A Cool Reception At Reception. We Asked If We Had A Nice Room As We Were There To Celebrate An Anniversary And Was Told 'Well You Will See In A Moment'. We Had A Room In The Road Which Was Very Noisey   As It Was Room 21 And We Were Celebrating 21 Years If Marriage Yesterday We Decided Not To Complain Or Be Moved  An Unfortunate Mistake On Our Part  We Were Both Wide Awake By Heavy Traffic Passing At 7 Am This Morning. The Room However Was Beautiful And Other Staff In The Bar And Restaurant Were Very Knowledgable ( With An Exception) And Very Eager To Be Attentive And Please  A Credit To The Establishment. We Had The Taster Menu In The Restaurant Which Was A Set Meal. I Would Advise That When There Is A Meat Course You Ask Your Guests How They Would Like Their Meat Cooking. We Wasn't Asked And When The Lamb Course Arrived It Was Practically Still Kicking. This Is Fine For Me As I Like My Meat On The Rare Side  It Was Infact Very Blue And Totally Put My Husband Off  He Couldn't Eat The Rest If His Meal Which Was A Shame As The Rest Was Beautiful. A Small But Easily Sorted Problem For Future Guests I Hope. Breakfast Was Delicious With The Same Attention To Detail So Thankyou. In Conclusion We Feel Disappointed That Such S Special Occasion Was Let Down By Small Issues (With The Exception Of The Lamb). I Wouldn't Usually Fill Out Feedback Requests But Felt You Would Find It Useful And Help Your Establishment Be Second To None And A Really Great Place To Stay. Many Thanks
column28: Romm 21. Beautifully Clean And Well Appointed Room  Lots If Hot Water And Double Shower Was A Plus. Road Noise A Real Issue.
column37: Lamb Was Raw  Guests Not Offered The Chance To Have Their Meat Cooked To Their Palate. Ruined The Rest If The Meal For My Husband.
column46: The Bar Tender Was Very Knowledgable On Drinks And Restaurant Staff Were Kind And Courteous At All Times. Reception Let The Hotel Down.
column50: Comments Already Made  Small But Significant To A First Class Service And Experience
column51: Beautiful Big Comfy Bed And Toiletries.

column24: Staff Very Friendly And Helpfully And We Like That They Offer To Carry Your Bags
column28: 24  We Were Upgraded And The Suite Was Amazing
column37: There Seem To Be A Lot Of Staff And We Were Asked The Same Questions By Different Staff There Didn't Seem To Be One Person Looking After Us  It Was Ok Just Would Have Been Nice Just To Have One Looking After You. Sometimes Its A Bit Quick To Take Your Plate Away And Move Onto The Next Dish
column46: The Young Man In The Bar Was Very Nice And All The Staff When Eating
column50: No We Were Very Well Looked After
column51: We Are Looking At Coming Back Next Year With Friends And Would Be Interested In Any Deals Offers Which May Be On

column28: I Think A Tea Tray Should Be Available In Room I Know You Can Order It But When You First Wake You Don't Want To Wait For A Cup Of Tea/ Coffee Room 5
column46: Not Sure Of He's Name But The Lovely Bar Manager I Assure If Not He Should Be Really Looked After Us With A Great Knowledge Of All The Drinks Fantastic Service
column50: Breakfast Was Lovely But 1St Mor I V On Our Full Talbot We Has One Mushroom Cup Think This Is Rather Poor The Tomato Was Bigger Why Not Give More Than 1 Mushroom After All For A Â£145. Night It's Pure Profit

column28: 1 Would Have Been Nice To Of Known About The Road Noise!

column37: The Service Was Very Professional  However  This Does Sometimes Get In The Way Of Friendlyness...Wouldnt Have Minded The Waiter/Waitress Passing The Time Of Day  Perhaps Slightly Stuffy To Say They Were So Young (Of Course  A Very Personal Opinion). Also  Perhaps Some Background Music And Subdued Lighting...Felt It A Bit Bright.
column50: The Overall Bill Was Accurate  However...I Aked The Barman If He Had A Bottle Of Pinot Grigio Rose For Dinner  He Did. There Was No Mention Of Cost And When I Got The Bill The Next Morning The Wine Was Â£34.99! A Little Steep For My Taste. Thought If Iy Had Of Been Mentioned Or Pointed Out On The Menu To Me I Wouldnt Have Chosen It. Many Thanks

column37: Sadly  We Didn't Receive Our Fudge With Coffee And We Only Realised The Next Morning .  Gutted As We Both Love It. The Meal Was Excellent  As Was The Service.

column28: My Partner Would Have Liked A Shower Cap In The Bathroom.
column50: No

column24: A Brief Overview Of The Hotel Would Have Been Helpful
column46: The Lady Who Checked Me In Was Very Professional.
column51: I Am Expecting To Be Contacted With View To Establishing A Business Rate. I Stay In Hotels Approximately 20 Nights Per Month And Would Be In The Malton Area Around 1 Night Per Week.

column16: Other: Tried 1St To Book Via Website But Didnt Complete
column24: Our Room Was Far Too Warm  And As A Result Quite Uncomfortable And Stuffy - Even With The Windows Opened (Which Do Not Open Far). Otherwise The Hotel And Staff Were Very Nice  But The Lack Of Aircon Or Adequate Room Ventilation Would Make Me Reconsider Booking Again Sadly.
column28: The Room (Apart From Being Too Warm) Was Good  But The Bathroom Had A Poor Windowsill Design With No Drainage  Meaning After A Shower The Water Just Sat There. (This Was Room 6)
column50: Better Ventilate/Cool The Rooms

column24: Gentleman Who Booked Us In Was Very Helpful Despite Our Room Not Being Ready
column37: Tables Nice & Spaced Out But A Slight Chilly Draft Came From The Window Where I Was Sat

column28: Room 22  I'm Sorry But The Heat In This Room Was Unbearable And Ruined A Very Nice Time At Your Hotel. We Rang Down And Asked For A Fan At 11.00Pm Ish And Were Told There Were None. We Ended Up Soaking Towels To Try And Cool Down And Even Considered Opening The Main Door To Try And Cool The Room. When We Spoke To The Lady On Reception In The Morning She Said And I Quote ' Yes We Really Must Get That Sorted'  Meaning She Knew There Was A Problem. Why Then If You Knew There Was A Problem You Put Us In That Room Or Why Wasn't There A Fan Already There.
column37: The Above Comments Are Aimed At The Evening Meal. Breakfast Was Not So Good  My Wife Ordered Smoked Salmon And Scrambled Egg On Toast  The First Plate Arrived With No Salmon  The Second Plate Arrived And The Toast Was Burnt  Not Just A Little Either It Was Black. We Asked For Another One And The Waitress Said 'Yes  Ok' And Walked Off Without Removing The Plate Of Food  The Third Plate Of Food Arrived And This Was Fine  I Find It Hard To Believe That A Chef Could Put Burnt Black Toast Down On A Plate Face Up So They Would See It And Then Cover It Thinking It Would Taste Ok ! On Leaving Breakfast There Was A Lady Who Had The Same And On The Side Of Her Plate Was Burnt Toast!!!
column46: I Would Like To Point Out The Lady On Reception That Morning (Saturday) When Challenged About The Room Being Fit For Purpose Said She Wasn't Authorised To Discount The Ron And That I Had To Ring You To Discuss Our Issue  I Pointed Out To Her That You Should Be Ringing Me And Made Sure She Had My Mobile Number  I Was Told You Would Contact Me When You Came In Later That Day  Obviously This Didn't Happen.
column50: I Think I Have Covered The Two Main Points  The Room Being The Major One.
column51: I Had Brought My Parents Up To The Talbot For The Night And On The Whole Had A Nice Time But Having Spent Approximately Â£500.00 I Expected A Better Level Service And Nights Sleep. I Would Appreciate A Call To Discuss This Further  My Mobile Is 07808060701

column24: The Hotel Temperature In All Public Areas And Rooms Was Increddibly Hot-We Had Our Window Open In Our Room Day And Night. There Was No Thermostat To Adjust The Temperature-We Were In Room 27 On The Third Floor. I Would Recommend Some Background Music In The Dining Room And Bar Areas As You Could Hear A Pin Drop In The Dining Room At Breakfast Time And Low Background Music Creates A Nice Ambience Where People Feel Comfortable To Talk Between Themselves.  On The First Evening We Ate In The Bar Area-The Menu Was Very Limited To 2 Startes And 2 Main Courses And 1 Desert. I Could Not Eat 3 Of The Dishes Due To The Contents And Been Pregnant. We Came For A Bar Meal At Lunchtime Last December 2012 And There Was Lots Of Choice And The Food Was Delicious  Hence Requesting To Return To The Talbot Hotel For Our Mini Break Prior To The Arrival Of Our First Child In December This Year. We Were Really Disappointed With The Selection Of Food Available In The Bar In The Evening And I Think The Hotel Is Really Missing A Treat With More Bistro/Informal Dining Which More People Want In Today's Busy World As Opposed To 3-5 Formal Courses In The Dining Room At Approx Â£50 Per Head. If You Would Like Any Further Information On Any Of My Points Raised Above-Please Don't Hesitate To Contact Me Direct On 07889 052534/Emmasykesno1@Gmail.Com As I Would Like To Help You Improve Your Customer Service As I Think With Some Slight Tweaks The Talbot Could Be An 'Amzing' Hotel If You Want It To Be.

column24: The Idea To Stay With You Was Because Of Groupon  However  We Decided To Book Direct After Seeing A Different Offer On The Website That Appealed More. A Booking Was Eventually Made Via Telephone But Would Have Been Much Easier If The Online Booking Worked Better. column28: Toiletries Were Not Replenished And After A Day Of Walking Had To Ask For Shampoo And Soap Etc Which Is Rather Poor. Situation Improved By Day 3.
column37: We Liked The Informality Of The Dining Room As We Have To Dine Out Formally A Lot With Our Jobs. We Thought The Food Was Excellent. In Terms Of Presentation  Some Of Menu Cards Were A Tad Scrappy And We Were Disappointed That The Wine Selection Was Not Available With The Menu Degustation  Which We Would Ordinarily Opt For In A Restaurant. Bar Presentation Could Be Improved  No Small Napkins When Serving Cocktails Or Nibbles Provided (But This May Not Be The Level You Are Aiming At); Martini Was Well Made.
column46: The Breakfast Lady  Sue Was Particularly Hard Working And Did A Good Job.
column50: Turn The Heating Down - It Was Far Too Hot And Stuffy. Probably Have A Kettle In The Rooms As It Is Such A Faff To Have To Call For It. For A Small Hotel You Might Want To Try And Up The Staff Training To Give An Exceptional Impression E.G. We Stayed For 4 Nights And No Member Of Staff Ever Referred To Me By Name And Did Not Even Learn The Room Numbers.  Staff Ought Not To Discuss Too Much Between Themselves In The Reception Area Or Corridor Especially Other Peoples Bills Etc. Clear The Hoover Away Off The Landing When Not In Use. Will Probably Aim For A Larger Room Next Time As There Was A Lot Of Noise Both From The Lorries On The Road And People Upstairs.
column51: Any Comments Provided Are Merely By Way Of Feedback. Overall We Had A Really Excellent Stay And The Staff Do A Good Job.

column28: Noise From Passing Traffic Wasn't Great Given The Cost Of The Room And The Fact It Was 'Superior'

column24: Another Fantastic Stay At The Talbot. The Reception Staff Are Always Very Courteous And Friendly. Have Recomended To Many Friends And Family And Will Definitely Be Returning Soon. Many Thanks
column28: Room 3 Is The Best Room We Have Had  Immaculate And Stylish In A Traditional Way.

column15: Used To Live In Malto 30 Years Ago  And Remembered It Being Wonderful

column37: Maybe A Childrens Menu.

column28: Room 6 Was Very Noisy With The Shower Next Door
column51: The Deal We Booked Wasn't Fully Honoured. We Were Charged For Tea/Coffee/Cake When The Website Says It Was Included

column28: Room 2 Langdale - Received A Complimentary Room Upgrade.  Truly Spoilt With This Room  Thank You So Much.
column51: Look Forward To Dining With You On Our Next Visit!

column50: Crisps Nuts And Olives Out On The Bar?

column24: We Had The Most Relaxing And Enjoyable Stay.  The Staff Were Helpful And Friendly.  We Thoroughly Enjoyed Our Stay And Meeting James Martin.
column28: It Was A Beautiful  Airy Room And One We Would Love To Stay In Again.  It Had A Separate Area For Our Teenage Daughter.
column37: It's The Best Food Eaten Out We Have Had In Months.  Limited Choice  But Beautifully Presented.
column46: They Were All So Good It Would Be Difficult  And Unfair  To Just Pick One.
column50: Nothing.  Was Perfect!
column51: Sambucca For The Bar (Would Be Great After The Meal).

column28: We Were Told To Call Reception If We Required Tea/Coffee As No Facilities In The Room.  I Tried To Call At Around 7Am But No Answer.  This Was Frustrating. Would Have To Bring My Own Travel Kettle Next Time.
column50: Tea/Coffee Tray In Room

column28: Room 16 - It May Be Slightly Old Hat However When We Stay In 5* Accommodation We Expect To See Robes!
column37: I Have Experienced A Number Of Quality Restaurants Over The Years And I Am Afraid We Were Not Completely Satisfied With The Food At The Talbot. Out Of The Six Dishes We Had Only One Was Of The Quality We Expect. The Others Ranging From A Chicken Starter That Was Unrecognisable To A Chocolate Dessert That Was Quite Frankly Hilarious In Its Content And A Cheeseboard That Was Dry And Unpalatable Spoilt The Occasion.
column50: If The Food Had Been Of The Quality We Expected I Would
column51: If The Food Had Been Of The Quality I Expected I Would Not Have Any Hesitation In Recommending The Talbot To Others However At This Point In Time I'm Afraid I Just Could Not Do So.

column24: No
column28: Disliked The Voile Curtains But Appreciate The Necessity For Privacy
column37: Spectacular Food

column46: I Would Say Each And Every Member Of You Team A Fabulous But Bar Staff Made Me Laugh
column51: Hope To See You Again Towards The End Of The Year I Have Never Left A Hotel With Tears In My Eyes  You All Have Made My Birthday So Special And I Now Love Salmon

column28: 1. I Had Room 12  Which Was A Long Way Away From The Main Body Of The Hotel.  Given That I Was Paying Â£265 A Night.  I Assume Lesser Rooms Don't Have A 'View'  Although Nor Did I. 2.  I Thought The Bathroom Was Well Appointed  But Perhaps Attention Be Paid To Dusting The Shower Head. 3.  I Do Not Think That The Price Should Compare With  Say Stapleford Park.  It Should Be Lower Given The Facilities On Offer.  Or Is This To Compare With The Feversham Arms?
column37: I Was Tempted To Switch Off The Music  As I Was Situated Next To The Speakers On Both Occasions.  It Doesn't Work Siting Them On The Floor.
column50: The Final Account Was Inaccurate.  Why Put The Hotel Guests Parking So Far Away?  What If It Had Been Raining?
column51: I Stay In A Lot Of Hotels  So Am Rarely Sad To Leave!  The Hotel Is Still New  So I Must Imagine There Is Bedding In To Be Had.

column24: Call Not Returned After Message Left.  Called A Few Days Later And Got Answer Phone Again But This Time Call Was Returned.  Better If A Person Answers Really.
column28: Dvd Player Would Be Good.  Tea Making Facilities In The Room.   Love The Decor - Really Suits The Hotel And Its History.
column37: Wine List Is Just A Bit Pricey.  Otherwise Excellent.  Also  The Lounge Needed Clearing Of Drinks And Cups Etc As We Took Coffee In There And It Needed Clearing.  Small Point But Better You Know.
column50: Shame The Bathroom Isn't Big Enough For A Double Ended Bath And Stand Alone Shower
column51: Fantastic Place.

column28: Tea/Coffee Facilities Would Have Been Nice
column37: Tea Light Holder Was Chipped

column51: The Final Bill Is Difficult To Reconcile.  We Would Also Suggest Requesting A Signature For Items Purchased.  On Returning Home We Noticed  'Lunch Purchases' Which We Did Not Recognise.

column24: Just A Couple Of Minor Points.  Firstly  Everyone Else Who Were Given Menus And Their Drinks In The Bar Were Given Nibbles  Apart From Us .... Hardly A Hanging Offence But Noticed!  Secondly Whilst Perusing The Menu We Heard Other Diners Selecting A 'Taster Menu' When We Asked About This Menu We Were Told We Couldn't Have This Because It Had Been A Special 'On-Line Offer'. We Felt This Was Very Strange As Perhaps Guests Might Like To Have The Option To Order This And Pay The Appropriate Supplement.
column28: Forgot To Mention When Checking Out That The Plug In The Washbasin In Room 18 Doesn't Function Correctly!!
column37: See Previous Comment.
column46: The Lady On Breakfast Duty This Morning 28.05.13 .....In My Opinion She Kept Her Eye On Everything Ensuring There Was Plenty Of Juice  Glasses Etc As Well As Keeping On Top Of The Ordering  Delivering And Clearing Away  A Real Credit To Your Organisation
column51: To Be Fair To The Talbot We Had Just Spent Time In The Yorkshire Wolds And Had Dined (Twice .... It Was So Good) At The Pipe And Glass (Between Driffield And Beverly) And I Honestly Believed The Talbot Would Be Better Than A 'Pub' ...... Sorry!!!!

column24: The Receptionist 'Poppy's Owner' Was Delightful & So Was Poppy.
column28: Why No Air-Conditioning? The Room Was Really Quite Warm Even After We Had Turned The Radiator & Towel Rail Off  Therefore A Restless Night. Could Have Done With Two Shower Gels  Plus A Shower Cap. Really Missed Having Tea & Coffee Making Facilities In The Room So That You Can Make Tea Or Coffee At Your Own Leisure & Not Have To Be Disturbed (I Know You Can Request It  But It's Just Easier To Make It Yourself). Also Missed Having A Safe In The Room. The Towels Are Amazing. The Room Spotlessly Clean & Free Bottled Water A Nice Touch. Loved Everything Else.
column37: Food Was Amazing. Service Was Charming  But Slightly Disorganised. The Style Of The Maitre D'/Restaurant Manager Was At Odds With The Rest Of The Staff  In That He Appears To Prefer A More Formal Style Rather Than The More Relaxed Presentation Displayed By The Rest Of The Team.
column46: The Barman (With The Beard) Was Friendly & Knowledgeable & Made An Excellent Espresso Martini. The Young Receptionist 'Poppy's Mum' Was Very Friendly & Helpful.
column51: Apart From Some Of The Few Comments Made  We Really Enjoyed Our Stay & Considering We Only Live A Few Miles Down The Road From The Talbot  We Definitely Will Be Staying Again  Or Look Forward To Coming For Dinner. We Have Already Recommended It To Our Friends.

column24: Check In Easy
column46: All Good.  Noticed The Bar Man But It Might Have Been The Beard That Was Exceptional Rather Than What He Did!  There Seemed To Be A Good Rapport Between Staff Which Added To The Positive Ambience
column50: No
column51: Was Pleased To Be Able To Stay Just One Night

column28: Room 4. I Would Have Loved A More Accessible Mirror In The Bathroom (Eg A Pull Out Shaving Mirror) As Short-Sighted And Struggled With Make-Up Without Glasses. Not A Big Issue  But Just Something I Noticed.
column37: Food Excellent. Friendly Service  Not 100% Slick (Eg Offered Bread Long After Diners Around Us  Who Had Arrived After Us) But Not Cause For Complaint Either.
column46: Young Man (Porter) At Reception  Whose Name I've Forgotten. Remembered We Didn't Take Milk With Coffee But Still Never Assumed We Wouldn't Want It  So Asked Each Time.
column50: Nothing
column51: We Were Very Pleasantly Surprised At The Free Room Upgrade - Certainly Meant Our Expectations Were Exceeded. Initial Concerns About Lack Of Coffee In Room Were Overturned Due To The Speed With Which Any Requested Coffee Appeared (Other Venues Could Learn From This).

column24: We Had Previously Visited And Discussed The Talbot As A Possible Venue For Our Wedding  And This Stay Was Supposed To Allow Us To Experience Things First Hand. You Can Imagine Our Disappointment At Being Told We Hadn't Got A Room Reservation And That We Had Been Booked Into An Alternative Hotel!
column46: Francesca Was Very Helpful And Eventually Sorted Out Our Booking Problem  But On Initial Arrival There Seemed To Be A Lot Of Staff Wandering Around With Little Direction. The Arrangements For The Jay Rayner Talk At 10Am In The Marquee Appeared To Be Badly Organised
column50: The Final Account Was Presented At A Price Â£30 Higher Than The Price Agreed At The Time Of Booking [Eventually Rectified]
column51: This Weekend Was Intended As Our Opportunity To Assess The Talbot As A Venue For Our Wedding In April 2014  But Given The Problems We Experienced [Notwithstanding That They Were All Eventually Rectified] And The Apparent Lack Of Organisation  We Are Now Not Sure What To Do

column37: Staff Were Excellent  And Were Obviously Will Trained.
column46: Sorry Can't Remember Names But The Two Gentlemen In The Bar Were Very Good. The One With The Beard Sorted Out Our Bottle Of Champagne And Made Sure It Was At Our Dinner Table With Us Even Having To Ask.

column28: The Only Thing That Did Upset Me Was The Toilet Seat It Had Snapped And Hadn't Been Replaced I Did Tell Reception The Answer Was It Happens All The Time!!!!!  Room 16
column37: The Food Was Amazing We Loved It.
column46: Apart From The Toilet Seat!!!!!!
column50: Not Really We Loved It.
column51: Carry On With The Good Work Well Done Guys Xx

After We Had Paid Our Bill And Left The Hotel We Noticed We Had Been Charged For Some Bar Items On Our Bill Which We Hadn't Had  We Called The Hotel When We Arrived Home And This Error Was Rectified Without Any Fuss And A Refund Made  We Also Received A Receipt And Apology Through The Post  Which Was A Nice Touch!

column15: Billboard At The Side Of The A64

column50: It Was Disappointing To Find That The Spa Treatments Were Just 'Over The Road' And Not Part Of The Hotel.

column50: I Did Ask For Sambucca To Have With My After Dinner Coffee But Unfortunatly You Did Not Dtock The Drink. I Did Settle On Another Drink Though
column51: Really Enjoyed My Stay An I Thougjt The Price Was Excellent For The Quality. Keep Up The Good Work

column37: The Dining Experience Was Very Disappointing. Whilst The Food Was Good It Lacked A Wow Factor. Which It Definitely Had When We Stayed Previously Also The Restaurent Lacked A Manager Presence Whilst The Service Was Okay It Lacked Speed And Silver Service ..
column46: The Porter Was Excellent So Patient And Attentive.. Several Times He Rose To The Challenge With Afternoon Tea. ..
column50: Again The Restaurant Experience For Dinner And Breakfast. In The Morning Could There Be Light Music Played When You Did It Changed The Atmosphere Within The Room .

column51: A Very Enjoyable Stay

column24: No One Avail At The Reception Desk - Kitchen Staff Most Efficient

column37: No
column51: Breakfast Was Decidedly Chilly - For Some Reason The Main Doors Were Always Being Propped Open

column4: Other: Looking To Move To The Area So Had To Stay At The Famous Talbot
column24: On Arrival I Had Expected Aporter To Help Me Out Of The Car With My Luggage  But Only The Receptionist Was At Her Desk.   There Was No Porter So I Had To Carry My Own Bags Up To My Room Through The Bar  Conservatory  And Up A Flight Of Stairs.  For A Hotel Of Your Calibre I Found This Quite Unacceptable.  I Rang Down For A Jug Of Milk One Morning But Was Unfortunately Brough Soyer Milk That Ruined My Coffee Totally.  I Like A Very Formal Approach In High Class Hotels  So Sir And Madam All The Time To Me Is Must From All Staff.  I Do Think The Changes To The Hotel To Be Quite Superb  And The Stonework On The Outside And Garden Landscaping Is Like Something Out Of Pride And Predjudice.  The New Vegetable Gardens Are Going To Be Wonderful.  More Tables And Chairs Outside Needed  It Would Make It Look Very Pretty.  Thank You So Much For Looking After Me So Well.  Louise Goodwin
column28: The Water Pressure From The Bath Shower Unit Was A Little Too Powerful!!  And I Was Surprised To See Open Wirework Leading From The Towel Rail Along The Wall Over The Door Down To The Radiator  Could This Not Have Been Boxed In Or Hidden  I Didn't Think It Was Legal In A Bathroom.  But I Thought The Bathroom Was A Lovely Room  Classic In Fact.
column37: I Think That The Dining Room Could Be A Little More Romantic  Lower Lighting  A Candle On The Table  A Fireplace With A Warm Fire Perhaps.  It Was Just A Little Too Bright For Me.
column46: The Manager And Lydia The Receptionist
column50: I Would  As A Garden Designer Myself  Have Made More Use Of The Seating Area Outside For A Cigar  Or A Smoke And Drink By Putting An Awning Over The Narrow Area Between The Dining Room And The Garden Wall  And A Garden Heater.  Sitting Outside At A Hotel Is An Absolute Must In My Personal Opinion.  Pretty Yellow Umbrellas Would Look Beautiful And More Large Urns And Tubs Of Pretty Flowers And Geraniums In Red.
column51: As Arnie Said 'I Will Be Back' !   Louise Goodwin

column24: The Receptionist Accommodated My Partners Injury By Giving Us A Room On The First Floor.

column51: A Lovely Hotel. Would Come Back For A Family Break If You Allow 8 And 11 Year Old Children In The Hotel.

column24: Reception Desk Could Do With A Sign To Show That It Is The Reception.  I Had To Ask.
column28: Room No 9.  Bed Ok For Comfort But I Do Like A Softer Mattress.  Shower In Bathroom Is Excellent - Best Shower I've Ever Had.  Mirrors Both In Bathroom And Bedroom Are A Bit Far Away For Applying Make-Up.  Perhaps You Could Provide A Small Free Standing Vanity Mirror In Bathroom Which Can Be Taken Into The Bedroom.
column37: The Only Reason I've Said Agree For 'Professional Service' Is That Our Dessert And Sorbet Courses Came Out In The Wrong Order.  We Weren't Bothered But The Staff Were  And They Apologized. The Service Was Very Good And The Food Was Excellent.
column50: It Was A Beautiful Day And There Were Only 2 Tables Outside On The Main Area  Which Were Taken.  We Had To Take Our Drinks Down To The Kitchen Garden Area.  This Was Still Nice But There Was Nowhere To Put Our Drinks.  More Tables Up Top Would Be A Good Idea And Also Umbrellas Over Tables To Provide Shade.You Need A Mixture To Cater For Sun And Shade Lovers.
column51: Good Choice Of Food At Breakfast And Those Prunes Are To Die For!

column24: I Did Speak To You After Our Stay.  Little Things Could Be Improved. Biscuits With Complimentary Tea. The Waitress Didn't Use A Different Knife For Each Cheese. We Felt Rushed At Dinner  Portion Sizes Could Have Been A Little More Generous.
column28: Our Room Was Small  Even Though It Was Only Â£20 Cheaper Than Much Larger Rooms.  I Was Late In Booking So That Was The Only Room Left.  Could Have Done With A Shower Cap In The Bathroom To Make The Most Of The Powerful Shower.
column37: As Mentioned Earlier  We Felt Rushed At Dinner  Waitress Should Have Used Different Knives To Cut Cheeses  Only One Helping Of Choc/Fudge As Only One Coffee Ordered - Seemed Mean. Even In Cheap Restaurants Everyone Gets A Mint!!

column28: Room 21  We Loved Our Room  Definitely One Of The Best We Have Stayed In  Bed Was Very Comfortable
column37: Excellent  Could Not Fault The Dining Experience
column46: We Ordered Coffee On Sunday Morning  It Arrived Very Quickly. The Bar Manager Was Efficient And Friendly And Made Us Feel At Home.
column51: Will Definitely Return

Sadly Our Lunch On Arrival≪ Bar Lunch Main Course Was Disappointing Plus There Were Problems With The Evening Bar Meal We Opted For  Didnt Have Dessert Due To Poor Choice (2). We Had Eaten There As We Had Spent Quite Some Time Trying To See What We Could Choose From The Restaurant Menu≪ All Three Of Us Finding It Very Difficult. It Seems There May Be Some Improvements Needed. We Understand The Hotel Hasnt Been Open Very Long Yet And That The Team Are Working Towards Attaining High Standards.
column51: We Liked The Town Of Malton And The Surrounding Area  People Were Very Friendly . We Liked Our Rooms And Facilities At The Hotel . We Are Likely To Return To Stay At The Talbot Again In The Future .
