column28: Due To The Location Of Room 10 It Is Unfortunate That The View From The Window  Is Of The Adjacent Building. We Appreciate That Nothing Can Be Done About This!
column37: We Both Thoroughly Enjoyed Each Meal Taken At The Hotel
column46: All Staff That We Came Into Contact With Were Extremely Professional  Friendly And Polite. We Felt That Our Needs Were Being Anticipated In Advance (Before We Actually Realised We Needed Something!)
column50: Nothing
column51: A Thoroughly Enjoyable Experience. A Well Needed Period Of Rest And Relaxation Folowing An Anxious Time Relating To Personal Health Issues. Thank You To Your Staff For Helping To 'Restore The Balance'!

column37: We Appreciate That A Lot Of The Staff Were Young And Clearly Learning But - 1. Whilst Pouring The Wine Some Was Spilt On The Glass And Formed A Pool On The Base. The Staff Apologised  But We Were Left To Mop It Up To Prevent It Dripping On Our Clothing Whilst Drinking. 2. Cheese And Biscuits Were Served To One Of Us  But Without Cutlery  And At The Time There Were No Staff In The Dining Room. One Of Us Had Finished Our Sweet Before We Were Able To Ask For A Knife. 3. We Had Coffees And Took It In The Drawing Room. We Wanted To Sit On One Of The Sofa's But Each Table Next To The Sofa's Were Full Of Dirty Pots  And Had To Clear A Place For Our Coffees Ourselves. The Staff Member Said He Would Get Someone To Clear The Table   But No One Appeared. 4. No Sweets/Fudge Was Served With The Coffee's  As Described On The Menu. These Points Are Fairly Minor  And Did Not Detract From Our Overall Experience. We Did Not Mention These At The Time Because We Did Not Feel It Necessary  But Have Pointed These Out To You For The Future Development Of Some Of Your Staff. Some Of The Longer Serving Members Of Staff Did Provide Excellent Service  And All Were Very Pleasant And Courteous.
column46: The Barman (Possibly Called Steve) Remembered Us From A Previous Visit And Was Very Welcoming. He Was Keen To Help And Assist.
column51: Although We Stayed  Our Parents Joined Us For Afternoon Tea  And They Brought Their Dog With Them. It Was Great That There Were Grounds They Could Stretch His Legs In  But It Was Noted By Them And Another Guest With A Dog Who Was Staying  That There Were No Dog Litter Bins.  Bins Would Hopefully Encourage Dog Owners To Clean Up After Their Dogs.

column28: Room 14 The Photos On The Website Do Not Do Justice To The Size Of The Room. It Exceeded Expectations In Every Respect.  The Bed Was Amazing And Everything About The Room Was Of A High Quality. It Certainly Had The Wow Factor - Plus The Quirkiness Of The Uneven Floors! Loved It.
column51: To Still Be Talking About The Hotel Over A Week Later Shows Just How Impressed We Were. The Complimentary Tea And Coffee Via Room Service Added A Lovely Luxurious Touch. Can't Wait To Visit Again.

column24: Upgraded Room Was Appreciated However We Would Have Paid For An Upgrade To A Quieter Room (Road Noise) Had One Been Available On The Offer  We Certainly Have Had Lovely Rooms In The Past. Dinner Was Exceptional However We Were Slightly Abandoned At Breakfast But We Were Late Down (9.15)
column28: Houghton  Lovely Room And Bathroom The Adjoining Sitting Room Is A Little Large To Suit The Purpose. We Would Certainly Request A Room At The Rear Of The Hotel As We Have Always Had Previously

column37: Both Myself And My Girlfriend Who Are Both Foodies Thought The Taster Menu Was Not Up To Standard. First Course Was Ok. The Halibut Was Overlooked And Dry. No Crispy Chicken Skin And The Broth Had No Chorizo And Smelt Of Mint. My Lamb Was Fine But My Girlfriends Was Sinewy And Most Of Hers Was Left. The Waitress Made No Comment About Her Plate Been Almost Untouched. Both Desserts Were Ok But Nothing Special.  We Both Thought The Waiting Staff Were Young And Someone More Senior Should Have Been On The Restaurant Floor Throughout The Service. The Wine Was Spilled When Poured At The Start Of The Meal  We Were Really Expecting Something Special But Found The Food And Service Lacking.

column46: Every Member Of Staff Had A Ready Smile And Were Very Approachable . Our Waitress For The Evening Meal Was Very Knowledgeable About The Menu And Looked After Us Very Well I Think Her Name Was Mani.
column50: What You Are Doing You Have Got It Right I Can't Find Anything To Criticise . Even Our Dog Got A First Class Welcome
column51: The Talbot Is A Special Little Gem It Oozes Quality And Combines This With Excellent Personal Service And Delicious Well Thought Out Menus.It Was A True Pleasure To Stay Here And We  Look Forward To Our Next Visit.  Thankyou

column24: Would Have Been Better To Be Tea And Coffee That We Ordered Were Complimentary
column46: Not Sure That Her Name Was  But We Had Had A Car Accident While Staying With You  And Had To Stay Later In Room  While Waiting For Hire Car- Very Helpful Receptionist.
column50: Just To Know That The Tea & Coffee Were Included  As We Would Order A Drink For When We Woke.

column28: The Shower Gels Etc Were Not Replaced For Second Evening Which Was Disappointing.
column37: We Ordered Wine With Our Meal But We Had To Prompt The Staff To Bring It.
column50: We Were Charged For A 3 Course Evening Meal When In Fact We Only Had 2 Courses. This Lacks Attention To Detail. This With The Toiletries Being Replaced Would Have Enhanced The Experience.

column15: I Was Born In Malton  But Now Live In Devon  Although My Parents Still Live In Malton  So I Visit Regularly
column24: During The Phone Call When I Was Booking My Stay  I Requested Confirmation Of My Booking Via Email  But Was Made To Feel This Was Not Part Of Your Normal Service. I Had Also Booked A Lunch Event For 14 People In The Wentworth Room. I Sent An Email To Conform Numbers For That Event About A Week Before Hand  But Got No Reply Or Thanks For Confirming. The Day Before The Event  I Got A Phone Call Asking Me To Confirm The Numbers!
column28: I Thought The Room Was Fantastic  Very Well Appointed  Comfortable. However  I Expected That This Was The Kind Of Hotel That Would Provide An Evening Turn-Down Service  Replenish Water Etc.
column37: I Think The Food Is Excellent
column50: I Apologise If This Sounds 'Snobby' In Any Way  But You Did Ask For Honest Feedback. I Expected Your Front Of House Staff To Be More Mature  More Experienced. They Were Pleasant  But I Would Not Say That I Felt I Was Been Looked After By The Level Of Personnel I Would Have Expected From A Hotel Like The Talbot. So Much Of What You Do (The Food  The Decor  Your Rates) Earns The Respect Of A Good Hotel; But The People Did Not Mirror That Image.
column51: I Was Disappointed That My Bill Was Incorrect. I Was Quoted Â£200/Night Including Breakfast And I Was Charged Â£225. Despite Noticing It When Paying  I Didn't Challenge It...It's Only Â£25 After All  But It Didn't Do My Faith In Your Attention To Detail / Accuracy Any Good.

column24: Room We Stayed In (22) I Think  Had A Severe Slope. This Was Not The Problem But The Fact That I Put A Glass Of Water On To The Beside Table And It Shot Off Due To The Slope Was! If It Had Been A Hot Cup Of Tea  That Could Have Been Nasty.
column28: See Previous Comment. In Addition The Windows Did Not Open Much At All And As The Weather Was Very Warm We Felt Rather Uncomfortable.
column37: The Food Was Very Average And With Small Portions. After Being Shown To The Table No One Asked Us If We Would Like A Drink.  When We Finally Asked For A Glass Of Wine  One Of Them Was Dirty And The Breakfast Menu Had A Large Orange Juice Stain All Over It! Not Great Really!
column50: See Previous Comments.
column51: Not Really.

column24: Might Be A Good Idea For A Note To Be Made On The Secret Escapes Website Re Booking In For An Evening Meal A While Before Trip So That There Is A Choice Of Times.
column37: We Had An Excellent Meal To Celebrate A 50Th Birthday And Had A Wonderful Time And Would Definitely Recommend It To Friends And Relatives.
column46: There Was A Bit Of A Problem When We Arrived As Although We Had Booked Two Rooms There Was Only One Available And The Hotel Was Full.  However The Lady On Reception Quickly Sought Advice And Arranged Fro The General Manger To Vacate His Room And The Duty Manager Arranged For Us To Have A Drink In The Bar.  Both The Receiptionist And Duty Manager Dealt With The Issue Which Was Quickly Rectified This Was Appreciated.

column37: Not Enough Staff Observing The Restaurant  3 Times We Had To Wait To Catch A Waitress To Ask For Drinks  Then Wait For Drinks To Be Served  You Really Should Be Asking If We Need/Want Drinks  It Must Be Where You Make A Lot Of Profit  And You Are Missing Out On Selling Opportunities By Simply Not Being Observant  Otherwise Excellent Stay  Thank You.
column46: The Gentleman Who Took Our Restaurant Order And Initial Drinks Order In The Bar  When My Daughter Wasn't A Particular Fan Of Her Initial Choice Of Wine  He Swapped It Immediately For Another Glass Having First Quizzed Her On Her Preferences  Excellent Service. Sorry I Do Not Know His Name But He Wore A Dark Suit.

column28: I Think The Pictures On The Website Showed The Room To Be Larger Than It Actually Was.
column37: All 4 Diners Thought That The Standard Of Desserts Didn't Quite Match The High Standards Of The Other Courses
column51: I Felt That The Dinner  Bed And Breakfast Package Was Very Good Value.

column50: No

column37: Starter And Main Was Good But 5 Selections Of Cheeses Of Which 3 Were Blue (Don;T Eat Blue Cheese) And 2 Were Goat? ... Not Very Original - I Suggest James Martin Visits Devon Hh Restaurant In Broadclyst And Sees How Cheese And Biscuits Should Be Served
column46: I Had To Find The Receptionist On Arrival And Don;T Like Having To Call Down For Hot Drinks

column28: There Was A Pair Of Nickers In The Drawer
column37: Even Better Than Last Time
column51: I Had Very High Expectations

column24: Your Receptionists Are Very Welcoming And Helpful.
column28: The Added Touches For Our Dog Were Brilliant  We Had Brought Her Cage But It Was Lovely To Have A Little Blanket Water Bowl And Feeding Bowl With Biscuits!! Really Made Her Feel Welcome And Special.
column37: The Food Was Stunning But We All Agreed That We Were Disappointed With The Desserts! We Had Had Such High Expectations Considering Desserts Are The James' Speciality Don't Get Me Wrong They Were Good But ....  The Food At Breakfast Was Also Exceptional  But We Had To Ask For More Toast As Only Got Half Slice Each And Then When It Was Delivered There Was No Butter And We Couldn't Get Any Ones Attention So Had To 'Acquire' Some Form A Nearby Table! So Possibly Waiting Staff Could Be A Little More Forward Thinking.
column46: Sadly I Didn't Get The Names Of The Girls On Reception But They Were Exceptional And A Real Credit To Your Team.
column50: Gorgeous Hotel In Gorgeous Grounds Wish We Could Have Had More Than One Night

Rather Trivial  But We Noticed That The Two Gentlemen Serving At The Bar And Taking Dinner Selections Were Wearing Dirty Shoes.  Although It Didn't Impact Upon The Overall Experience  Given The Outstanding Decor And Cleanliness At The Hotel  It Seemed Out Of Place Not To Have Polished Shoes! Everything Else Was Marvellous! Thank You.

column24: Communication Was Excellent. After My Online Booking For Dinner  Bed & Breakfast I Was Contacted Very Swiftly To Confirm My Preferred Time Of Dining.
column28: The Room Was Lovely And If This Would Have Been The First Room I Had Stayed In I Would Have Probably Marked It 1  But Having Stayed In The Nantwich Suite Before It Was Not Quite The Same. Still Excellent Value For Money Though.
column37: The Food Was Lovely And Well Presented. The Beef In Riggwelter Was Slightly Disappointing As It Was A Bit On The Bland Side. All Other Dishes Were Delightful
column46: I Really Would Not Like To Single Out Just The One As Everyone Was Very Friendly & Attentive.
column51: Even Though We Stayed Previously And Knew What To Expect  The Complimentary Glass Of Prosecco To Celebrate Our Wedding Anniversary Was A Nice Touch

column28: Wonderful Room (Number 16) Very Comfortable And Spacious
column37: Sometimes I Felt That The Staff Were Not In The Dining Room As Often As They Should Have Been Therefore We Were Left To Wait To Ask For Things Especially At Breakfast.
column46: They Were All Lovely
column51: Felt As Though There Was A Lot Of Chatting Between Staff And Not Paying Attention To Their Tasks - We Had To Ask For Extra Tea And Toast At Breakfast And Also Bread One Night At Dinner.  Also We Were Served On Two Mornings By Someone Who Had Obviously Just Been For A Cigarette Or Had Been With Someone Who Had Been Smoking.  I Dont Mean This To Sound Picky As We Really Enjoyed Our Stay The Staff Were All Really Lovely And Will Most Definately Be Coming Back But When You Ask For Feedback I Think We Should Try To Be Honest.

column24: May Sound Trivial But There Is No Actual Sign At The Reception Desk; After Driving Make Things As Esay As Possible For Your Guests
column28: Room 6 Although There Was Road Noise This Did Not Bother Us Too Much And I Thought The Room Was Lovely
column37: We Really Enjoyed The Food And The Waiters Were Very Friendly. Eating Out For Us A Pleasure And We Have Very High Expectations Having Some Excellent Retaurants Near Us At Home Not To Mentiom My Husband's Great Cooking! I Wouldnot Say  The  Service Was Poor  Indeed At Breakfast It Was Excellent  But There Were Little Things That Could Have Been Better. It Was A Hot Evening And There Were Not Enough Water Jugs So We Had Bottled Water  The Waitress Filled Up Our Wine Too Much   We Wanted It To Get Cool  In Fact The Ice In The Bucket Had Melted And We Had To Ask For It To Be Changed. I Would Say The Service Lacked That 'Polish' That We Experience At Local Hotels.  I Don't Know If Anyone Else Has Ever Commented But For Me The Chairs Were Terribly Uncomfortable.
column50: It Was Disappointing That There Ws Little Room Outside For A Drink In The Warm Weahter  We Stood For A While But Resorted To Going Back Outside Which Was A Shame
column51: For Us It Is The Sevice That Really Makes The Difference To A Place. The Food Was Outstanding And Excellent Value And If There Was A Little More Attention To Detail We May Be Tempted To Return As The Venue Is Delightlful And The Village Lovely. I Have A Very Stressful Job And Going Away To Be Waited On Is A Real Tonic For Us A A Couple; We Have Been To Hotels Where The Food Has Not Been As Good But The Being Made To Feel Completely Relaxed And Pampered A Bit Without Being Too Fussy Has Been Better Than The Talbot. I Am Sure The Hotel Will Continue To Thrive As It Has All The Basic Ingredients For A Weekend Break. The  Longe Is Very Nice And The Bar Areas Comfortable. We Alos Loke A Wasl Round The Garden Whicha Ia Am Sure You Have Plans To Extend.

column28: Room Too Warm And With Window Open Too Noisy
column37: Some Drinks Orders Were Forgotten And Had To Be Repeated Or Abandoned. Noise From Kitchen Or Food Prep Area Travels To Dining Room
column50: Bed For Son Could Have Been Made Up For Arrival. Fans Offered For High Temperatures.
column51: Staff Very Friendly.  Son And Dog Very Warmly Welcomed As Well As Adults Food Very Good.

column24: Staff Were Professional And Friendly We Were Made To Feel Welcome
column28: Room 4 - A Magnifying Make-Up/Shaving Mirror In The Bathroom Would Be Beneficial And Very Useful
column37: A Very Good Venue  Perfect Size To Feel Comfortable. Not Too Big So You Are Just A Number And Tables Spaced So You Don't Intrude On Other Diners.  Will Definitely Return And Recommend To Friends And Family.
column46: The Receptionist On Arrival And The Young Man Serving In The Bar
column50: No Everything Was Good
column51: I Am Looking Forward To Our Next Visit

column28: We Had Room 17 It Was To Hot And When We Opened The Windows It Was Like Sleeping At Brans Hatch Race Course With Cars Zooming Up And Down The Main Road Till 0200 Hrs Then It All Started At 0500 Hrs Again  It Was A Shame Because Reading Trip-Advisor They All Talk About The Same Problem !!
column37: Loved The Food  And With Living Only At Whitby We Will Come Again But Only For The Food  Shame Whitby Is Only 30 Minute Drive As My Wife Wanted Kippers For Breakfast  Guess What There Was None Ha Ha Ha We Could Of Brought Them With Us !!

column50: Give Me And My Wife A Nights Sleep.

column37: We Loved The Food But There Were Two  Dishes That Weren't As Refined As The Others. We Were Slightly Disappointed We Didnt Get The Same High Standard On All The Dishes For Example 2 Were Presentation And 1 We Had A Small Piece Of Plastic Food Packaging Left In. Also Dirty Cutlery .
column46: We Especially Thought The Barman Gave Us Friendly And Great Service.

column28: Beds Very Comfortable - Sprung Base Made The Beds More Comfortable Than Most Other Hotel Beds
column37: Food Was Good But Not Excellent.  Service Was Flexible But Always Friendly (Staff Holidays?).  Main Concern Was That The Menu Did Not Change At All  And As We Were There For 4 Nights  It Became Difficult To Choose.  Little Choice If One Does Not Like Fish.  And Ran Out Of Ingredients (Sweetbreads In Lamb Dish)
column46: Duty Manager (Sunday To Wednesday) - Always Willing To Go Out Of His Way To Please. Waitress With Lovely Smile Who Went Off Tuesday Night - She Really Cared And Was Quick.
column50: Restaurant Was Fine  Just Not Exceptional.  A Dynamic Menu With Seasonal Ingredients Would Make For An Improved Dining Experience.
column51: The Hotel Was Full And Busy  And Occasionally Service Was Not At Its Best.  But No Complaints  Simply Not 'Exceptional' And There Is Room For Improvement.  Ordinarily I Do Not Complete Such Questionnaires But Feel My Comments In This Instance Would Assist You To Achieve Excellence.  Good Luck And Thank You.

column24: I Rang And Left A Message About Wanting To Make A Reservation And Was Very Impressed How Quickly The Hotel Rang Back.
column28: It Was Really Warm When We Stayed So We Had To Open The Window. Traffic Noise Was Apparent From The Main Road From Early On. Other Than That Very Small Thing The Room Was Excellent.
column46: Oliver Was Very Attentive And Looked After Us Very Well.
column50: No. We Had A Lovely Time.

column24: I Had To Ring & Correct The Booking The Conformation Only Stated One Room When I Had Booked 2.

column50: Get The Small Details Correct Ie Extra Toast Etc I Felt That If It Was Not Written Down It Got Forgotten.
column51: It Was My 50Th Birthday & The Four Of Us Had A Great Time The Hotel Was Lovely Although Very Hot & Quiet Noisy In The Morning As We Had To Have Both Windows Open  But That Was Not Fault Of Hotel  Although Some Form Of Air Conditioning However Temporary May Have Helped.

column28: Road Noise  About Which You Can Do Little  Was A Tad Intrusive

column46: The Wi-Fi Was Not Working From Saturday Evening And Still Not Working When We Left Mid-Sunday Morning. On Saturday Evening The Problem  When Pointed Out  Was Rather Airily Dismissed As 'Weather Related'. Clearly This Cannot Have Been The Case As It Still Didn't Work On Sunday Morning. If It Had Been Checked Thoroughly On Saturday When It Was Pointed Out It Could Have Been Fixed Earlier
column50: Attended To The Wi-Fi Problem With More Professionalism
column51: No

column24: Our Welcome Could Not Have Been Any Nicer  We Were Welcomed Like Old Friends And Straightaway Felt At Home Again
column28: Nantclwyd Thank You So Much For Our Complimentary Upgrade To This Junior Suite. It Is Our Favourite Room In The Hotel And Is Was Lovely To Stay In It Again. The Room  Bathroom And The Views Are All Stunning.
column46: This Is A Difficult One As Everyone Is So Friendly And Helpful But We Particularly Enjoyed Our Chats With Craig Whilst He Was Out In The Garden Collecting The Veg For That Nights Dinner And Jeremy Who Came Out To Chat To Us Whilst We Were Enjoying An Evening Glass Of Wine Outside. But Once Again  Everyone Went Out Of Their Way To Make Our Stay A Memorable One. Thank You!
column50: We Were Sorry That The Thursday Supper Meal Deal Was Not On Because Of Yorkshire Day As We Have Been Meaning To Try This Out For Some Time. However The Complimentary Glass Of Rose English Sparkling Wine More Than Compensated For Our Slight Disappointment.
column51: As Always Are Stay At The Talbot Was More Than Fantastic And We Can't Wait To Visit Again. Many Thanks To All The Staff.

column24: After Being Server Our Afternoon Tea / Evening Meal The Staff Did Not Inquire If There Was Anything Else. This Was Not An Issue For Kate Or Myself Although I Did Hear A  Lady On A Different Table Complaining That She Had An Issue And Had Been Unable To Bring It To The Attention Of The Waitress Until After The Meal.  The Staff Were Excellent And It Seems Odd That They Did Not Carry Out The Usual 'Is Everything Alright With Your Meal' Check. As I Said  This Was Not An Issue In Any Way  Only An Observation.
column28: Room 17. The Sash Windows Was More Than A Little Tricky To Sort Out(You Could Tell That It Had Been Refurbish As They Normally Stick). Had To Juggle The Upper And Lower Sections As The Top Section Kept Dropping Down.

column50: I Do Not See How You Could Improve

column28: It Was A Very Hot Day . Air Conditioning Would Have Helped To Cool It Down As When Windows Wher Open The Noise From Traffic On Main Road Was Very Noisy
column37: We Waited A While To Be Seated . And There Didnt Appear To Be A Reason Why. The Seats Where Slightly Uncomfortable As They Where As Wide As The Tables I Couldnt Reach The Table Without Leaning Forward . Although The Food Was Excellent . The Time Between Each Course Was Slightly Rushed.
column51: I Wish You Well With Your Endeavours To Make The Talbot  A Perfect Experience. Its Nearly There.

However  The Absence Of Room Tea And Coffee Making Facilities Really Was A Very Noticeable Deficiency.The Extra Â£2.50 Tray Charge Shouldn't Be Necessary. Every Other 4/5 Star Hotel I Have Stayed In Offers This  Sometimes Even With Homemade Biscuits And Chocolates Included Which Is A Very Nice Touch  Eg: Amberley Castle Hotel & Ardanaiseig Hotel.
column37: The Service Was Really Excellent. The Menu Was Very Interesting And Beautifully Presented. Lower Lighting In The Restaurant And Candles On The Tables Would Make The Dining Experience A Bit More Intimate Than It Presently Is.

column51: Breakfast Was Good Although We Had To Move Our Table ( Next To The Entrance To The Kitchen) Across Ourselves So The Waiting Staff Didn't Brush Past The Back Of My Wifes' Chair When They Rushed Through A Narrow Gap. There Is Also A Loose Floorboard Near That Entrance That Rocked Our Table A Bit When The Staff Went By. Also   It Would Be Better If The Window Cleaners Did Their Stuff After The Breakfast Service Has Finished.

column37: We Cannot Speak Highly Enough Of Our Experience!  We Visited With Our 10 Year Old Son Who Was Very Delicately Offered An Alternative Menu Should He Desire One - Very Professionally Handled.  The 'Junior Menu' Wasn't Needed And The Three Of Us Enjoyed Two Nights Of Wonderful Food.  Our Son Was So Impressed With His Meals That He Now Has A Menu Signed By Your Kitchen Staff As A Memento Of Our Visit.  Our Only 'Negative' Comment Might Be That A Third Night's Stay Could Have Caused Difficulties If The Menu Continued Unchanged.  It Didn't Affect Us On This Visit - But It Might When We Come Back!
column46: All Of Them!  Great Attitude  Well Trained  Made Our Visit Memorable.
column51: We Went On To Stay At Another  Similarly Priced  Establishment.  Unfortunately It Did Not Come Anywhere Close To Repeating The Wonderful Experience We Had At The Talbot. Our Stay There Was Very Disappointing And We Have Moaned About It To Anyone Who Has Asked. We Won't Be Going Back!  However  We Have Sung The Talbot's Praises  Recommended It To Everybody  And Intend To Return.

column28: Watson Room 12: The Room Was Spacious With An Airy Feel And A Perfect View Of The Rear Garden Which Offered Tranquility  As Well As Far Reaching Views Over Malton To The Hills Beyond.  Furnished To A High Standard  With An Excellent Colour Scheme  Comfortable Seating And The Most Comfortable Hotel Bed We've Ever Slept In  This Room Offered The Relaxation We Craved  With Not The Remotest Noise Interference.   My Personal Favourite Aspect Was The Bathroom - Fittings  Layout Materials And Products  All Top Drawer.

column50: Ifeel You Were Short Staffed And We Were Not Looked After At All Well. We Have Staid With You 3 Times Before And Everything Has Been Excellent. This Time The Lady On Reception Forgot To Bring Drinks To Our Room-Bearing In Mind We Had Travelled For 3 Hours. Later My Husband Had To Go To The Bar For 2 Glasses Of Pproseco As There Was Nobody Attending To The Lounge. I Had To Ask For Olives And Nuts. The French Gentleman Made Me Feel Awful. I Asked Him To Take Our Order At 8.50  We Were Due To Sit Down At 9Pm. He Answered By Sarcasticly Saying 'Sorry I Thought I Had Another 10 Minutes. By Now I Felt Tearful. The Girls In The Dining Room Were Superb But I Had To Ask Them To Dim The Lights. There Were Wall Lights  Chandeliers And Candles. Restaurants Should Feel Romantic-But Thats Just My Opinion. One Minor Point  There Were No Cotton Wool Balls Or Buds In My Room. Had To Use Tissues To Clean Off My Make-Up.  These May Seem Petty Points But When You Pay A Bill Of About Â£270 For One Night You Expect Good Service Which We Have Had On Our Previuos Visits. Thankyou.

column24: Part Of Our Package Was To Have A Cream Tea.  On Arrival At Approximately 1.15Pm  The Receptionist Told Us That We Could Take The Cream Tea Anytime. On Expressing This To The Gentleman Without A Name Badge Behind The Bar  He Very Abruptly Told Me That I Had 'No Chance' As It Was Lunchtime. They Did Not Appear To Be Busy  But I Accepted That 'Tea' Is Not Normally Taken At 1.30Pm.  He Could Have Been Much Politer In Explaining That Tea Was Taken After 3Pm.  I Told Him We Would Return And Asked If Tea Could Be Taken Until 5.30Pm?  He Said I Could 'Take Tea Till Midnight As Far As He Was Concerned'.  I Thought This Was Odd As Surely This Would Be During Dinner And Seemed To Contradict His Earlier Reason For Not Wanting To Serve Tea During Lunchtime.  I Have To Admit That This Exchange Gave Me A Poor Impression Of The Staff.

column50: More Effort To Accommodate Travelers Needs
column51: A Hotel's Most Fundamental Purpose Is To Offer Rest And Refreshment Ie Hospitality. On Arrival (15:20) Having Travelled Some Distance To Attend An Evening Wedding Reception At The Talbot Our Party Were Looking Forward To Afternoon  Tea When I Enquired I Was Told By The Receptionist That The Wedding Ceremony (Which I Did Not Attend) Meant They Could Not Accommodate Us With Any Food At All!!! Having Not Eaten Since Breakfast We Were In Desperate Need Of At Least Tea/Coffee.  As There Is No Drinks Making Facility In The Rooms And As Directed By The Room Service Directory We Tried To Order Hit Drinks  Again Not Available!!! We Enquired After A Tea Room In Malton Upon Which We Were Given Voyage Can't Be Bothered Directions  We Wandered Around Malton And Eventually Found A Costa Coffee!!!. I Was Astounded To Find Myself In A Costs Coffee When I Was Resident In What You Describe In Your Website As A Luxury Hotel.  I Have Stayed At Other Hotels Where Drinks Making Facilities Are Not Available In Rooms (Usually A Sign Of Luxury And Superior Service) However I Have Never Ever Stayed In A Luxury (Even A Non Luxury Hotel) Where Food And Drink Are Not Available To Residents!!! Yes You Were Closed To The Public For The Wedding But If You Cannot Provide Facilities For Residents As Well As Host A Wedding I Think You Need To Rethink How You Promote Your Hotel And It's Facilities.  I Cannot Stress Enough How Not Being Able To Take Refreshment As A Resident Clouded My Whole Family Wedding Experience With You.  May I Recommend You Go Back To The Basics Of What Function A Hotel Is Supposed To Serve Before You Brand Yourself As Luxury.  I Have Declined To Have My Feedback Made Public Out Of Respect For My Family Who Chose To Hold Their Wedding Day With You.  I Couldn't Bear To Cloud Their Special Day With The Knowledge That Their Special Event Was Left Lacking By Your Poor Service.

column51: At Time Of Departure I Did Not Fully Check The Account As The Check Out Area Was Busy. On My Return Home The Charges Seemed Higher Than Expected  With A Charge Of 44.50 For Diner Wine. What We Had Was A Bottle Of French Red Which I Was Sure Was Â£20 In The Wine List And A Glass Of Prose Co. Could You Please Clarify If I Made An Error In The Wine I Chose. Booking Ref2631760  Invoice 15792  Departure 20/9. Thank You For Your Help In This Matter.

Included In The Price Quoted To Me When The Booking Was Made Was A Bottle Of Champagne. This Never Materialised Nor Was Alluded To At Any Stage Of Our 2 Nights' Stay At The Talbot. When I Jokingly Mentioned The Fact As I Was Settling The Bill  The Receptionist Did Not Offer The Slightest Apology But Confirmed That The Champagne Should Have Been Offered To Us At Some Stage Of Our Stay. I Would Have Thought That It Would Be A Nice Gesture And Good Pr Practice To Offer To Remove From Our Final Bill The Charge For The Two Glasses Of Champagne/Prosecco We Had Had With Our Dinner The Night Before. Alas This Did Not Happen. However  She Did Suggest She Could Give Us A Bottle To Take With Us On Our Journey  Which We Declined. A Very Small Thing  I Know  And I Only Mention It Because  I Assume  You Are Interested In As Much Feedback As Possible. Notwithstanding This 'Hiccup' Our Stay With You Was Most Enjoyable And We Are Hoping To Return. With Kind Regards  Magdalena Taylor

column16: Other: Not Sure Arranged By My Daughter
column24: My Husband Is A Very Plain Eater And Called Ahead To Ask If He Could Eat From The Bar Menu Rather Than Eat The Restauarant Menu Which He Knew Would Be Too Much For Him - However On The Evening We Were Told That Could Not Be Accommodated. - He Did Eat But It Was A Little Too Fancy For Him.  I However Was Thrilled By The Whole Experience
column37: See My Previous Comment About My Husband
column46: The Barman Steve Was Particularly Friendly But All Memebers Of Staff Were Attentive - They Are A Credit To You
column50: Perhaps Allow Someone With A Plainer Palate Be Able To Eat Comfortably

column28: Extremely Comfortable Bed And Pillows
column46: Waiting On Staff All Of Them Pleasant And Hardworking
column51: We Will Return And Has I Said In My Trip Advisor Review We Have Ate At 2 3 4 Rosette An Michelin Star Restaurants And The Food Was Up There With The Best. Well Done And Keep Up The Good Workð

column24: In Yorkshire Every One Was Friendly And Welcoming Apart From Your Reception Staff Who Would Rather Look At Their Computer As If We Were An Unwanted Interruption. There Was A Girl (Who Was Picked Up By Her Mother) Who Would Have Been Better Getting A Job As A Librarian.
column28: I Would Have Liked A Couple Of Hooks On The Back Of The Door To Hang My Suit Whilst I Was Dressing For Dinner. A Shoe Cleaning Kit In The Room Would Have Been Useful.
column37: Wonderful Food And Friendly Dining Room Staff Made Up To Some Extent For The Unfriendly Reception  However  We Had A Autumn Break Package And We Had To Ask For Every Single Item That Was Included In The Package. We Had To Ask For Drinks  Cakes  Cocktails  Olives And Nuts. (The Nuts Never Arrived). We Also Had To Ask Where To Go And Were Unsure What To Expect. All This Information Should Have Been Forthcoming From The Reception Staff.
column46: The Waitress Was Helpful And The Chef Picked Up Very Quickly That I Could Not Have Cream.
column50: We Were Charged For A News Paper That We Did Not Order And Drinks Which Should Have Been Included In The Package. This Was Resolved When We Complained.
column51: There Were Several Couples On Different Packages. I Can Only Assume This Was Confusing For The Staff.

column37: The Portions In The Evening Were Very Small And We Are Not Big Eaters   I Had To Ask For A Portion Of Potatoes   I Would Expect A Seperate Dish Of Veg And Potatoes To Be Served
column50: Look At The Size Of Your Portions Served At Dinner   If We Had Stayed Longer Than 2 Nights The Menu Was Not Big To Start With And Would Have Been Found To Be Repetitive.

column24: As Always I Cannot Fault The Service You And Your Staff Provide.
column46: Everyone I Spoke To Excelled. It Is Nice To Be Able To Say  They Were All As Good As Each Other
column50: Could You Build A Spa Please.
column51: We Came Down To Attend A Charity Ball At The Golf Club. The Talbot Hotel Graciously Offered A Prize For Auction. Needless To Say I Won The Auction An Will Now Be Visiting Again. The Voucher Entitles My Wife And I To One Nights Staff In A Suite With Breakfast And Dinner. Would It Be Possible To Take This Break When Mr James Martin Is Overseeing The Restaurant. He Is A Great Favourite Of My Wife. See You Again Soon. Kevin & Donna Wilson

column28: Booked Two Rooms And Both Fine - Though I Provide Health & Safety Audits Of Many Similar Premises And Would Probably Be Careful When Describing Route To Room 3 As Accessible (My Father Could Just Manage The Steps En-Route).
column46: Staff Involved With The Brough Scott Function In The Atrium Were Particularly Helpful...
column50: An Itinerary Of Hotel Events Linked To Book Fair Would Have Helped - While Not A Hotel Responsibility I Was Unable To Clarify If I Could Attend The Brough Scott Talk Until Very Close To The Actual Time.
column51: I Suppose I Should Also Say That The Hotel Should Provide For Disabled Car Park Near The Hotel Entrance... Not Always Available When I Was There With Parents.  I Will Be Back For The Malton Food Festival (Was There Earlier This Year) And Also Left My Card Reference Professional / Independent Health & Safety Or Fire Risk Services

column28: I Would Like Tea And Coffee Facilities In Room As Complimentary
column37: When Served Cheese My 3 Guests Had Finished Deserts Before I Received Biscuits For Cheese And That's Only Because My Husband Had To Get Up And Leave Restuarant To Find Someone   Also We Had Coffee And Treats   We Received 6 Small Sweets For 4 Of Us   I Feel We Should Have Received 8   2 Each As We Were All Being Polite In Who Had 2 Or 1   Same With Toast In Morning 4 Of Us And 6 Half Slices In Toast Rack   Small Points I Know But This Is What Will Set You Apart And What We Remember
column50: Yes You Had A Guest Speaker And His Pr Asked Us Could We Talk Quieter Outside Of The Room And This Was Embarrassing As We Were All In Nice Pleasant Conversation   Not At All Loud That's Why You Haven't Scored Excellent

column24: The Overall Stay Was Excellent And We Really Enjoyed It. The Food Could Not Be Faulted.  I Am Trying To Be Helpful Rather Than Complaining And The Following Things Would Have Made It Perfect:  Not Having To Ask For The Additional Items Which Were Included In The Autumn Getaway Package - These Should Have Been Offered To Us But We Had To Ask For Each Item And Were Then Billed For Dinner Separately Which Was Included In Our Package.  The Room Upgrade We Received Was Lovely And Much Appreciated But It Would Have Been Really Nice If Bathrobes Were Provided.
column50: Please See Previous Comments

column24: Everything From Arriving To Departing The Staff Were Excellent Nothing Was Too Much Trouble.
column28: We Were In Room 14 & It Was Exstreamly Hot   We Did Not Have The Heating On In The Room. This Is Not A Complaint Just An Observation .
column37: Looking Forward To Our Next Visit
column46: Steve Very Welcoming But Everyone Were Lovely

column24: No All Fine
column28: No All Very Good
column37: Service At Dinner Was Faultless However At Breakfast Table Staff Were Slow To Clear Plates Which Made It Quite Difficult Given The Size Of The Tables.
column50: Not Really Other Than The Failure To Clear Some Of The Breakfast Dishes Promptly And The Fact That We Waited Half An Hour For Tea To Be Delivered To The Room And Had To Chase It Up.
column51: Aside From The Two Comments On Service Above  Our Stay Was Absolutely First Class. The Room Was Well Appointed And Comfortable. It Was Also Well Designed To Have All The Things It Needed In The Right Places Plus A Very Comfortable Bed. The Food At Dinner Was Some Of The Best We Have Eaten And The Paired Wines Well Chosen. The Staff Were Exceptionally Friendly And Generally Highly Professional. So All In All A First Class Experience And One We Will Definitely Repeat.

column46: Sorry I Did Not Get Her Name But The Blonde Haired Lady Who Was On Reception About 4Pm On Thursday 24Th October 2013 Was Particularly Helpful Although All The Staff Were A Credit To The Hotel.

column51: Just A Big Thank You To All Staff At The Talbot Hotel. They Made The Whole Experience A Wonderful One. Hope To Return Soon.

column24: Our Experience Was Fantastic And We Had A Wonderful Time Thank You!!
column37: Tasting Menu Was Sublime!!
column51: Complimentary Upgrade Was A Lovely Surprise!!

column28: Stayed In Room 16 For 3 Nights. Room Was Not Serviced After 2Nd Night. People Upstairs Walked Like Elephants Making Light Fittings Jangle And Rattle
column37: Ate Two Nights. First Night Service Was Excellent. Second Night Was Terrible  Waiting Hours Between Courses  An Had To Pour Own Wine And Water
column46: Steve Behind Bar
column50: Better Room Service. Clean Room Each Day
column51: Stayed On James Martin Offer. James Martin Book Had Run Out  Offered Some Relish Book Instead. After Several Requests  Was Told James Martin Slow Cooking Book Was On Order And Would Be Sent On. Was Also Told By Reception That James Only Rarely Visited The Hotel. Given That Our Stay'offer' Was To Pus James Martin Latest Book  Slow Cooking  How Ironic That You Had No Books In For Our Stay.

column15: Never Stayed Before But Have Had Weekend Lunch X 2 Before
column37: The Meal Was Excellent.  Those Who Do Not Enjoy Fish Could Have Been Restricted A Little.  Two Of Our Party Of Were Celebrating 50Th Birthdays On 24/10/2013  We All Agreed That The Choice Of Venue Was Just Right.  The Food Was Lovely  Portions Left Us Feeling Full Yet Not 'Bloated'.  Generous Cheese Board Was Lovely!
column50: Without Wanting To Detract From The Positive Comments In Any Way At All  We All Thought That The Afternoon Tea Cakes Were The Weakest Part Of The Package By Far.  Less Volume But Better Quality Next Time Please!!
column51: Thank You All For A Fabulous Way To Start My 50Th Birthday Celebrations.  The Signed Book By Jm In The Bedroom Was A Thoughtful And Much Appreciated Touch.

column24: Staff Very Friendly And Attentive.  Really Good Welcome.
column28: Room 23.   The Bedroom And En-Suite Was Spotless. The Furnishing And Bed Linen Of Very High Quality And The Pillows Were Exceptionally Comfortable  Which Usually Is The Opposite In Most Hotels.   The Only Minor Negative Comment Would Be The Size Of The Tv Set  Which Was A Little Too Small For The Size Of The Bedroom.
column37: The Overall Dining Experience Was Absolutely Was Absolutely Wonderful.   The Wines Selected For Each Course Of The Taster Menu Were Exceptional And Complemented Each Course Absolutely To Perfection.   Great Overall Dining Experience !   The Only Negative Comment  -  The Restaurant Was Far Too Warm And Made It A Bit Uncomfortable Especially At Breakfast Time As At Dinner We Had A Window Opened Which Was Most Welcome.
column46: All The Staff Were Extremely Friendly And Polite  And Behaved In A Very Professional Manner.   It Is Very Difficult To Acknowledge Anyone In Particular  -  However The Two People That Come Straight To My Mind Would Be The General Manager  And The Young Porter Who Took Us To Our Room Upon Our Arrival.   Keep Up The Good Work It Makes Such A Difference To The Whole Experience Of Going Away !
column50: Honestly  Can't Think Of Anything.   All Was Really Great.
column51: Thank You Very Much For Making Our Little Treat Away Such A Wonderful And Memorable Experience.    We Can Honestly Say That It Was One Of The Best.  Keep Up The Good Work.             Big Thanks And Regards To All The Staff.

column24: Very Friendly Fuss Free Greeting And Booking In At Reception
column28: Room 21 Very Spacious Lovely Presented Room. Bed Was Huge And Very Comfortable A Lovely Nights Sleep. Shower Was Lovely Good Water Pressure.
column37: We Had A Fantastic Experience The 5 Course Taster Menu Was Excellent
column51: We Will Definitely Visit Again Had A Fantastic Stay.

column24: We Asked About Having Lunch In The Bar But Was Told It Was Very Busy And Were Directed To The New Malton As It's Also A Dog Friendly Establishment  It Was Great - Perfect For What We Needed And Got Us Out And About For A Little Stroll.
column28: Room 21 - All Was Fine  Lovely To See The Dog Bed And A Couple Of Bowls.  The Lighting In The Bathroom Failed In The Morning Though  Not That It Mattered To Us As We Were Packing Up To Leave.
column46: There Was A Young Lady With Dark Hair  Quite Tall  Didn't Catch Her Name  She Was In The Restaurant For Dinner And Again For Breakfast.  Very Bubbly And Charismatic  She Was A Breath Of Fresh Air.
column50: I Realise That We Could Request Tea And Coffee In The Room But We Didn't Like To Ask  We Do Like An Early Morning Black Coffee So In-Room Refreshments Would Be An Asset.
column51: No - All Good!

column37: We Had The Tasting Menu With The Recommended Wines  And It Was Definitely One Of The Best Meals I've Ever Eaten In A Restaurant  Including When I've Been Lucky Enough To Dine In Michelin Star Establishments Or Those With The Names Of Other Famous Chefs Above The Door.
column46: Yes  But Unfortunately I Don't Have Her Name. The Waitress Who Looked After Us At Dinner (8.00Pm On Saturday 26Th October)  Who Has Only Been With You A New Weeks And I Would Guess Is French  Was Very Warm  Welcoming And Knowledgeable While At The Same Time Being Unobtrusive. That's A Difficult Combination Of Skills To Pull Off.

column50: Rang On The Monday As Had Lost An Earring  Staff Were Very Helpful And Rang Me Back With An Update  Unfortunately Couldn't Find The Earring.

column24: We Were Advised That We Had Been Upgraded To A Suite  Shown To The Suite Which Was Lovely We Were Really Excited. We Received A Call Shortly After Saying Sorry We Have Made A Mistake We Have Assigned You The Incorrect Room. It Was A Shame But We Know Mistakes Are Made And We Found It Amusing.  Our New Room Was Lovely Though.
column28: I Ran A Bath But Unfortunately There Was Limited Hot Water So Could Only Stay In A Few Minutes
column37: The Food Was Exceptional  The Service Good But With A Little More Training It Could Be Exceptional  I Am Veggie And Received A Cauliflower Dish I Asked The Male Server To Describe The Dish He Said 'Cauliflower'.
column50: I Have Made Constructive Comments Which I Hope You Will Take On Board To Improve The Customers Experience Even More.

column28: Room 6. The Room Was Lovely And The Bed And Bedding Were Excellent. The Bathroom Was Too Small With The Shower In A Strange Place In Front Of A Window. The Sink Was Too High For My Husband And Myself And I Would Have Liked Face Cloths.

I Think That Two Bottles Of Each Product And Soap Should Be Provided In A Twin Room  Or Double For That Matter. There Was Also A China Box In The Cupboard Underneath The Sink That Was Slightly Dirty And Contained Only One Cotton Wool Ball. I Was Uncertain As To Whether It Should Have Been Full Of Cotton Wool Balls Or If It Was Something Removed From Sight Due To A Cotton Wool Shortage  Either Way It Served No Purpose.
column46: The Waiters And Waitresses In The Restaurant Were All Excellent.
column50: Whilst Ben Was A Superstar  I Do Feel That An Extra Hand At The Front Door Would Be More In Keeping With The Standard That I Was Expecting From Your Hotel. Ben Was Exceptional On Our Arrival  But There Was No One To Assist On Our Departure.
column51: Though Not On The Menu  I Requested Boiled Eggs For Breakfast. These Arrived And Were Beautifully Presented But Disappointingly Were Almost Like Jelly Inside  So I Put The Lids Back On And Said Nothing Since I Had Said That I Would Not Complain If They Were Not Cooked To My Liking  (Though I Appreciate That I Now Am!). Truly  It Was Fine And Not Worth Making A Fuss About Since I Had Lots Of Nice Toast And Coffee  However From A Feedback Point Of You For Your Hotel  It May Be Worth Either Giving Your Breakfast Chef More Training Or Declining Requests For Boiled Eggs In The Future.

column37: The Dining Chairs Are Uncomfortable

column28: Would Have Liked A Fridge In The Room.

column51: I Took Pippa For A Walk In The Gardens And 'Cleaned Up' After Her  But There Were No Bins To Dispose Of The Waste  So I Had To Walk Into Town To Find A Bin. column50: We Arrived Having Had A Long Drive From St Andrews And Were Very Much In Need Of A Drink. We Needed To Ask Twice More  And Yet It Still Took 40 Minutes To Arrive Which Was Not A Great First Impression.
column51: The Quality Of Both The Evening Meal And Breakfast Was Excellent. Delicious Fresh Food  Cooked And Presented Superbly. The Cakes Served At Tea Were Dry (With The Exception Of The Macaroons And Small Sponge Drops In Cases).

column50: At Breakfast My Husband Asked For Baked Beans With His Full English And We Were Told That He'd Doesn't Like Them' To Which My Husband Replied That The Chef Didn't Have To Eat Them  Just Cook Them. column42: I Worked From My Room  Rather Than Using A Meeting Room. We Were Also Served The Wrong Drink With One Of The Courses- Though This Was Picked Up Later By The Head Waiter/Sommelier Who Brought Us The Correct One To Sample!Having Said That  That We Thoroughly Enjoyed Our Evening And Would Love To Come Back!

column24: When Booking For A Stay It Would Be Easier If Dinner Bookings & Available Times Were Discussed Up Front. I Got To The End Of The Process To Be Informed I Couldn't Eat Before 9:30Pm. column28: At This Level Of Hotel I Expect Bathrobes And Nice Bathroom Products Befitting Of The Standard. To Be Honest The Products Were Nasty. Maybe Some Molton Brown Would Be In Keeping With The Overall Character Of Your Hotel And What You Are Aiming To Achieve?
column37: The Food On The Table Is Your Saving Grace But Your Dining Staff Need Training! Service Was Slow To The Point Of Embarrassment. Breakfast Service Was Particularly Bad  Inefficiently Slow  No Table Clearing  Our Cooked Breakfast Arrived To A Cluttered Table  That We Had To Reorganise For Your Staff! I Wanted To Take All The Staff To One Side And Point Out The Glaring Issues......Shame There Was No One On The Floor Doing Just That!
column46: Reception In Dealing With Laborious Emails In Getting Dates & Meals As Close As We Could. Your Barman Is An Engaging Character And We Enjoyed Rapport With Management Staff. column50: As Already Mentioned.....Bathroom Attention  Train Your Dining Staff.
column51: I Don't Wish To Sound Negative As  Overall  We Enjoyed Our Time With You. It Could Have Been Better And I Hope Constructive Criticism Is Welcomed And Acted Upon. column24: I Think The Reception Staff Could Take Their Work Up A Notch Through Some Simple Training. However False It May Be Or Appear  There Is Nothing Wrong With Reception Staff Telling Us They're Really Pleased To See Us Or Be Dealing With Us. I've Only Recently Noticed That To Make A Hotel Or Restaurant Special  The Guest/Customer Needs To Feel As Though They Have Stepped Out Of The Everyday World Into Something Approaching A Different World. The Element Of Acting In The 'Delighted To See You' Welcome Actually Achieves This Effect. The Talbot Is Not There Yet. The Lad Taking Us Up To The Room  However  Was Spot On  Ie  Getting Out Of The Room Fast So As Not To Make Us Feel That He Was Angling For A Tip. Nice Touch  Accidental Or Not.
column28: I Thought The Room Was Great. The Fixtures And Fittings  Going For Something Like An Edwardian Feel (Am I Right?) Were Well In Keeping With The Rest Of The Hotel  Which I Thought Was Great In Terms Of Furnishings In This Particular Historical Style. The Bathroom Was Fab  As Was The Bed. The Room Was One Of The Best Things About The Hotel - Very Impressive Work All Round. The Only Problem Was Being Woken Late At Night And Early In The Morning With Traffic Noise  The Road Being Right Outside The Window.
column46: Positively  The Lady With The Red Glasses And Chestnut Coloured Pony-Tail In The Dining Room When We Had Lunch On The Day Of Our Stay And Breakfast The Next Was Just The Sort Of Person I Like To Have Serving Me. She Was Informal But Not In A Bad Way. It's Notable That At Gordon Ramsay's Restaurant At Royal Hospital Road  His Three Michelin Star Establishment  Is Smart But Informal In Terms Of Atmosphere. I Thought That The Uniforms Of Those Waiting On Are Spot On: Smart And Professional Looking. However  The Younger Element Were Inclined To Be A Little Too Serious! The Red Glasses Lady Was Clearly Experienced  Which Is Great. Britain Is Plagued With Staff Who Are Too Young  Under-Paid And Under-Trained. I Was Very Pleased To See That The Talbot Is Making An Effort To Train The Staff 'Properly'. Overall The Staff Hit A Nice Balance Of Formal/Informal; It's Just That There's Room To Take It To An Even Higher Level.
column50: There's Always Something  Isn't There! Aside From The Comments Made Above  I'd Like To Comment On Lunch. After Jay Rayner's Outstanding Review Of James Martin's Outstanding Cooking At Dinner  We Were Eager To Eat Lunch. And While It Was Overall Very Good  I Have To Admit To Being A Little Underwhelmed With The Portion Size Of My Choices - Welsh Rarebit  Pot Chicken In Tarragon And Cream Sauce And Whisky Croissant Butter Pudding. This Was Especially In The Case Of The Pudding Where I Could Have Just About Put The Whole Lot In My Mouth In One Go! Whilst I Very Much Appreciate The Keenly Priced Menu  You Still Feel Sold A Little Short If There Doesn't Appear To Be Much On Your Plate. For The Record  The Rarebit Was Disappointing In Terms Of Flavour - The Cheese Was Much More Underpowered Than I'd Expected. That Said  It Still Tasted Good  As Did The Other Dishes. The Dessert Was Blindingly Good In Terms Of Taste. Again On The Positive Side  It Was Not Remotely The Case That My Wife's Portions Were Undersized - Not At All In Fact. The Parfait Should Have Had Twice The Amount Of Bread To Accompany It  But We Put That Right By Asking For More. The Waitress's Attitude Here Was Perfect.   One More Comment In 'Could Do Better' Mode. If You Want To Take The Bar 'Experience' Up A Notch  Put Some More Local Beers On Via Pump And Have A Wheat Beer On Tap Too. In Terms Of Decor  I'm Not Sure It Matches The Lounge  The Hallway And The Rooms. Two More! Coffee After Dinner. My Wife Ordered A Double Espresso And She Didn't Think Much Of The Flavour. We Like Our Coffee  Go To Italy A Fair Amount And Know What Good Coffee Tastes Like  And I Trust Her Palette. Surely  If The Talbot Is A Truly Aspirational Modern/Traditional Hotel It Should Serve Excellent Coffee All Round. My Cafetiere Was Fine  As It Was The Next Morning At Breakfast  But It Wasn't Exceptional. It Was As Good As It Needed To Be And No More. Three! Talking About Breakfast Reminds Me About The Toast. Why Is B And B And Hotel Toast So Mediocre?! Usually  It Comes Too Soon And It's Underdone. Here  It Came Too Soon And Half Of It Was Underdone! The Other Half Was Overdone!!!! How Can It Be So Difficult To Serve Toast That's Done To A Turn? Heaven Knows You Churn The Stuff Out Every Day - Can't You Get Your Machines On The Right Settings And Keep Them There? Honestly!
column51: Can I Now Comment On More Things I Liked? The Late Bar Was Great And My Cognac Delightful And At A Good Price. Indeed  The Range Of Spirits On Offer Was Impressive And Set Out Beautifully On The Menu. The Food Overall Was Really Good In Terms Of Flavour And Ingredients. My Fried Plate Was Lovely - Delicious Ingredients Well Cooked - And The Buffet Spread Impressive.   What I Most Enjoyed About The Hotel Was The Relaxed Feel To The Place  The Lounge With A Nice Range Of Sunday Papers And The Traditional 1900-20 Decor And Furniture. I'm A Staunch Labour Voter But I Didn't Feel Myself To Be In The Grip Of Complaisant  Pompous  Tory Yorkshire. Well Done  Those Responsible For Making Me Feel Like That!  Looking Forward To Returning Soon  Keep Up The Economy Offers!  Best Regards   Craig Thomas 19 The Hollins Holloway Derbyshire De45ba
