Cotton Wool Balls Not Replaced On Second Day. Would Have Preferred To Be Informed Room Facing The Main Road As Weather Very Hot And Unable To Leave Window Open Due To Noise.
column37: Evening Meal Excellent But As Mentioned On Our Departure Cheese Board Not Covered And Flies Present On Board. Breakfast The Second Day Excellent  On First Day Poached Egg Solid Mushroom And Bacon Over Cooked. However We Did Thoroughly Enjoy Our Stay. The Evening Meal Was Everything I Had Hoped For. ( A Work Of Art)
column46: The Young Lady Who We Met On Arrival Very Pleasant And Made Us Feel Very Welcome During Our Stay
column50: I Feel The Room We Were Given Was Expensive For Our Second Night Stay. The Offer For The First Night I Would Highly Recommend.
column51: Overall We Enjoyed Our Stay And Would Book Again But Feel The Price For The Room For Bed And Breakfast Only Very High Far More Expensive Than Other Similar Hotels In The Lake District

column28: Bathroom Was Brilliant.  Room Was Very Hot And Window Kept Closing Itself.
column37: After Eating In The Restaurant For 2 Nights We All Agreed It Would Be Difficult To Find Things To Eat For More Nights. We Discussed This At The Time And Said The Bar Meals Should Be Available For Longer Or The Restaurant Menu Should Change Daily  Even With A Couple Of Specials.
column50: Staff Were Very Good But Attention To Detail Was Sometimes Lacking.  Bringing Menus To Us In The Drawing Room Was Slow [20 Mins]  Also When We Ordered Afternoon Tea And They Brought Us Some Cake But No Napkins  Forks Or Plates.
column51: We Had A Really Nice Time At The Talbot And Would Return.

column37: My Only Minor Criticism Was Late Arrival Of Pre-Dinner Nuts/Olives With Drinks.Nuts And Olives Were Presented Just Prior To Being Ushered To Our Table.Would Have Liked More Time To Enjoy With Drinks.
column51: The Talbot Has Been Carefully And Tastefully Renovated And Compared With The Best Breaks We Have Enjoyed Through Secret Escapes.

column28: No Shower Cap Or Face Cloth
column50: More Staff On At Breakfast - We Sensed That They Were 'Rushed'

column24: We Were Very Late And Tired And Really Appreciated The Warm Welcome We Received
column28: Fitzwilliam: Bathrobes Would Have Been A Nice Addition To The Bathroom. Something Needs To Be Done To Make The Sitting Room Cosier As It Is So Small. The Wardrobe Knob Needs To Be Screwed In!
column37: It Was Just Perfect
column46: No  They Were All Kind Friendly And Helpful
column50: A Breakfast Menu In The Bedroom For Room Service
column51: Looking Forward To Coming Back

column50: Tickets To Castle Howard Were In The Package. They Were Not Offered At Checkout And We Forgot To Ask. As Both Of Us Have Visited Castle Howard Before It Was Not A Problem And We Visited Nunnington Hall Which Was Very Pleasurable. We Had A Splendid Stay At The Talbot Hotel. May I Suggest That The Tickets Are Offered Either At Check In Or Check Out.

column46: It Would Be Unfair To Select One Person As Everyone We Came Into Contact With Was Helpful Polite And Professional
column50: Would Have Been Nice To Meet James !
column51: We Had Such A Lovely Time We Intend To Return In October

column28: It Was A Very Warm Weekend And Needed A Fan Or Air Conditioning. The Sash Windows Only Opened A Few Inches.
column37: Again It Was Very Warm
column46: All Of The Restaurant Staff Were Excellent

column24: All The Staff Were Very Helpful And Courteous

column15: Visit To Malton By My Wife

column24: Regarding This Specific Question  I Made This Booking For A Special Occasion.  I Am An Experienced & Relatively Frequent Traveller And Have Used Many Hotels Of Different 'Levels'/Ratings Etc.  There Seemed An Overall Atmosphere Of Coolness Or Lack Of Genuine Warmth Or Helpfulness From Most Of The Staff So  Sadly  I Would Assume This Emanates From The Management.
column28: Towels/Facecloths Left In The Bath Were Not Renewed But Re-Hung.
column46: Although We Did Not Use The Bar (We Were Travelling With An Elderly Lady) The Bar Staff Seemed Generally More 'Receptive' Simply With Their Eye Contact And Pleasant And Open Approach As We Walked Through Their 'Area' To Or From Our Room.
column50: There Is Little Point Completing A Survey If It Is Not Frank So My Comments Are Considered And Honest And I Would Not Mind Discussing. There Is Little Point Completing A Survey If It Is Not Frank So My Comments Are Considered And Honest And I Would Not Mind Discussing. The Main ÂEnhancementâ Could Be Staff Behaviour. Communicating Skills And Warmth Seemed To Me Lacking And I Am Not Difficult To Please.  Despite Being A Very Busy Person I Frequently Take The Time (Even Without It Being Part Of A Survey) To Write In To Express My Appreciation  To Praise Service And Particular Members Of Staff And  More Rarely  To Complain. On This Occasion There Was Nothing Outstanding And I Genuinely Felt That  Whilst There Might Be Total Commitment To The 'Job'  There Was A General Lack Of Spark Or Care To The Clients. No-One Was Impolite And I Can Honestly Say I Prefer Not To Have The Greetings That Trip Off The Tongue  But Something Was Definitely Missing!
column51: We Were Intending To Eat In The Hotel But Were Disappointed With The Offer Of The Single Vegetarian Option Of Butternut Squash Rissotto That (Even Though This Was Probably Superb) Is A Dish That Many Restaurants Offer!  We Dined Out At The New Malton Which Was Highly Recommended To Us And Had The Choice Of Three Unique  Imaginative & Well Prepared Meals.  Between Us We Sampled Them All Over The Two Nights And They Were Simply Stunning In Presentation And Taste.  Additionally We Were Offered Something Specially Prepared If The Menu Was Not To Our Liking And We Gave A Little Notice.  There Was No Need As Each Meal Was Gorgeous.

column24: Staff Exceedingly Helpful And Friendly
column28: Loved The Accommodation And The Coffee On Tap
column37: We Thought The Food Was Superb And The Staff Welcoming And Friendly.
column51: We Look Forward To Returning And So Hope We Will Be Advised Of Any Special Offers As We Love The Surrounding Area As Well

column28: A Poor Room Having No Views At All
column37: The Food And Restaurant Were Very Good But Nothing Wowed Me
column50: A View Of Some Sort From The Room

column37: We Were Served By Luke Who Was Friendly And Very Professional. Our Only Disappointment Was The Breakfast Where The Eggs Were Overcooked - Both Scrambled And Poached.
column46: Luke Who Was Friendly And Professional

column28: The Floor In Room 15 Slopes. This Results In The Furniture Surfaces Which Are Highly Polished Sloping Also! Glasses Etc Want To Slide Off And In Fact We 'Lost' A Glass Of Champagne That Way. Would Be Good To Have Drinks Mats And/Or A Warning Regarding This! Also Quite Noisy From Fans From Kitchen ? With Having To Keep Windows Open Due To Hot Night Time Temperatures.
column37: The Reason For Our Visit And Its Connection To James Martin. Had A Lovely Pre Meal Stroll Around The Lower Level Veg Garden And Grounds. Bumped Into A Chef Harvesting Herbs Etc And Enjoyed Pleasant Chat.
column46: Chef We Met In The Garden - Young  Large  Tattoo  No Hair !!!!!! Very Friendly Took Time To Chat.
column50: Meet James Martin ! Let Us Know If He Will Be At The Talbot Anytime Please.

column24: I Notified The Hotel When I Booked Ahead That I Was Vegetarian.  I Reminded Reception Of This When We Arrived On The Afternoon Of Our Stay.  However  There Was No Vegetarian Option Available As A Starter And Only One Dish On Offer As A Main Course. There Had Been No Communication Between Booking / Reception And The Kitchen
column37: See Previous Comments Regarding Booking.  Very Mixed Feelings About Our Whole Experience At The Talbot. My Evening Was Spoiled By A Lack Of Communication Between Reception And The Kitchen So There Was No Vegetarian Option Available On The Menu As A Starter And I Felt I Was Offered A Very A Very Hasty And Not Very Imaginative Alternative.  There Was One Vegetarian Option As A Main Course - And I Have To Say  This Was Outstanding  As Was My Partner's Main Course.  The Restaurant Staff Were All Very Pleasant  But Not Very Efficient Or Informed.  Service Was Incredibly Slow And We Tried To Order Wine With Our Meal Twice But Nothing Ever Arrived.

column24: We Had Requested A Room On The 1St Floor But Were Allocated A Room On The Ground Floor With Disabled Facilities.  We Were Very Disappointed But On Again Asking Your Reception Staff For A Room On The 1St Floor  We Were Told All The Rooms Had Been Allocated.  Had It Not Been For The Courteous And Efficient Intervention Of Dominique Ghislain  Our W.E. Would Have Been Ruined.  Miraculously He Arranged For Us To Stay In The Houghton Suite.  Thank You Again Dominique.
column28: Houghton Suite - Okay But Have Stayed In More Luxurious Hotel Rooms In The Uk And Overseas  Ie. Bermuda.
column37: Over Rated And Reliant On James Martin's Reputation.  Big Let Down That Steak Was Only On The Lunch Menu.  Heard Lots Of Comments In The Restaurant Re Waiting Time Between Courses And Coffee And Liqueurs Being Forgotten.  Also  Breakfast Selection  Eg. Fresh Fruit. Etc  Could Have Been Presented Better Than It Was.  Always Appeared If Staff Were Present But On An Ad Hoc Basis As To Who Does What.
column46: Dominique Ghislain - Brilliant People Skills. The Young Uni Guy (Dan?) Also Has Good People Skills.
column50: We Trusted The Hotel To Meet Our Reservation Request.  These Few Days Away Were Important To Us As An Escape From Personal Stressful Times For My Husband And Myself.  We Arrived At The Hotel Only To Stress Again.
column51: We Also Experienced Poor Afternoon Tea Service In The Drawing Room.  Tea Promptly Delivered  Along With 1 Breakfast Size Jam  Butter Straight From The Fridge And Clotted Cream.  20 Mins Passed W/O Scones Arriving........Told There Were Quite A Few 'Checks' Awaiting Afternoon Tea.  After Second Enquiry As To Arrival Of Scones........Butter Had Melted By Now.......Told Our Order Had Been Lost!  Finally  Our Scones Arrived After A Wait Of Approx. 45 Mins.  It Was Obvious The Scones Had Come Straight From The Oven And Despite The Butter Now Being Soft Enough To Spread  The Scones Just Fell Apart Into Crumbs.  Told We Wouldn't Have To Pay!

column50: Tea Facilities In The Room

column24: Hotel Appeared Deserted Initially. No Staff Evident In Reception Bar Or Dining Area
column37: Service Appeared A Little Slow On The Saturday Night-Probably Due To High Number Of Diners.
column50: Tea/Coffee Facilities Provided As A Matter Of Course Rather Than By Request.
Tea And Coffee Facilities  In The Room Please Requested Tea On The Monday Evening Non Was Delivered
column51: Thefinal Bill Was Inaccurate   This Was Amended Without Any Fuss Which Was Appreciated

column24: I Was Pleased With The Overall Appearance And Experience. Particularly Pleased With Room As When I Telephoned Your Member Of Staff Recommended An Upgrade
column37: Both Myself And My Husband Choose Different Items On The Menu And All Were Presented Well And The Flavours Were Wounderful
column46: All The Staff Were Attentive Polite In Just The Right Way Without Being Over Attentive The Balance Was Just Right
column50: Really Enjoyed Stay If We Could Have Got Cover For My Care Commitments I Would Have Loved To Stay Longer. I Really Cant Think How Your Team Could Have Done Anymore Than They Did

column28: Room 18.   Only One Of Each Product In The Bathroom  Therfore We Had To Share The Meagre Shower Gel.
column46: The Night Porter On Duty 2Nd August  Was Helpful And Tried To Deal With My Complaint.  ( See End Comments)
column50: During The Night / Early Hours Of 2Nd August I Had To Ring The Night Porter To Complain About The Noise From The Room Above. The Occupants Were Arguing And Causing A Disturbance Which Not Only Woke Me But Prevented Me Sleeping Between 1.30 And 4.00 Am. The Porter Investigated And Rang Me Back To Confirm The Noise Was Unacceptable And Would Leave A Note To Reception Staff To Offer Us A Discount.  He Also Rang The Offending Room  Which Eventually Became  Quieter. See Further Comments Section.
column51: On Checking Out  Reception Was Very Busy Due To The Impending Wedding Taking Place. We Reminded The Receptionist Of The Porters Note Of Which She Was Aware. However The Manager Could Not Be Found To Sanction A Discount And Aware Of The Queue At Checkout We Paid The Bill In Full On The Understanding That The Manager Would Ring Me On Monday 5Th August To Offer Us A Reduction For The Disturbance We Encounted. However Sadly No One Rang  Which Is Disappointing.

column24: I Wanted To Use The Travelzoo Voucher But Only On A Specific Day So I Checked Availability First. The Person I Spoke To Was Extremely Helpful And Made A Provisional Booking In Order To Allow Me To Obtain The Voucher
column28: Room 14. The Room Was Very Hot When We Arrived. Reception Said They Would Try To Fond A Spare Fan  But Presumably Couldn't  And By Night Time It Had Cooled Down A Lot.
column37: We Came Specifically For The Tasting Menu  And Were Thrilled. Interesting Mixtures Of Food All Presented As Works Of Art. The Only Thing We Couldn't Face Was The Chocolate At The End!
column46: All Excellent - Particularly One Of Our Waitresses - Didn't Note Her Name But She Had Fancy Nail Varnish With Bows On. Very Friendly And Made Us Feel Very Welcome.
column50: No. We Had Wanted To Go Somewhere Out Of The Ordinary For Our 35Th Wedding Anniversary  And We Had A Wonderful Time.
column51: The Only Reason I Put 'Maybe' Earlier In This Survey For A Future Visit Is Price - Without The Travelzoo Offer It Would Have Been Outside Our Range. But We Feel Very Lucky To Have Been Able To Stay With You - A Beautiful Hotel With Well Appointed Rooms And Excellent Food And Drink  And Lovely Grounds Too. Please Tell The Chef How Much We Enjoyed Our Meal.

column50: No  Not Really We Both Really Enjoyed Our 2 Nights At The Talbot
column51: Thank You To All Staff For Making My Birthday A Memorable One  Everybody Was Very Friendly And Helpful.

column15: Had Lunch In The Restaurant And Loved It
column46: Clare On Reception Was Really Helpful And Took Us To View Another Room Before Making A Booking Ready For Our Next Stay At The Talbot In November.
column51: Would Not Be Returning If We Hadn`T Loved Our Time At The Talbot.  A Really Unwinding And Relaxing Place To Stay.

column24: Very Helpful Staff. Hotel Decor And Ambience Immediately Relaxing. Very Tastefully Done And In Keeping With The Building
column28: Fitzwilliam Suite - Fabulous Suite  Extremely Comfortable. My Only Comment Would Be That The Hairdryer Was Difficult To Use Since You Have To Hold The Button Down In Order For It To Work And I Have A Weakness In My Joints. Also It Would Be A Nice Touch To Have Bathrobes. However These Are Not Complaints Purely Comments - We Loved The Suite.
column37: Wonderful Food And Service  Staff Very Friendly And Helpful.  Would Definitely Recommend
column46: I Can Honestly Say That All The Staff Should Receive An Acknowledgment As They Were All Excellent!
column50: See Previous Comments
column51: Every Part Of Our Visit Was Excellent And Fantastic Value For Money. Many Thanks  We Will Return - Hopefully Soon!

column24: Staff Very Helpful
column28: 14 Room Was Very Hot And Airless(Not A Particularly Hot Day) Staff Did Provide A Fan On Request.
column37: Very Enjoyable. Portion Sizes Were Adequate At Best. Looking Forward To Yorkshire Cheeses So A Little Disappointed To Be Served Isle Of Wight Blue (Though Delicious) Staff Did Not Know All Of The Cheeses
column46: All Good
column50: We Will Return And Look Forward To Seeing How The Restoration Of The Hotel Develops.

column24: It Was Not Obvious That The Lady Sitting In The Alcove Was Reception.  Perhaps A Sign On The Desk?
column28: There Was No Tea/Coffee Presented.
column37: The Waiting Staff Were Very Professional  Would Converse Intelligently  And Were Unpretentious
column46: All Equally Good
column50: A Map Of The Town In The Room
column51: Although It Was An Effort To Get To The Top Floor A Lift Would Spoil The Hotel. The Restoration Work Was Well Done With No Expense Spared.  The Character Was Retained And The Usual Noises From Old Buildings (Eg Plumbing) Are Not There.  It Was Very Quiet.  The En Suite Is Most Impressive With Its Marble.

column24: We Had Booked A Weekend P Ackage With Dinner Both Nights. I Was Very Pleased That The Hotel Contacted Me In Advance Of Our Stay To Confirm Our Dinner Reservations.
column37: There Was A Tendency For Waiting Staff To Forget To Clear The Table. On The First Night We Had To Remind Staff That We Would Like To Order Wine With Dinner - The Wine For The Starter Course Arrived When We'd Almost Finished The Starter. On The Second Evening Staff Again Came To Take The Food Order Before Asking About Wine - Because Of Our First Night Experience We Pushed To Make The Wine Order First.

column28: The Room Was Uncomfortably Warm.  Additionally  As Much As Tea And Coffee Was Available By Calling Reception  Facilities In The Room Would Have Been Most Welcome.  We Also Missed The Provision Of A Fridge Which Would Have Invaluable To Cool The Bottled Water.
column50: See The Comments In The Room Section.  Bar Prices Were Extorsionate Which Perhaps Reflected The Few People Using The Facility.
column51: Lovely Hotel And Superb Food But Has A Way To Go To Reach The Expectations Of A 4 Plus Star Hotel.

column46: Claire Was Very Helpful

column24: Computer System Down When We First Called. Took Longer Than Expected For It To Function So We Had To Wait For A Considerable Time For A Call Back.
column28: Would Have Appreciated Tea And Coffee Making Facilities
column50: Suggestions For Short Strolls From The Hotel.

column24: Disappointingly  I Was Not Made Aware Of 'The First Anniversary Offer' When I Booked. This Only Came To Light When  On My Return Home  I Recommended Your Hotel To Friends Who Subsequently Booked Straight Away. These Friends Were Informed Of The Offer Which Apparently Has Existed From 1St April To 31St August. This Has Marred What Was Otherwise A Memorable Experience To The Point Where I Feel Reluctant To Return Or Give Further Recommendations To Friends.
column28: Too Hot For The Time Of Year And A Window Wouldn't Open Fully.
column37: Highly Recommended.
column46: Disappointing That No Member Of Staff Mentioned 'The Offer' Even When We Ordered A Single Cup Of Tea For Which We Were Charged.
column50: No
column51: The Questionnaire Has Been Difficult To Complete Since My Views Have Been Affected Retrospectively By The 'Offer' Not Being Available To Me. Why Was This??

column4: Other: Travelzoo Offer And For A Treat And Trial Experience
column24: No
column28: The Only Negative Was Traffic Noise Which Started Early The Following Morning  But I Am A Light Sleeper!
column37: I Would Definitely Like To Dine There Again!
column46: No One In Particular - They Were All Good.
The Barman Who I Believe Is A Student In Liverpool. Enjoyed His Conversation & Knowledge Of Drinks Really Appreciated The Attention & Complimentry Drink Offered By The Manager
column50: Not Really. Had A Really Enjoyable & Memorable Stay
column51: Our Promotional Deal Was Excellent Value For Money & Our Accomodation Was Excellent The Evening Meal Was More Limited And Complex Than Expected. Presentation Was Excellent But If I Was A Younger Man Would Have Still Felt Hungry At The End Of The Evening

column24: Efficient  Professional And Friendly.
column37: The Food Was Very Good Indeed. Beautifully Presented And Well Cooked.
column50: No  It Was Very Good All Round.
column51: Just To Say That We Enjoyed Our Stay Very Much. We Will Return And Are Interested In Special Offers And Events. We Have Been Added To Your Mailing List For This Purpose.

column4: Other: Part Of Our 30Th Wedding Anniversary Celebrations!
column28: Room 12. There Were Three Of Us Booked In The Room But We Only Had Two Sets Of Towels And 1 Toilet Roll. We Had To Call Reception After Midnight For Extra Toilet Paper!
column46: All Your Team Members Deserve A Mention.
column51: It Was Lovely To Sit At The Tables Outside For A Drink But We Felt That There Should Have Been More Seating Area Outside.

column24: No It Was All Fine
column28: It Would Have Been Nice To Have Had Tea/Coffee Making Facilities In The Room. I Tried To Ring Down To Reception And Order 2 Teas But I Couldn't Get Through. The Receptionist Was Obviously Busy So  We Had To Do Without.
column37: None. It Was Excellent. The Food Was 1St Class - So Tasty.
column46: The Girl On Reception When We Arrived Was Lovely. The Room Wasnt Quite Ready Because We Were A Little Early. We Were Happy To Have A Walk Into Malton To Fill In The Time. When We Arrived Back  She Escorted Us Up To The Room Herself And She Had Already Taken Our Suitcase Up. She Was Really Friendly.
column50: Just The Tea/Coffee As Mentioned.
column51: Lovely Hotel  Lovely Staff. A Little Pricey For Us To Stay Unless You Have An Offer On. I Would Appreciate It If You Could Let Me Know If There Are Ever Any Offers On Similar To The One We Enjoyed With Travelzoo For Â£199 For A Night's Stay And Taster Menu/Champagne.

column50: I Would Like To Have Seen A Proper Terrace/Patio Area For The Hotel Instead Of The Couple Of Tables At The Front Of The Hotel Which Seemed To Be The Only Area Where You Could Sit Perhaps And Have A Drink. This Was A Shame As There Were Ample Gardens But They Were Not Cultivated. As We Have Had Such A Fabulous Summer I Feel This Is An Opportunity Missed To Be Able To Enjoy The Outside Space.

column28: 12 Everything Excellent - Would Be Even More So If Tissues And Disposable Shower Hats Were Provided - As The Shower Is Not Adjustable Being Overhead And Ladies Would Not Want To Spoil Their Hair Dos!! - But It Was Great To Relax In The Bath As The Alternative
column51: Excellent Visit - Thank You

column24: The Receptionist Was A Liitle Fraught When I Called To Make The Reservation As Her Computer Had Crashed Or Something. When She Called Back All Was Fine!
column37: Would Recommend It  Especially The Wine Served With Each Course. We Did Comment At The Time About The Strawberry Course Which Was Ridiculously Small  And The Wine With That Course  In Our Opinion  Was Too Sweet.
column46: The Gentleman Who Is The General Manager Was Welcoming  Convivial  And Appreciative Of Feedback. Also Our Waitress On Sunday Night Tall  Slender And Dark Haired  Who Was Working Again On Monday Morning For Her Friendly And Pleasant Manner.
column50: I Have To Mention That My Breakfast Fried Egg Was Poor And The Bacon Overcooked. When I Cooked Breakfast In Our Pub I Would Not Have Sent Out Such An Egg. The Egg Obviously Was Not Fresh  And As A Result Was Flat And Overcooked On The Underneath Including Half Of The Yolk. Find A Supplier Of Really Fresh Eggs That Will Stand Up For Themselves! Preferably Free Range. Then Your Cook Might Have A Chance Of Producing A Good Fried Egg.
column51: It Was Really Refreshing To Find A Hotel That Sells An Excellent Pint Of Real Ale  Which Was Obviously Well Looked After.

An Excellent Hotel With Friendly  And Efficient  Staff Who Are Knowledgeable And Professional Without Being Stuffy Or Pompous. (This Is Not Always The Case In High Quality Hotels.) The Food Was Excellent - We Had The Tasting Menu - Finest Ingredients Beautifully Cooked And Presented. We Really Like The Complimentary Tea And Coffee. What A Great Way To Treat Guests. Our Thanks To All The Staff.

column28: Bedroom Was Good Size But Found Bathroom Rather Small
column37: My Wife Had Some Temporary Dietary Restrictions But This Was Managed Very Professionally By Both Maã®Tre De And Chef And She Was Very Satisfied With The Food Delivered.
column46: See Notes Made For Question 15
column50: Next Time I Will Ask For A Room With A Bigger Bathroom
column51: Excellent Service From All Staff  We Both Had A Very Comfortable Stay And Good Food

column28: Room 16. The Absence Of Tea/Coffee Making Facilities Was Inconvenient  Especially  When An Accustomed To An Early Morning Hot Drink On Waking.
column50: Provide Tea/Coffee In The Bedroom.

column28: Our Room Was Noisy At Night Due To Proximity To The Road - I Would Not Choose This Particular Room Again

column24: Both The Staff That I Spoke To Regarding Our Booking Were Very Pleasant & Efficient.
column28: Being Able To Ring Down For Fresh Tea & Coffee Was A Lovely Touch.
column37: The Food Was Delicious. If I Had To Make A Recommendation  It Would Be To Include More 'Exciting' Fruit In The Fresh Fruit Salad At Breakfast.
column46: As We Were Staying For 2 Nights  We Asked If We Could Eat From The Al A Carte Menu On The 2Nd Evening. The Gentleman From Management Who Attended To Our Request Was Very Pleasant & Professional.

column28: The Room Was Way Too Hot And I Had To Ask For A Fan. I Would Have Preferred To Open The Window To Let Air In But There Was Too Much Traffic Noise.
column50: Ask If There Are Any Special Requirements When Booking - Would Have Chosen A Room Away From Traffic Noise

column28: Tea And Coffee Making Facilities  Dressing Gowns And Shower Cap Could Be Provided. We Were There 6 Nights The Room Was Not Dusted During Our Stay  Damp Towels Were Not Replaced. We Had To Request Replacement Shower Gell Etc  Pre-Booked Early Morning Tea Arrived 20 Minutes Later Than Requested And Phone To Reception Not Answered.
column37: We Dined On 17Th And 22Nd The Menu Was The Same. If We Had Dined Every Night Of Our Stay Would It Have Been The Same Every Night? On The Thursday Evening The Taster Menu Was Not Available  Celeriac Under Cooked.
column51: Although Very Professional And Courteous The Staff Did Not Recognise Us Even Though We Were There 6 Nights. No One Was Friendly Or Tried To Make Conversation Or Remembered Our Room Number.

column24: The Wedding Was Wonderful! The Staff Were Very Helpful! The Hotel Was All That We We Expected  If You Maintain This Standard You Will Be Very Successful! Thankyou To All At The Talbot!! Julie Dilnot ( Brides Mother)
column28: Bought On Suit! It Was Excellent For The Wedding  Perfect As You Could Self Contain The Bride And Bridesmaids Before The Wedding! Very Clean  Service Wonderful! All Staff Wonderful At The Wedding!! Thanks Again Julie Dilnot
column37: Food Exceptional  Service The Same  Well Trained Staff And The Presentation Was Superb!!!!
column46: Nothing Was Too Much Trouble! Truly Wonderful Weekend!! Thanks To The Talbot And Staff Xxxxxx
column50: Just A Couple Of The Bookings  The Wrong Price! Small Prob Only
column51: Just Excellent!!!!

column46: Francesca In Sorting Out/Returning Something We Left Behind

column24: Everything Was Perfect
column28: Room 23 I Think  Just Lovely  The Bed Was So Comfortable And Everywhere So Quiet.
column37: Once Again  Just Perfect.
column46: The Young Waiter Who Brought Our Champagne Outside To Us  Can't Remember His Name  I Think He Said He'd Been With You About 5 Months.  He Was Very Friendly And Keen To Do Well.
column50: Nothing At All.
column51: We Enjoyed Our Short Stay Immensley.

column24: Steve The Bar Manager Kept Us Entertained. The Food Was Outstanding And Rooms Immaculate. A Great Mini Break Between Golf At Fulford And Ganton.

column46: I Would Like To Praise All The Staff  They Did An Excellent Job And Such A Young Team Efficient  Polite And Well Presented.

column24: Warm And Friendly Welcome By Pleasant Well Trained Staff
column28: Room 22 Rooms Should Have Hair Driers Room Was Very Hot Even With All Windows Open
column37: The Food Was Exceptional One Of The Best Meals I Have Ever Eaten Well Done Talbot We Will Be Spreading The Word
column46: All The Staff Did A Fine Job Thank You Staff
column50: Air Con In Rooms Would Be Great
column51: The Overall Experience Was Very Good Indeed Thank You For Your Service

column28: We Were In The Fitzwilliam Suite And It Was Absolutely Fantastic!
column37: Would Certainly Recommend The Dining Experience.
column46: Everyone Looked After Us Extremely Well So We Couldn't Choose One Over The Other.
column51: We Found The Breakfast Cooked Breakfast A Little Bit Dry And Baked Beans Would Have Enhanced It.

column28: A Lift To The Second Floor Would Have Been An Advantage But Not Essential
column37: We Had The Tasting Menu Which Would Lead Us To Return
column46: All Were Good At Their Job
column50: I Am A Large Man And Found The Chairs In The Bar Uncomfortable
column51: Again Only The Lack Of A Lift

column28: Room 21. - Beautiful Room. Really Comfortable Bed.Fantastic Shower. The Only Downside Was The Room Was Very Hot And We Could Only Open One Window. Use Of A Fan Or Air Con Would Have Been Useful. Appreciate That This Would Not Normally Be A Problem Given The Usual Uk Weather!
column37: We Had The Tasting Menu With The Wine Selections Which Was Excellent.
Menu Could Better Describe Some Of The Dishes

column28: We Had Room 5   And We Loved It
column46: Hayley Was Excellent As Was All The Staff  Very Impressed With The Breakfast Staff Who Were Always Helpful Happy And Efficient  Loved Sitting In The Drawing Room To Have Tea  And The Young Local Staff Were So Inthusiatic.

column50: As It Was Rather Warm When We Stayed Perhaps The Option Of An Fan In The Bedroom Would Have Been Nice!

column28: Room 22. We Asked For A Quiet Room And Ended Up With One Which Contains The Kitchen Fan Extraction Duct Which Is Very Noisy. We Raised This Before 5Pm And Were Told It Had Never Been Raised Before And Would Stop Around 10 Pm. At 1030 We Had To Ring To Complain About The Continuing Noise And It Was Switched Off But Then Back On About 15 Minutes Later. We Asked To Speak To A Member Of Management But Were Told That There Were None In The Hotel On The Morning Of September 20. When We Dined Our Choice Of Wine Was Not Available But It Still Appeared On Our Bill! This Was Our Second Stay And We Had Hoped It Would Be Better Than The First But We Were Disappointed.
column50: See Previous Comments.

column24: We Were Welcomed But There Wasn't Anything Personal About It.

column37: The Quality Of The Food  Wine And Service Was Really Exceptional On All Occasions As Had Been Recommended To Us. As You Have Asked And Only As We Were Pushed To Say One Thing  We Were Surprised That The Jam For The Cream Tea And Breakfast  Although The Excellent Elsenham Brand  We Might Have Expected An In-House Made Preserve  All In All  If That Was All We Could Say It Isn't Anything That We Would Repeat To A Third Party. We Were Also Very Impressed At The Lengths That The Reception Staff Went To To Locate A Bath Plug When The Original Was Collected With The Morning Change Of Bath Towels.

We Have Already Highly Recommended Your Hotel To Our Family And Friends.

Composers That I Would Recommend To This Ambiance Would Be Chopin Or Even Vaughan Williams Something That Has A Relationship To Landscape Would Be More Appropriate. I Felt The Music Was Disturbing My Perception Of The Atmosphere Of The Room And The Hotel. I Do Know This Because I Am An Artist And I Do Work With Atmosphere In My Installations Myself And I Can Sense Were Well When Something Is Not In Harmony.

column51: My Wife And I Both Very Much Enjoyed Our Stay At The Talbot  Especially The Dining Experience.  I Understand That The Building Is Old And We Were Made Fully Aware That The Hotel Had No Lift And We Were Allocated A Room At The Top Of The Stairs As Agreed So No Complaints.  However I Wonder How Much Thought Has Been Given To Making Life Easy For Clients With Mobility Problems.  For Example  A Handrail At Either Side Of The Staircase Would Be Welcome  As Would Handrails Where Two Or Three Steps Exist.  Grab Rails Over The Bath In Some Rooms Etc.

The Hair Dryer Was Very Difficult To Use Having To Try Styling Whilst Holding In The Button Very Hard. We Asked For This To Be Changed But This Was Not Done. A Welcome Tray Of Tea & Coffee Would Be Better Than Having To Order From Reception.

column28: Room 25.  Despite It Being A Cold Evening The Room Was Very Hot When We Retired That Night.  I Found It Too Hot To Sleep And At About 2Am Looked To See If I Could Open A Window.  The Secondary Double Glazing Didn't Appear Able To Be Opened So I Went Back To Fitful Sleep.  Next Moring I Noticed It Could Open  But Didn't Check To See If The Actual Windows Would Open  Or Whether The Secondary Glazing Could Then Be Propped Open To Allow A Draught Into The Room.  The Duvet Was Thick  Lovely And Toasty  But Unfortunately  Too Hot For Me.  I Spent Most Of The Night With It Thrown Right Back.
column37: First Class Meal.

column50: No  It Was All Lovely

column28: Room 25 And Then Room 14.  I Would Have Preferred To Have Had A Hospitality Tray In The Room.  I Was Informed Upon Checking Out That I Could Have Had Such A Tray  But This Was Not Mentioned In The Literature In The Room.  The Floor In Room 14 Is Somewhat Uneven And Can Be A Little Disconcerting If One Has To Make A Visit To The Bathroom In The Night.  The Seat At The Bottom Of The Bed Is Most Uncomfortable  Since It Is Very Deep And Does Not Have A Back To It.  One Has To Hold On To The Arm To Stop Oneself From Falling Backwards On To The Bed.
column37: We Chose The Talbot Hotel Because Of Its Advertised Connection With James Martin.  We Expected Good Food And Booked For The Evening Meal For Each Of The Three Nights On The Strength Of It.  After The First Night  However  We Regretted That Decision Upon Learning That The Menu Would Remain The Same For The Whole Of Our Stay - Indeed  Apparently  It Is Only Changed A Few Times A Year.  We Found The Variety Of The Menu To Be Pretty Limited.  My Wife Had To Resort To Having The Same Main Course For Each Of The Three Nights.  This Lack Of Change To The Menu Would Be The Principal Reason Why We Will Probably Not Return To The Talbot Hotel.  Other Hotels In Which We Have Stayed Have Adopted A Much More Flexible And Attractive Menu.  There Also Appeared To Be Absolutely Nothing On The Menu That Would Have Been Suitable For Any Children.  All Four Of Us Were Very Disappointed With The Dining Experience  Except For The Very Pleasant And Willing Staff Who Did You Proud.
column46: All The Members Of Staff Were Very Pleasant Indeed And Most Helpful  Particularly With Regard To My Wife's Limited Mobility.
column51: I Thought That The Cost Of The Soft Drinks Was Exorbitant.  To Buy A Pint Of Lemonade For My Wife Meant That I Had To Purchase Three Small Bottles At Â£2.50 A Time!

column37: We Had Two Nights Dining With You. The First Was A Shooting Party - Excellent Food And Even Better Service- The Young Staff Are A Credit To You And The Training They Get- The Waitresses Could Not Have Done More - Ditto The Wine Man Too - All In All A Good Place To Stay In That Part Of The World Which Sadly Has Not Too Many Good Places. The Second Night I Entertained 3 People - Again A Splendid Night- I Return For Yet More Shooting On The 20Th October For 3 Nights - I Hope That This Experience Is As Good As My Last One.  Roger Baines
column46: It Would Be Unfair To Single Any One Out All Were Good  The Front Desk  The Waitresses In Particular - So Very Good For Young People  The Wine Man And The Bar Man - Excellent!
column50: No I Think Not!
column51: No Other Than Thanks - In A World Where Good Service Is So.. So Lacking It Was Good To Find A Place Such As The Talbot Back In My Native Yorkshire - Now Exiled For Many Years In The Channel Islands And Across The World!

column37: We Regularly Eat In Restaurants Some With Michelin Stars And Others With None. The Evening Meal At The Talbot Was Excellent With A One Star Michelin Standard. The Dining Experience However Was Spoilt By The Restaurant Room. All The Lights  Wall Lights And Main Lights Were On All Night Creating No Atmosphere Whatsoever- Was Similar To Being In A Supermarket Cafe. Perhaps You Could Install Spot Lights In The Ceiling Shining Individually Onto Each Table Giving A More Professional Feel And Experience. Unfortunately The Breakfast Could Only Be Described As Average !! Bacon And The Sausage Not Cooked Properly  Black Pudding Over Cooked And Dry
column51: The Afternoon Tea Was Excellent. We Also Noticed Some Staff Were In The Bar Area Around 10 30/11Pm  Sat Down Drinking And Socialising- Again Not Very Professional

column46: The Reason For Completing This Questionaire (Which Normally I Wouldnt Waste My Team) We Felt Very Strongly That The Bar Area Was Chaotic !  The Champagne Was Served In A Wine Cooler  Admitedly Cold Champagne  But A Real Ice Bucket With Ice Would Have Been Far Better.  The Table Was Left With The Previous Peoples 'Afternoon Tea' Pots.... And Would Still Have Been There Had We Not Asked The Waitress To Kindly Remove Them !  She Was Very Apologetic.... But Neither The Bar Man Or The 2 Other Waitress's Hadnot Even Noticed.  We Were In The Corner Near The Bar.  She Also Agreed The Champagne Should Have Been Served On Ice.... Shame When You Have The Most Expensive Bubbly And It Looks Like A Bottle Of Wine.
column50: There Seem To Be Plenty Of Staff  But They Are Not On The Ball With The Little Things.... They Are All Great And All Keen But A Little More Training Maybe.  Such A Lot To Remember.... Just A Bit Of Fine Tuning Would Really Make The Place Special !  The Food Is Absolutely Superb.... The Chef Has To Be Congratulated !!

column28: Making Comparisons With Other Hotels We Have Visited  The Room Facilities At The Talbot Were Disappointing. Whilst Room Service Was Available For Tea And Coffee It Would Be Preferable To Have The Facility To Make Your Own  Particularly If Required Late At Night Or Very Early. An Iron And Ironing Board Would Also Be Advantageous.
column51: In Regard To Q18. After Leaving The Hotel I Realised That The Final Account Was Not Correct. I Had Been Offered The Opportunity To Look At The Bill  But Did Not Realise We Had Been Charged For Over Spend On The Restaurant Allowance. Infact We Had Not Used Up The Full Â£60 Allocated. I  Therefor  Had To Ring The Hotel To Get This Rectified. The Problem Was Rectified Straight Away By Your Reception Staff  But A Little More Accurate Detailing Of Customers' Orders Would Help To Stop This Happening. Apparently It Had Been 'Assumed' We Had Had 3 Courses During Our Meal  When In Fact We Did Not Have Desert.

column50: We Were Very Disappointed Not To Be Able To Eat In The Restaurant In The 4 Nights We Stayed At The Hotel. We Were Not Advised To Book A Table In Advance At Any Stage. On The First Night We Ate In The Bar  But Found The Menu Very Limited And We Had To Order Before 7Pm. Thereafter  After Being Advised That There Was No Room In The Restuarant (Despite The Restaurant Not Seeming Busy  And The Restaurant Manager's List Showing No More Than 10 Pax At Any One Time In The Evening) We Went To The Local Restaurant  'The New Malton' Where The Food Was Excellent  The Prices Lower Than The Talbot  And The Service Was Accomodating And Welcoming. We Visit The Malaton Area Regularly On Business And Will Have To Consider Carefully If We Wish To Stay At A Hotel Where The Dining Experience Is So Disappointing. The Impression We Got Was That The Restaurant Is Managed Principally For The Benefit Of The Local Population And Not Your Paying Residents - Sooner Or Later This Approach Must Surely Damage Your Hotel Trade And Your Reputation.

column24: No
column28: No
column37: Yes!  We Were Booked For The Tasting Menu.  We Both Strongly Dislike Goats' Cheese In Any Form.  I Cannot Pretend We Are Allergic To It But Personally I Feel Nauseous When I Have Had It  Or Dishes Made With It  In The Past.  I Took The Time To Telephone Before Our Arrival And Explain This As The Only Food Fad We Have.  Unfortunately The First Course Of The Tasting Menu Was Goat Cheese.  It Was Not Described As Goat Cheese On The Tasting Menu.  I Was Made Aware Of The Problem As We Were Initially Given The A La Carte Menu By Mistake And I Spotted The Dish Which Was Fully Described On That Menu.  As A Result I Brought It To The Attention Of Our Waitress Who Made Arrangements For Us To Have The Smoked Salmon Starter Instead.  The Matter Was Dealt With Very Efficiently And In A Friendly And Light Hearted Manner Which Allowed Us To Remain Comfortable.  It Was  After All  My Wife's Birthday  And The Stay With You Was Her Treat.  Had One Of Us Actually Suffered From An Allergy To The Offending Item The Evening Could Have Become Very Unpleasant.  Everything Else Was Exceptional But I Believe This Is A Matter Which Should Be Rectified.
column46: Yes.  The Waitress Who Dealt With Our Goat Cheese Issue.  I Am Afraid I Cannot Remember Her Name But She Was Very Helpful And Had A Very Pleasant Manner.
column50: No
column51: The Absence Of A Lift Was A Problem For My Wife Who Has Knee Problems.  I Understand Why There Is No Lift But It Meant We Were Not Able To Relax In The Lounge Earlier In Our Stay As We Might Have Wished To As One Journey Up To Our Room Was All She Could Manage.  In Retrospect A Room On The Ground Or First Floor Would Have Been Better.

column37: When Shown To Our Table My Wife's Chair Was Not Offered And The Young Waiter Just Walked Off. If This Is Considered 'Sexist' These Days  Coordination With Other Staff Would Have Allowed Both Chairs To Have Been Offered. We Ordered Wines By The Glass To Suit Each Course And I Had To Ask For The Main Course Wine To Be Brought  Which Still Took Time. My Wife's Glass Of Red Wine Had Considerable Sediment  Showing That Whoever Poured It Knew Little About Wines. Another Guest Across The Dining Room Was Heard To Complain Loudly (And Rudely I Thought) About Slow Service. These Things Diminished (But Not Destroyed) The Enjoyment Of The Food  Which Was Excellent.
column50: Simply Achieve The Standard Referred To In My Previous Comments
column51: In Spite Of The Adverse Comments  The Stay Represented Very Good Value For Money. We Have Stayed At And Eaten In Many 1  2 And 3 Michelin Star Restaurants And Hotels  And We Recognise That Ultra-High Service Comes At A Price. However  The Cost Of Achieving A Much Better Standard At The Talbot Would Be Little. Better Attention To Basic Training And Attention To Some Small Details Could Create A Significant Return On Investment. We Would Happily Return To See How Things Might Have Changed.

column15: Been Visiting Malton Regularly For 50 Years So New Talbot Had Gone Through Renovation So Gave It A Try
column28: On Next Stay I Will Request A Room To The Rear As Road Noise Was Quite An Issue Even During The Night
column37: Dont Fix What Aint Broke
column51: Coffe And Tea Etc In Room I Know It Was Available But Prefer It In Room

column24: 7 Day Cancellation Should Not Include Price Of Dinner  Only Room So I Booked Dinner Separately
column28: 14 The Room Was Extremely Hot  Being South Facing And The Window Would Not Open More Than A Few Inches. A Solution Needs To Be Found To This Problem.

column24: In Warm Weather Our Room (Number 14) Was Too Hot As It Is In Full Sunshine For Much Of The Day. Plainly For Security The Windows Have Restricted Opening But More Ventilation Is Needed.
column28: See Above About Room Ventilation

column24: The Hotel Has No Lift  Our Room Was On The Second Floor  And The Hotel Does Not Employ A Porter. The Receptionist Offered To Help Carry Our Cases  But A Hotel Aspiring To These Standards Should Have A Porter.
column28: It Was Difficult To Open And Close The Inner Window As The Curtains And Pelmet Got In The Way. It Was Noisy  When It Was Open. There Were No Facilities For Making Tea  Although We Were Offered Tea In The Lounge  And No Tissues In The Room
column37: We Really Enjoyed The Food  But The Waiting Staff Were Friendly But Need More Training To Achieve The Standards We Expect From A Restaurant Aspiring To High Standards  Eg Not Bringing A Tray Into The Bar To Carry Your Drinks To The Table  Not Clearing The Crumbs Between Courses  Etc. Sounds Nit Picky  But Cumulatively It Does Make A Difference.
column46: Friendly Helpful Barman.
column50: Drinks Making Facilities In The Room  Particularly For Morning Tea.
column51: It Felt As If The Company Had Invested A Lot Of Money In The Building  But Were Now Penny Pinching On Staff And Other Facilities. Like The Paintings  Not Quite The Real Thing!

column28: Room 17 There Was No Room Between The Toilet And Toilet Roll Holder. Suggest Find Another Location For The Holder. No Shower Cap
column37: Food Was Very Good But Not Excellent. Surprisingly As James Martin The Ythe Executive Chief The Deserts Were Only Average. The Dining Room Was Half Full But Overheard Someone Being Turned Down Earlier As Fully Booked. The Atmostphere Suffered From Being Half Empty.
column50: Generally All Very Good  But Not Exceptional.
column51: All In All Excellent Value

column37: Excellent Food And Service From Staff Who Worked Diligently And With Alacrity
column46: The Bar Manager Had A Problem To Deal With. He Turned A Potential Difficult Situation Into A Cabernet. He Should Be Employed In The Diplomatic Service. Congratulations To Him
column50: No
column51: I Just Hope Your Very High Standards Are Maintained

column24: Every Thing Was Fine The Staff Did Well
column28: One Of The Best We Have Stayed In
column37: The Menu Was A Disappointment After Seeing The Vegetable Garden Thought We Were In For A Treat But Not So The Meal Was A Disappointment Too No Clams In The Shells Or On Plate And One Was Not Even Open So Should Have Been Removed Cheese Board No Mild Cheeses Asked For Wensleydale Told Did Not Have Any But Then It Was On The Breakfast Menu By The Way The Breakfast Was Good Husband Cringed At Beast Cheek As It Was The Only Meat His Mother Could Afford When They Were Young Sorry To Be Negative But After Seeing What James Martin Cooks On Saturday Kitchen I Think He Needs To Take Another Look At Things But We Did Enjoy The Talbot
column46: All Were Good A Truly Well Run Hotel Thank You
column50: Tea Coffee In Rooms Would Be Good My Husband Is No Good To Anyone Till Had At Least 2 Cups Of Tea

column24: Prior To Booking Checked That You Served Gluten Free Meals.
column28: Disappointed There Were No Tea/Coffee Making Facilities In The Room. The Bed Was Exceptionally Comfortable And The Linen Of A High Quality
column37: While The Overall Ambience Was Good We Were Disappointed With The Over Elaborate Nature And The Quantity Of The Food. Too Much 'Posh Nosh' And Not Enough Substance.
column50: The Dinner Was Disappointing For Us But The Rest Of Our Stay We Thoroughly Enjoyed

column15: We Like To Stay At Hotels With Great Chefs - Le Manoir  Northcote Manor  Rick Stein's And So On.
column24: No  It Was As Expected.
column37: We Dined With You Twice.  The First Night My Wine Was Decanted.  The Second Night With A Different Maitre 'D It Wasn't And That Was A Shame.  My Wife Is A Non Meat Eater And The Chef Arranged For A Different Choice For Her On The Second Night.  That Was Very Much Appreciated.
column46: The Barman Was Outstanding And Always Very Helpful.  Our Waitress At Breakfast Could Not Have Been More Helpful Or Courteous - She Was A Slightly More Mature Lady And Wore Glasses  Don't Know Her Name.

column15: Called During Malton Food Fair And Heard About James Martin Restaurant.
column37: The Quality Of The Food Was Of A Very High Standard And Beautifully Presented.
column51: Missing Light Bulb In Bedside Lamp  And Then All Room Lights Fused When Bathroom Light Was Used  Causing Wall Light Bulb To Blow. Should Not Happen In Hotels Of This Rating.

column28: A Minor Issue But The Hair Dryer Ran Too Hot And It Did Not Seem Possible To Reduce The Heat. Room Was Too Hot At Night Despite Window Being Wide Open But That Was More A Product Of The Warm Weather Not A Fault. Very Much Appreciated Publication Of The History Of The Establishment And Malton.
column46: Barman/Manager. The Beer Had A Slight 'Caste' To It And I Expressed Concern. Rather Than Offering Something Else He Had The Confidence To Say I Would Find It Was Fine  He Had Tested It And He Would Not Serve It To Me If It Was Not Ok. He Was Right  It Was Just Slightly Fresh. Restaurant Staff Impressed With Their Knowledge Of Wine
column50: Had A Separate Sheet On The Bed For Hot Weather But We Removed The Duvet Cover And Slept Under That So Not Great Problem.
column51: We Wish You All Success. You Made A Big Investment In An Uncertain Economic Climate.

column24: On Arrival There Was No One At The Reception  However A Young Man Went In Search Of The Receptionist. On Her Arrival There Was No Welcome  Only A Very Surly Reception.We Were Told In No Uncertain Terms That We Were Too Early To Book In As She ' Had Only Just Finished Dealing With Departures And We Would Have Been Informed Of Checking In Times On Our Confirmation. This Was Not A Problem To Us And Agreed To Return At The Appropriate Time. On Our Return She ( Lydia) Showed Us To Our Room  No Banter  No Rapport Only The Basic Info Offered  We Felt Like Going Home.Fortunately Other Members Of Your Staff Showed Much More Welcoming Skills And Personality.Regarding The Deco   Food  Presentation All Excellent Just A Pity The Yorkshire Hospitality Did Not Shine Through On Our First Contact. With Regards Julie Gerrard
column46: I Really Need To Emphasise Our Disapointment With The Receptionist  However On Checking Out Another Young Lady Approached Us To See If We Needed Any Help She Was Totally Different  Very Pleasant And Helpfu Lwhilst Lydia Still Had Her Aloof Head On  I Strongly Feel There Is A Training Need For People Skills And Pleasantry Skills. My Husband Mentioned How She Had Made Us Feel And She  Did Not Seem To Care .

column28: Only A Very Tiny Point. No Biscuits With The Tea And Coffee.
column37: Maybe More Vegetables Would Be Better.

column50: It Would Have Been Preferable To Have Tea Making Facilities In The Room.  We Were Surprised There Were None.
column51: Thank You For Making Our Visit So Happy And Memorable.

column28: Housekeeping (Cleaning) Was Not As Good As It Should Be And The Hotel Information Pages Were Slightly Grubby
column37: The Staff Were Pleasant And Friendly But Could Not Be Described A Truly Professional.  No Coasters Were Provided For Drinks In The Drawing Room And The Nuts And Olives Were Left On Trays In The Hall And Not Served With The Drinks.  The Pacing Of The Meal Was Bad.  The Main Course Was Served Immediately After The Starter - There Should Have Been A Suitable Pause.  Presumably The Main Course Order Was Given To The Kitchen Too Soon.  A Second Bread Roll Had To Be Requested And The Butter Served With The Original Roll Was So Soft It Was Almost Liquid.
column50: More Professional Staff Who Would Clear Breakfast Plates Without Having To Be Asked To Do So.
column51: The Hotel Has Been Extremely Well Re-Furbished And The Bathroom Was Very Good But The Overall Operation Did Not Live Up To Expectations Even Though All The Staff Were Well Meaning And Very Polite.

column37: Restaurant Waiting Staff Must Improve. 'There You Go' And 'No Problem' Is Not Appropriate  And The Food Deserves So Much Better. White Wine Unopened In Cooler Until Second Course And Red Ordered Was Substituted  And Opened  Without Consultation. None Of This Spoiled The Occasion  But Should Be Better.
column50: Bar Furnishing Is A Little Austere; Could Be More Comfortable.
column51: Congratulate All In The Kitchen.

column50: The Option To Be Able To Order Plainer Food If Needed And/Or A More Frequent Change Of Menu.  The Food Was Excellent But If You Did Not Like Fish Or You Were A Vegetarian The Choice Was Rather Restricted.

column24: Receptionist Was Most Welcome But Other Staff Not
column46: Breakfast Waitress Was Asked Twice If There Was Any Gluten Free Bread As My Wife Is Coeliac Before Telling Us You Had Run Out Of It On The Previous Day.
column50: As We Had Arrived Later Than Planned Due To Motorway Road Works Along The Way We Were Then Given Conflicting Stories As To Where We Could Have A Lighter Meal. A Little More Consideration Would Not Have Come Amiss.
column51: Disappointing For What Could Be A Very Good Hotel With The Right Welcome.

column24: No
column28: Window Was Open On Arrival And We Found It Impossible To Close Did Not Matter Much To Us As It Was A Warm Night And Overlooking A Quiet Garden
column37: Portions Were Small The Cod Was Served With Bones Which Should Have Been Removed Prior To Cooking We Are Not Young But Even Three Courses Would Not Have Satisfied A Youthful Appetite
column46: The Barman Was Friendly And Particularly Helpful
column50: We Were Strongly Discouraged From Parking Near The Entrance To The Hotel Even To Unload Our Luggage Which Meant We Had To Carry It From The Top Car Park. A Designated Loading/Unloading Bay Would Be Useful. Rooms Of This Quality Are Often Supplied With Toweling Robes  They Would Have Enhanced My Stay
column51: Using The James Martin Brand Name Led Us To Expect More Of The Dining Room The Â£1 Champagne Offer Was Misleading As The Tariff Was Â£5 More Making The Real Charge For The Wine Â£6 Breakfast Was Excellent In Terms Of Both Food And Service

column28: I Had Difficulty Opening The Small Bottles Shampoo Etc. Know Why You Supply In This Way But Problem For Arthritic Fingers!
column46: Dominic For Help And Advice With Wine Choice. Bar Man For Service And Humour. Young Waiter Who Served Us At Dinner. He Was So Pleasant And Attentive. Hate To Single Any Staff Member Out As All Exceptional.
column50: We Should Have Requested A Room On A Lower Floor As The Stairs Were A Problem. Our Own Fault
column51: We Will Be Back!

column28: Room 21 Very Good - But Rather Too Many Stairs - Would Ask For A Room Easier To Access.Have Stayed In The Fitzwilliam Suite Before Which Was Excellent.  Also Room 12  Which My Daughter And Her Husband Stayed In On This Occasion.

column24: No - Everything Went Smoothly And Was As We Had Anticipated.
column37: Just Wish We Lived A Little Nearer And Could Easily Visit More Often.
column46: Your Reception Staff Were Helpful And Efficient  As Was The Man Who Ran The Bar On The Evening When We Stayed.
column50: Not Really.  Over The Years We Have Stayed In Many Very Good And Well Known Hotels  And The Talbot Was Up To Standard And Completely Met Our Requirements.  We Enjoyed The Background Music.

column28: Room 21. I Would Have Preferred A Room On A Lower Floor But I Did Not Request One. Also The Products In The Bathroom Were Difficult For Me To Open. These Are My Problems! Old Age And Arthritis Are To Blame!
column37: We Enjoyed Lunch In The Bar Which Was Ideal. Dinner In The Restaurant In The Evening Was An Amazing Experience. The Talbot Ticks All The Boxes As A Dining Venue.
column46: Everyone Was Caring And Knowledgeable. Dominic Was Excellent At Steering Through The Recommended Wines And Attentive While We Enjoyed The Taster Menu. The Bar Man Was Friendly And Humorous. The Young Man Who Waited On Us At Dinner Was Efficient And Delightful. The Waitresses Were All Friendly But Committed To Their Task.
column50: No. It Lived Up To My Expectations And Wildest Dreams.
column51: Thanks Again To Everyone On The Team. Keep Up With The Good Work.

column24: No
column28: Excellent
column37: Staff Need A Little More Polish But This Did Not Detract From The Experience
column50: No
column51: Very Enjoyable

column24: Well Catered For Until Room Available
column28: Rather Noisy Because Of Road Traffic
column37: Very Obliging  Helpful Staff
column46: Young Lady Who Offered To Provide Toast With Our Coffee While We Waited For Other Guests To Join Us For Breakfast
column50: No
column51: Rather Warm  But No Doubt Lovely And Cosy In Winter

column28: Room 14.  The Room Was Far Too Hot As The Windows Would Only Open At The Bottom.  Hot Air Rises And To Even Out The Temperature The Top Of The Window Needs To Open.  It Was So Hot That Both Of Us Slept On Top Of The Duvet. I Can Understand The Restrictions With Old Buildings  But Surely You Should Be Able To Open The Top Of The Window As Well As The Bottom
column37: Would Certainly Tell Others About The Talbot.  Great Place.
column46: All Were Very Good.

column28: For An Executive Room The View Was Non Cxistana/

column24: Very Pleased To Get The Table For Dinner That We Had Mentioned Over The Phone.
column28: Room 9.   Well Appointed; Did Find The 'Duvet' A Bit Heavy On A Warm Night - And The Side Table Sloped Noticeably:  A Glass Started Sliding Off  But Was Fortunately Noticed In Time!  Excellently Appointed Bathroom.
column37: We Have Recently Been Both For Lunch And For The Evening Tasting Menu.  Both Experiences Were First-Class.

column28: Perhpas A Shower Cap Would Be Useful And Also Cotton Wool Balls.
column37: I Would Highly Recommend To Friends And Hope To Return.  The Staff Were Very Helpful And Explained Certain Elements Of The Food When We Asked.
column46: The Receptionist On Duty When We Arrived Immediately Realised That My Friend Would Be Unable To Manage The Two Flights Of Stairs To Our Booked Room And Then Arranged For My Friend To Have A Ground Floor Room To Which She Was Extremely Thankful. I Was Able To Stay In The Booked Room And At No Extra Charge Which Was Most Appreciated.
column50: Perhaps Should Have Been Made Aware Of The Fact That There Is No Lift.  I Had Not Thought To Ask When I Made The Booking.
column51: We Both Thoroughly Enjoyed Our The Experience And Hope That We Will Be Able To Return.
column61: Mrs Heather Goil  Mrs Pat Margiotta

column24: Our Tee Time Had Not Been Booked At Golf Course But We Very Kindly Fixed In By The Professional
column28: No Shower Cap. Shower Had Mould And Shower Door Was Grubby
column37: We Were Last To Be Served In The Evening. Service Was Rather Slow And We Eventually Had To Summon A Waiter For Dessert.  We Were Not Offered Coffee.  This May Have Been The Result Of The Appearance Of James Martin In Dining Room Causing Staff To Be Distracted.  It Was However Lovely To Meet Him.
column50: Please See Previous Comments

column24: The Young Lady On Reception Didn't Seem Too Sure Of The Situation Re Coffee/Tea In The Room/Outside.
column28: We Stayed In Room27. There Is A Problem With The Curtain Pelmet In That You Cannot Open The Inner Window Or Close It Without Disturbing The Pelmet. We Had To Ask Staff To Close The Inner Window Before We Went To Bed. Frustratingly  All The Staff Seemed To Know About The Problem But Had Done Nothing About It. This Was Compounded When It Proved Very Difficult To Open The Inner Window When It Became Warm In The Night. There Is No Handle On It. Sorry To Sound Like All I'm Doing Is Complaining But It Would Be Better If It Was Made Clear In The Room Information That Tea/Coffee Are Complimentary Rather Than Saying They Are Available.
column37: Staff And Food In The Resataurant Were Excellent. The Only Problem Was The Restaurant Manager  Who I Believe Is Named Dominic. We Arrived In The Bar At 7Pm For Our Meal At 7.30. He Brought Us Some Nuts/Olives And Then Ignored Us Until My Wife Asked Him  At 7.50  When We Eating. He Immediatley Showed Us To Our Table But Why The Delay?
column46: Clare On Reception This Morning Listened To My 'Moans' And Acted Very Professionally. The Barman Was Very Professional But At The Same Time Friendly. The Only Problem Was Dominic.
column50: See Previous Comments.

column37: Beautifully Presented High Quality Food - An Excellent Dining Experience.
column46: All Your Staff Were Superb And Made Our Short Stay Most Enjoyable.

column28: Regretted Not Asking For A Tea Tray For Early Morning. It Was Offered
column46: Waiting Staff Were Excellent And We Particularly Liked The Fact They Engaged Us In Conversation.
column51: Our Stay Was A Gift From Our Family For Our Golden Wedding And My Daughter So Wanted It To Be Perfect I Am Sure She Spoke To Every Member Of Staff!!!!! It Was A Perfect Occasion And Meeting James Was Just So Lovely.

column46: Waiting Staff Were Excellent And It Was Noticeable That Although They Were All Very Young They Engaged Us In Conversation. We Both Liked That.
column51: This Was A Golden Anniversary Gift From Our Family And It Will Be A Treasured Memory. It Was A Real Bonus Meeting James Martin......Saturday Mornings Will Be Even More Special Now.

column24: Efficient Prompt
column46: Bar Staff And Staff Waiting On At Tables
column50: Acknowledge My Husband's 70Th Birthday.I Telephoned In Advance To Mention It .
column51: Thankyou For Your Speedy Response To James Martin's Presence In The Kitchen.It Was A Request From My Husband To Celebrate His Birthday In James' Restaurant.We Were Thrilled To Meet Him And Talk To Him.I Was Delighted To Be The First To Be Served His New Addition To The Menu Which Was Superb[Apple Dessert]

column24: Very Friendly And Efficient .
column28: Haughton Suite Room 4 Beautiful. Quite Exceptional And Beyond Our Need But A Delightful Experience For Of Anniversary.
column37: Superb. Possibly One Of The Best Meals We Have Had. As I Am Lactose Intolerant Eating Out Can Be Difficult But It Was Delightful That You Were Prepared To Let My Husband Enjoy The Taster Menu While I Remained On The 3 Course Menu Which Was Better Suited To My Needs. Thank You For Your Understanding  It Was Much Appreciated.
column46: All The Staff Were Exceptional So It Would Be Unfair To Single One Out.
column50: No
column51: Yes. We Enjoyed It So Much We Are Returning Again Next Month - When We Hope To Be Equally Well Looked After!!

column24: Very Pleased That You Are Pet Friendly. On Leaving By Car The Exit Gates Opening Mechanism Failed And We Had To Leave Via The Slightly Hazardous In-Gate.
column28: Room 10 - It Would Have Been Nice To Have Had Two Chairs In The Room.
column37: Well Done!!
column50: Although Correct The Final Account Was Somewhat Confusing Causing Slight Embarrassment For Ourselves And Your Staff. An Itemised Bill Would Have Been Preferred.
column51: A Discrete Dog Litter Box Would Help.

column24: On Departing By Car The Exit Gates Mechanism Failed And We Had To Leave From The Slightly Hazardous Entry Gate.
column28: It Would Have Been Nice To Have Two Chairs In The Room.
column51: Although Correct The Account Was Confusing And Caused Ourselves And Your Staff Some Slight Embarrassment. An Itemised Bill Would Have Been Preferred.

column28: Room Was Very Comfortable Fresh Flowers Was A 'Nice Touch'. Would Have Preferred Tea Coffee Facilities In Room.
column37: Breakfast - Toast Served Initially With Tea/Coffee Was Cold And Chewy When We Ate It After Cooked Breakfast. One Guest Chose Rump Of Lamb - Two Extremely Small Medallions Of Meat Were Totally Inadequate And We Ordered Extra Vegetables To Compensate. Service In The Dining Room Was Excellent.

column51: Food Is Very Good And Very Well Presented But A Little Minimalist. There Was No Trace Of Potato In Any Form And Combined With The Limited Vegetable I Felt Rather Unsatisfied With The Mains Each Day.

column24: I Found It Difficult To Make Telephone Contact When Trying To Make A Booking Presumably Because There Is Only One Telephone Line/Operator.
column28: The Only Problem Was The Operation Of The Sash Window  As It Couldn't Be Opened To The Chosen Amount.  The Toilet Roll Holder Was Sited In An Awkward Position.
column37: The Quality Of The Food Was Exceptional.

column50: The Upgrade To The Suite Was Well Received  But We Still Like The Rockingham!
column51: We Hope That Soon The Work On The Gardens Will Give The Benfits You Expect!

column24: Very Impressed
column28: A Lovely Room Without A View  But Great Otherwise. Bathroom Needed Bulbs To Be Changed And Bin Emptied  Window Catch Missing. We Loved Tea And Coffee Brought To Our Room  A Great Feature Of The Hotel. No Shower Cap  But A Lovely One Was Provided On Request With Good Grace And Humour.
column37: All Was Exceptional. Thank You!
column46: The Duty Manager And All Waiting Staff. Obviously Good Leadership And Training.
column51: We Are Returning Soon.

column28: The Noise Of The Outside Fans Also The Bathroom Fan Was Loud
column37: There Could Of Been A Better Bar Menu And No Children's Menu

column24: We Requested The Complimentary Champagne At 5.30Pm But It Was Still Served Immediately Following Our Arrival
column28: There Was A Problem With Heating/Hot Water On The First Day But It Was Dealt With Promptly Thank You
column46: Restaurant Staff Were All Very Welcoming And Friendly Which Suits Us.
column50: The Paper We Ordered Was Removed - Presume By Another Guest - From Our Door; Perhaps They Could Be Handed To Guests As They Arrive For Breakfast To Avoid Their Going Astray?
column51: Our Third Visit In Twelve Months!!

column24: Arrival Very Good Departure Indifferent
column37: Nouvelle Cusine Did Not Agree No Pototoes Only On Request Lack Of Vegtables No Soup On Menu Strange !Sweets Dissapointing Whitby Crab Good Starter But Not Much Else Satisfactory
column46: Bartender Was Very Helpfull
column50: Not Value For The Rate Charged

column24: Everything Friendly And Efficient
column28: 21 No Tea Making Facility
column37: Nice Relaxed Feel And A Well Paced Meal.

column15: James Martins Association With The Hotel
column24: Our Room Was Not Available On Arrival But We Welcomed A Complimentary Drink In The Bar
column50: Improved The Weather !!!!
column51: We Look Forward To Your Next Deals

column46: The Manager   Jeffrey Deplessy (?)   Was Informative With Regard To The Hotel And The Area And Very Welcoming. The Young Man Serving In The Bar Could Be A Touch Friendlier
column50: Breakfast Was Very Good But Two Other Hotels In Yorkshire We Recently Visited Were Better!

column24: Car Park To Far Away From Hotel Entrance On Wet And Windy Days
column28: If God Forbit I Was A Mr Blobby. I Would Have Problems With The Configeration Of The Bathroom. As It Was The Door And The Basin Surround Were To Close Together.
column50: Sort The Bathroom.   Change The Menue. Cauliflower To Days Running For A Vegitarian Is Very Bad.
column51: Will Be Contacting Mr James Martin Re The Menues  What We Had Was Not Good For His Reputation.

column28: We Stayed In Room 11 (Rockingham).Overall Very High Quality Of Fitments But Room Was Very Warm At Night Despite Heating Being Switched Off-Hard To Sleep.
column46: The Duty Manager In The Restaurant On The Evening Of Sept 19Th-Very Good Attention To Detail And Personal Service

column24: We Booked Room 23 But Were Not Told That It Was Up At The Top Of The Building With No Lift  As We Are Getting On In Years We Found The Mountaineering Course Each Time Especially With Luggage A Challenge  No Offer Of Help Was Offered. Guests Who Book Upper Floor Rooms Should Be Told That There Is No Lift When They Book.
column28: We Expected A Hotel Of This Quality To Have A Trouser Press  Tea & Coffee Facilities (A Tray Of Which Was Later Offered) And A Supply Of Shower Gel  To Go With The Shampoo & Conditioner That Were Offered.
column37: The Jazz Music Atmosphere In The Bar  Restaurant In The Evening  And Especially In The Morning At Breakfast We Found Just A Little Too Much Especially  The Morning Volume  Just Too Much When You Stay For A Four Night Visit. A Restaurant Of This Caliber Should Have A 'No Mobile Phone/Device' Policy  A Top Class Meal Was Spoilt When Phones Ring And People Start Chatting.  You Would Be Asked To Leave If This Happened At The Evesham Hotel Opposite Our Home.
column46: Domonic Was Very Helpful (My Wife Does Not Eat Fish And Found The Menu For Four Nights Restrictive) But Steak Was Offered Which Was Very Enjoyable.)  The Younger Male Management Member Has A Little Too Much Of An Aloof Attitude  Everything Appears To Be A Little Too Much Trouble For Him Either That Or He Has A Lot To Learn About The Hotel Hospitality Business.
column50: A Warm Welcome When You Arrive And A Friendly Goodbye Would Have Been Welcome  It Appears That The Receptionist Has Too Much To Do  Dashes About Alot And Has Little Time To Pay Proper Attention To The Task In Hand. Would Suggest The Staff Also Have Name Tabs So That This Type Of Questionnaire Can Be Completed In Full.  All Your Staff Especially The Younger Members  Should Be Trained To Treat Guests With A Friendlier Manner.
column51: The Car Park Exit Gate Was Faulty During Our Stay And Lots Of Delivery Vehicles & Some Guests Used It As An Entrance Which Is Dangerous When They Appear Out Of The Blue As You Drive Up The Exit Slope  What Is Needed Is A Sign On The Outside Of The Gates Which Should Read 'Exit Only'

column24: The  Young Lady Who Took Our Booking On The Phone Was Very Helpful And Efficient. She Sent A Confirming Email Very Promptly. We Were Greeted   Warmly And Made To Feel At Home Immediately On Arrival  And Our Luggage Was Taken Up To Our Room
column28: Room 15 Was A Beautifully Appointed Room  With A Comfortable Bed And Such Extras As Mineral Water  Which Were Appreciated.
column37: We Initially Chose The  Hotel Because James Martin Is Its Executive Chef. We Arrived Early Enough To Have Lunch As Well As Dinner. Both Meals Exceeded Our Expectations. We Had The Tasting Menu With Wines In The Evening  And Found The Balance Of Exceptionally Chosen Wines With Each Course Perfect - And Indeed Better Than Some Choises At Other Michelin Starred Establishments. The Food Was Delicate And Absolutely Delicious (As We Expected!) And All Of The Staff Were Both Knowlegable And Efficient  While Being Both Totally Professional And Also Friendly  And Giving An Impression Of Caring About Their Work. Our Only Regret Was That We Live Too Far Away (In Edinburgh) To Be Able To Eat Regularly There.
column46: I Can't Remember Names  And It Would Be Invidious To Leave Any Of Them Out
column50: Nothing
column51: This Was Our Last Night Of A Short Holiday  And The Whole Experience  Left Us On A High  And Able To Cope With The Delights Of  The Journey On The A1 Home!

column28: Room 2.    It Was Spacious With A Lovely View And Really Nice Bathroom.   The Bath Mat In The Cupboard Was Really Appreciated As I Am Unstable Getting In And Out Of Baths Due To Operations And It Is Not A Pretty Sight If I Have To Be Picked Up.    All The Staff Especially Steve In The Bar (Nice Martini's) And Yourself We Found To Be Terrific.  The Waiters And Waitresses Were Very Pleasant  Competent And Chatty Without Holding Things Up.   Now-The Food- Terr8ific.  Like General Mcarthur Said In Ww11 - We Shall Return And Thank You For Making Our Stay So Pleasant.  See You All Next Year.  Margaret Walker.
column37: The Size Of The Dining Room Was Just Perfect.  Not Too Big As I Hate Large Dining Rooms Which Tend To Get A Bit Noisy.   Yours Has Just The Right Ambiance And Of Course  The Quality Of The Food Was Wonderful.
column46: Steve In The Bar Who Served Us Lunch On Friday And Drinks Each Evening - Great Martini's. Youself For Being So Industrious Yet Had Time To Talk To Us. I Managed To Get The Name Of One Waitress - Kyomi Who Was Great But So Were The Others. I Always Like To Know The Names Of Who Is Serving Us And Name Badges Would Have Been Greatly Appreciated.  I Tend To Make Notes So When We Return We Can Acknowledge Them.
column50: Just The Name Badges Please So I Don't Have To Go Around Asking. Great Hotel  Great Restaurant And Great Staff. Did Notice That Every Morning Staff Were Very Busy Damp Dusting And Hoovering.  The Place Was Spotless. Oh  And A Last Thought - The Tray That You Kindly Sent To The Room On Friday Evening As We Left The Restaurant Was Greatly Appreciated.  We Did Ask The Girl On Reception For One On Friday Afternoon - But It Never Appeared.
column51: You've Got It Right.

column28: Our Only Comment Is That The Rooms Were Too Warm No Heating On In Bathroom Nor Bedroom But Difficulty In Sleeping Do Not Know Were The Heat Is Generated From But We All Found It The Same Even With The Windows Open.
column37: The Food We Had Was The Best We Have Eaten For A Long Time Wonderful.
column46: All Were Very Good Especially In The Dinning Room.
column51: Only That We All Look Forward To Being There Again.

column15: Called In For Coffee Earlier In The Year
column24: Bar Staff Failed To Check We Were Guests When We Asked For A Sandwich After 7.0Pm

column28: Room 7. Small Bathroom Meant That Over Bath Shower Was Difficukt To Access And Use. Despite Taking Care With Curtain Water Spilled Onto Floor.
column46: The Young Lady From Reception Who Went Down Into Malton To Try To Buy Me A Shower Cap When There Were None Available

column50: I Left My Telephone Which I Returned To Collect But I Also Left My Make Up Bag Which At The Time I Didn't Realise I Had Done. However  It Is Being Posted To Me But It Would Have Been Helpful If When I Returned For My Phone I Was Also  Given The Make Up Bag Which Was In The Same Room.
column51: We Really Enjoyed James Martin's Tasting Menu.

column37: The Taster Menu Was As Expected - Interesting And Challenging.   The Ordinary Dinner Menu Was Not What We Expected From Yorkshireman James Martin - Very 'Cheffy' And Much Of It The Same As The Taster Menu We Had Had The Previous Evening.   For Example The Whitby Crab Was A Tiny Mound Of Crab  Wet Through From The Apple Sorbet Which Was Melting Onto  It.   I Would Have Preferred Recognisable Crab On A Bed Of Salad Leaves.   So Although I Cannot Fault The Hotel I Was Disappointed With The Dinner And Would Not Recommend It To Friends.

column24: Re Interior Design - Not Too Keen On The Dining Room . Dark And Uninviting   Chairs Not Comfortable .  Staff Were Remarkably Kind And Considerate   First Class .    As You Ask For Pre Arrival Contact It Gives Me The Opportunity To Explain More Fully A Brief Check Out Discussion With Claire . I've Left Feeling A Little Uncomfortable About The Cost !   Confirmation Email 13 Sept Indicated That Breakfast And Dinner Were Reserved And Stated 'Total Cost Of Stay 'To Be Â£129.   The Total Was However Â£251 And Was Queried With Claire At Check Out . Not Convinced By Explanation But Paid Anyway . I Feel The Confirmation Note Was Confusing   Although I Did Think The Cost Shown Was Very Reasonable   Better Than The 'Offer' We Talked About On The Phone . Please Investigate And Explain .   Regards John

column46: The Duty Manager Who Was Extremely Attentive And Defused A Situation Which Had Arisen Concerning Lack Of Hot Water. The Receptionist On Duty When The Problem Was First Reported Had Not Handled The Client Well  Seeming Not To Believe His Story.  In Fact There May Be A Problem To Be Resolved In The Future As Just As We Were Leaving Another Person From One Of The Second Floor Rooms Was Reporting A Shortage Of Hot Water.

column24: The Food  Accommodation And Service Were All Excellent. We Had A Very Relaxing And Enjoyable Stay. The Talbot Is A Special Place And We Will Return. Many Thanks To You And Your Staff And Especially Our Evening Meal Waiter  A Young Man  Who Looked After Us And Was Very Pleasant And Professional.

I Was Not Notified That I Had To Book The Taster Course In Advance And Had No Option On Arrival But To Take The 9Pm Slot. It Would Be Preferred If You Had Contacted Me In Advance To Arrange. Upon Departure The Receptionist Didn't Automatically Provide Me With The Castle Howard Tickets. There Should Either Be A Notion My Bill Or These Should Have Been Provided Upon Arrival. The Quantity Of Waste In Hotels Is Tragic. The Majority Of Guests Will Understand If Measures Are Taken To Reduce Waste To Ensure Your Activities Are Sustainable. For Example Stop Using Individual Pots Of Jam And Honey But Use Reusable And Smaller Dishes. At Least Three Quarters Of My Honey Wasn't Used. Other Than Those Items A Great Package And Stay.

column28: No. 9 - Unfortunately  On The Friday We Stayed  There Was Considerable Noise (Booming Music) Which Didn't Stop Until 1.15Am  Thus Giving Us A Disturbed Nights Sleep.  We Realised This Had Nothing To Do With The Hotel  But Made A Suggestion To The Staff To Contact The Noise Abatement Officer In The Future.
column37: We Were Pleased To See That The Dining Area Was Spaciously Set Out  Unlike Some Restaurants We Have Been To In The Past  Where You Are Virtually Banging Seats!  We Think That The Overall Ambience And Attention To Detail Is A Pleasure To See.
column46: We Found Overall That All The Staff Were Courteous And Attentive To Any Questions Or Requests We Had.

column28: Room 11 Was Fabulous  Very Spacious And Lovely Views Of The Garden. The Bed Was Extremely Comfortable And Dressed With Top Quality Bed Linen The Bathroom With Roll Top Bath And Separate Rain Shower Was Of The Highest Standard .

column24: Mix Up With Dates. We Had Booked Via Secret Escapes For 4Th July But Received A Phone Msg From Talbot On The 6Th June Advising Us That We Had Not Arrived For Our Booking 4Th June. This Was Quickly Sorted Out As We Had Our Printed Booking Form To Hand  And To Compensate For Our Disappointment We Were Given An Upgrade From Norton Room To Junior Suite. Fabulous!
column37: We Had Booked For The 5 Course Tasting Menu  And Unfortunately The Portions Were Very Very Small. It Would Have Been A Good Idea To Have Been Talked Through What Was On Our Plates  For Instance  I Had To Ask If The Creamed Potato Was Missing But Apparently It Was The Tasteless Streak Of Cream On The Plate  ... And Why Two Desserts  A Cheese Course Would Have Been More Appropriate.

column28: I Know It Was Easy To Request Tea/Coffee In The Room But We Would Prefer To Be Able To Make This Ourselves And It Would Be Nice To Have Some Biscuits / Fruit On Arrival. Room 16
column50: We Were Very Fortunate To Have Glorious Weather During Our Stay But We Did Feel That The Seating Area Outside Needs To Be Developed To Allow For More Guests And A Greater Degree Of Privacy From The Road.

column15: We Have Been Coming To Malton For Over 50 Years And New The Talbot Had Been Under Renovation So Gave It A Try

column37: There Were 6 People In Our Party  One Of Whom Was Celebrating A 60Th Birthday. The Hotel Knew About The Birthday In Advace And Although I Did Not Expect A Cake I Do Think Tey Could Have Made More Effort Than Just Piping Happy Birthday In Chocolate On His Desert Plate

column24: Inside And Outside Of The Hotel Are Admirable
column28: Room 17.We Were Very Pleased With The Room We Were Allocated It Was Well Decorated Spacious And Spotlessly Clean With Lovely Views From Our Window.
column37: We Were Very Impressed With The Overall Dining Experience.The Room Was Well Decorated And Had A Relaxed Atmosphere.The Food Was Exceptional In Taste And Presentation On Each Course And Our Waitress Was A Credit To You.Her Timing Was Perfect.We Did Not Feel We Had To Wait To Long Between Courses But Neither Did We Feel Rushed At Any Stage Added To This She Was Courteous Friendly Helpful And Professional.We Were Also Impressed With Our Breakfast.
column46: Unfortunately We Did Not Get The Name Of The Waitress We Had During Our Evening Meal(.She Had Long Hair Tied Back In A Ponytail)She Was A Credit To You.Her Timing Was Perfect We Did Not Feel We Had To Wait To Long Between Courses But Neither Did We Feel Rushed At Any Stage Added To This  She Was Courteous Friendly Helpful And Professional.We Had Taken Advantage Of Your 1St Anniversary Offer And Had Decided To Have Our Bottle Of Champagne In The Bar After Our Meal Our Waitress Ordered This For Us And Brought It Our Table In The Bar She Opened It And Poured Our First Glass.We Are Most Impressed With Her Attitude And The Level Of Service She Gave Us.I Would Also Like To Mention The Chef For His Outstanding Culinary Skills.The Menu Was Most Appealing And Creative
column50: We Could Not Fault A Single Thing.
column51: We Were Most Impressed With Every Aspect Of Our Say At The Talbot Hotel.We Took Advantage Of The 1St Anniversary Offer And Feel We Had Exceptional Value For Money.We Will Most Certainly Recommend You To Our Friends And Family.
