column28: No.3 There Were No Bath Robes Or Slippers. The Toiletries In The Bath Room Did Not Include  Cotton Wool Tissues And The Hair Dryer Was Not Easy To Use......Very Difficult To Keep The Safety Button Depressed. Upon Arrival(Early Evening) We Had A Cup Of Tea In Our Room. The Dirty Tea Tray Was Still There The Following Morning. I Did Not Wish To Leave It In The Corridor  Perhaps Room Servis      No3. No Bathrobes And Slippers  Reception Told Us You Had A Problem With The Laundry Company! No Tissues Cotton Wool Buds Or Cotton Wool In The Bathroom. We Had Room Service For Two Cups Of Tea When We Arrived About 5.30Pm. The Tray Was Never Removed.I Did Not Want To Leave It In The Corridor  Perhaps It Would Be A Good Idea If Whoever Brings The Tea Suggests You Call To Have The Tray Removed. It Would Be Preferable To Have Tea/Coffee Making Facilities In The Room!     Should Have Asked Us To Call Them When We Wished The Tray Removed

When I Telephoned To Make The Booking The Receptionist Said Her Computer Was Slow And She Would Call Me Back In Five Minutes.  She Never Did.  I Had To Call Back An Hour Later.     We Booked Here As We Were Attending An Evening Wedding Reception.  We Had Travelled A Couple Of Hours  Arrived At 3Pm And Our Party Of Five Would Have Nothing To Eat Until The Reception (Approx. 9Pm).  We Asked If We Could Have Afternoon Tea Or At Least Some Refreshments And Was Told As There Was A Wedding Being Held  This Was Not Possible.  The Receptionist Did Not Offer Local Knowledge To Advise Of Somewhere We Could Go  I Had To Press For This Information And Some Recommendation As I Didn't Know The Area.  Information Was Poor.  As There Were No Tea And Coffee Making Facilities A Glass Of Water Was Not Going To Be Adequate And We Couldn't Get Anything From Your Kitchen Due To The Wedding.
column28: No Plastic Shower Cap   As The Shower Was Over Head A Plastic Shower Cap Is Necessary
column37: The Evening Reception Was A Hog Roast And Adequate But There Was No Vegetarian Option To The Pork.  Dessert Very Nice  Dining Room Very Comfortable
column50: As Previously Commented
column51: I Liked The Hotel And Location  However I Do Feel The Reception Staff Require Training Further

column24: The Front Desk Ought To Tell You Guests That Tea Is Available And Is Complementary
column28: No Soap Was Provided
column37: Would Have Preferred A Greater Quantity Of Vegetables With The Main Courses

column28: No Shower Cap Or Face Cloth
column37: Had The Tasting Menu Which Was Wonderful

column24: I Find It Difficult To Add Anything To Your Survey As Once Again We Find The Hotel And The Staff Excellent. I Think Perhaps The Menu  If It Was Possible Could Be Changed More Often. The Menu Was The Same Menu That We Had Had 6 Weeks Previously  But This Would Not Stop Us Returning To Your  Beautiful Hotel.
column28: Room 11.................Absolutely Beautiful. One Comment  The Mirror In The Bathroom Could Benefit With A Light Over The Middle As It Does Not  Seem Bright Enough For Shaving Or For Ladies Putting Their Make Up On.
column37: Once Again Faultless

column28: Tea And Coffee Tray Would Be Most Welcome  More Variety Of Bathroom Products - No Soap/Handwash/Shower/Bath Gel.. Only Products In Our Bathroom Shampoo  Conditioner And Body Lotion

column15: Entered A Competition - Offer As Did Not Win

column50: An Extra Arm Chair Was Requested And Was Provided Next Day.
column51: A Bottle Of Wine Was In The Room With Nothing To Say From Whom It Came. It Was Embarrassing When Our Friends Asked Us If We Enjoyed The Wine.(The Card Which Should Have Accompanied It Was Missing)

column24: No It Was All Fine Friendly But Not Over The Top In Fact Have Already Booked And Paid For My Son To Stay Early Novenber
column28: Silly Comment Did Not Bother Me But May Some Guests  Seemed One Of The Floorboards In Room Above Had A Problem Please Do Not Think I Am Complaining
column37: Again Could Not Fault It.

column28: There Were No Tea Making Facilities That We Could See

column24: Very Helpfull On The Phone Arranging Our Stay

column37: We

column37: I Appreciate That You May And Do Have Business People Staying But The Use Of Mobile Phones At 8Pm Is A Little Intrusive  Perhaps A Request For Them To Be On Silent Ant To Leave The Room For The Duration Of The Conversation. Just My Point Of View
column46: Young Barman Very Polite
column51: As To No 18 The Bill Is Slightly Vague As To What Exactly Had Been Purchased Ie Drinks Etc

column24: Had A Fantastic Time.  The Only Comment I Would Make Was That Other Guests Seemed A Little Rude And Made Little Effort On Their Personal Appearance And Manors.  I Appreciate The Hotel Can Do Little To Remedy This But I Would Note Some Of The Alternative Hotels We Viewed When Deciding Did Make Mention To A Dining Dress Recommendation Which May Help?
column28: I Would Have Liked A Shower Cap And More Than One Bottle Of Shower Gel As Evening And Morning Showers One Bourtie Ease Insufficient

column24: Food Was Delicious. Only Negative Was There Was No Hot Water When I Showered In The Morning.
column28: 19. I Also Had To Call About There Being No Hair Dryer - No Problem Though  The Lady Bought  One Up Straight Away
column37: Great
column50: For James Martin To Be There ;0)

column28: Room 20 We Found That There Weren't Any Face Flannels Left In Our Room On The Second Day  On Making Enquiry We Were Informed That There Wasn't Any Available Until Your Next Laundry Drop  Apparently The Room Maid Had To Collect One From An Unused Room!!!
column37: Chipped Crockery On Both Mornings  Service Not To Our Expectation On The Second Morning. Food Not Up To Standard On The Second Morning (Bacon Not The Same As On The First Morning  Over Cooked And Not Of The Same Quality)

column15: We Had Our Wedding Reception Here 1960
We Had Our Wedding Reception Here 1960

column28: Lampton Room 3 Excellent Housekeepers Very Pristine For An Older Building
column46: The Bar An Is Always Lovely And Friendly An Asset To Your Team!!!
column50: Maybe A Bit Quicker On Room Service Coffee ( Or Provide A Kettle) As I Understand Staffing May Be Tight Just A Small Point Which May May/ Not Be Helpful Not A Major Criticism As Believe Staff To Be Very Diligent And Some Things May Be Out Of Their Control
column51: Would Like Jam For Toast Next Time Please ( If Possible Missed The Nice Jam) No Negative Points Everything Lovely All Doing A Good Job

column24: Yes We Were Given A Complementary Upgrade Which Is Always A Big Plus. Thank You!
column37: What A Fantastic Meal We Had - One Of The Best Ever.

column46: The Restaurant Staff Are Excellent.

column28: Only 1 Bathrobe? Is That The Norm? Sloping Tables  Nearly Lost Our Bottle Of Champagne!!
Very Comfortable For Us And Lola (Our Dog) But It Was Very Hot.
column37: We Dined Twice In The Restaurant.  On The Second Night We Booked The Tasting Menu.  The Booking Was Accepted But On Arriving At Our Table We Were Told By The Restaurant Manager/Sommelier As There Was A Menu Change He Did Not Want To Put Too Much Pressure On The Staff.  He Still Agreed To Do It And When Asked Whether We Should Order Wine For The Meal Only Then Did He Confirm That This Was Included With The Tasting Menu And There Were 7 Glasses.  In Fact We Had Five Courses And Glasses. Also No Menu  No Explanation So We Seem To Have Missed Two Courses/Glasses.  The Restaurant Staff Were Very Willing And Very Pleasant But Did Not Seem To Know What Food They Were Serving.  That Evening The Restaurant Was Badly Managed And The Staff Although Very Willing Did Not Seem To Be In Control.
column46: Everyone Was Pleasant.
column50: Overall Our Stay Was Very Nice  Our Dog Was Also Very Satisfied But For The Price We Feel It Should Have Been More Than Just Nice - It Should Have Fabulous. It Would Have Been Helpful If Reception Had Had Available Maps And Information On The Area.
column51: Outside Our Bedroom Lambton In The Drain Gully There Was A Large Amount Of Cigarette Ends.  This Was Apparent Outside All The External Doors.  There Should Be Discreet Ashtrays For The Smokers That Clearly Do Stay At The Talbot.

column28: 18. There Was A Discarded Lid From A Product Bottle And Quite A Lot Of Dust In The Corner Behind The Bathroom Door
column37: We Appreciated That We Were One Of The First Customers To Book The 'Gourmet Stay' But The Waiter Was Unsure What Was Included And We Had A Slightly Awkward Moment When He Told Us That The Wine Would Be Charged As An Extra And Had To Go Away And Check! We Were Also Served The Wrong Drink With One Of The Courses. Having Said That - We Thoroughly Enjoyed Our Evening And Would Love To Come Back Again!

column15: My Brother Tom Bell Who Works For Sawdays Recommended The Talbot

column28: There Were No Dressing Gowns In Room 16 And No Bed/Bowl/Biscuit For Our Dog
column46: Everyone Was Particularly Kind To Our Dog.

column15: My Brother Tom Bell Works For Sawday's

column24: Change The Pork Scratchings In The Bar Seriously Though Very Pleased Great Value Thank You

column20: Everything We Hoped For

The Hotel Is Superb  The Condition And Quality Of The Decor / Fittings Is Exceptional !! The Staff Were Very Pleasant And Made Our Stay As Welcoming And Comfortable As Possible. Our Big Disappointment However Was The Restraunt. This Was The Main Reason For Our Stay  We Travelled Just Short Of 70 Miles To Experience Some Fantastic Cuisine But Were Very Disapointed. The Starter Of Crab And Apple Was So Cold It Was Practically Frozen  And The Panacotta Desert Would Not Have Been Out Of Place In A Happy Eater!  Overall The Hotel Alone I Would Award 10/10 But The Restraunt Cuisine 6/10.  Mr James Martin Would Not Have Been Impressed At All!!.
column24: No This Aspect Was First Class
column28: Once Again 10/10
column37: We Enjoy Good Food And Have Dined In Some Wonderful Restaurant's The World Over  We Expected So Much From This Dining Experience And Left The Restaurant Really Disappointed. I Had Arranged This Visit As A Birthday Treat For My Wife Because She Had Expressed A Wish To Experience The Food At James Martin At The Talbot.
column46: The Reception Staff And The Bar Manager Were Particularly Polite And Helpful  However The Waiting Staff  Particularly At Breakfast Left Us (And We Noticed Other Guests) Waiting For Service  So Long So We Had After About 15 Minutes To Go Looking For Someone And Ask Them To Take Our Order. Further Rather Than Being Offered More Coffee With Breakfast We Again Had To Stand At The Kitchen Door And Request This.
column50: I Think I've Covered Everything Previously  The Hotel Is Fabulous But The Restaraunt Is Getting By On Reputation Not On The Quality Of The Food.

column20: Very Comfortable Room  Very Friendly Staff And Wonderful Food. I Invited 2 Friends To Dine With Us And  Being From York  They Too Will Use The Restaurant In The Future.We Are From Swindon But Come To Yorkshire On Regular Trips And Hope To Be Able To Stay With You Again.
column51: We Use The Goring From Time To Time And Apart From The Obvious Grandeur Of That Hotel  The Service And Attention We Received Was No Less Enjoyable.

column20: Very Good  Only Point Was At Last Visit I Had The Room Over The Bar And It Was Quite Noisey.
column28: Not Sure Of Room Number But Can Hear Noise From The Bar.

column20: Lovely Hotel  Room And Fabulous Meal In The Evening. Breakfast In The Room Next Morning Was A Bit Disappointing -The Only Complaint.
Mediocre At Best - The Hotel Was As Expected Big Old Country House Which Was Fine But The Food Which Was The Main Reason We Visited Was Not Up To The Standard We Expected
column28: Room 14 - On A Slope !! Not Having Tea And Coffee In The Room Was Annoying Especially As I Am A Very Early Riser And Wanted A Cup Of Tea At 05:00 Am Sunday Morning - In The Bathroom The Soap Dish Was Coming Away From The Wall And The Plug Wasn't Attached Minor Niggles I Agree But Very Easy To Put Right At No Cost
column37: The Good Points   The Hotel Called Us Before We Arrived And Asked Us If We Wanted To Move Our Sitting Forward From 9:30 To 8:30. The Chap Behind The Bar 40/50S Shaved Head - Very Friendly  Knowledgeable And Helpful - A Credit To The Hotel.  The Bad Points  Saturday Dinner - Food Just Not Enough Of It - Expected Hearty Portions And Was Very Disappointed. I Have Been Fortunate To Travel Widely And Stop In Some Great Hotels With Chef Endorsements And Your Hotel Did Not Fair Well - Even In The Local Area Ruddings Park Is A Much Better Proposition For A Similar Price.  Sunday Breakfast - By Far The Worst I Have Had In A Long Time - The Staff Were All Young And Very Inexperienced - We Waited Ages To Be Served We Then Had Home Made Buttered Crumpets (Courtesy Of Warburtons) - Some Very Anaemic Looking Toast Without Jam Apparently Strawberry Or Anything But Raspberry Is Not Available In Yorkshire (We Asked) And A Full English Which Was Ok - That Said I've Had Much Much Better.  We Came To Your Hotel For The Food Because Of James Martin And Left Very Disappointed.
column46: As Before - The Chap Behind The Bar
column51: Step Up On The Food - If You Want To Remain A Destination Hotel You Need To Realise You Have Stiff Competition At Ruddings Park  Pipe And Glass And Swinton Park All Of Which I Would Revisit - Sadly I Will Not Be Coming Back To The Talbot.

column28: No 6.. We Found Previous Guests Clothing In Our Wardrobe
column37: I Found Pet Hair On My Breakfast Plate.. Which I Left. The Evening Dinner & Staff Were Excellent!! I Had To Find A Member If Staff At Breakfast Time
column50: I Was There A While After Breakfast Yet No Manager Or Anyone Came To Apologise For The Clothing In The Wardrobe Or Pet Hairs In My Breakfast.. We Felt Very Unimportant.
column51: No

column20: A Comfortable  Courteous  Friendly Stay In A Lovely Room With Excellent Food.
column28: Room 12. The Room Was Cold When We Arrived As The Radiators In Both Bathroom And Bedroom Were Off. It Took A While For The Bathroom To Warm Up!  The Shower Was Efficient But It Would Have Been Better To Have A Side Spray As Well ( Mrs Sterland) And Also A Shower Cap Provided.
column46: The Serving Staff In The Restaurant Were Particularly Friendly. Sorry I Can't Recall Names.
column50: No We Thoroughly Enjoyed Our Stay.

column20: A Quality Experience  Food Exceptional  Staff Excellent  No Complaints.

Extremely Comfortable Room And Lounges  Staff Were Excellent In All Areas And Food Interesting And M Ostly Delicious.

column46: The Man Attending The Bar Was Friendly And Helpful At All Times And Made Us Feel Very Well Looked After.
column50: No
column51: Thoroughly Enjoyed Our Stay And Hope To Be Back Soon.

The Food Was Lovely And In The Dining Room Service Was Good.

column51: Great Location And Lovely Hotel. Good Quality Food. To Improve You Need To Anticipate Guests Needs A Little More. Great Location For York And Castle Howard And Overall We Had A Flexing Weekend

column24: Receptionist Was Extremely Helpful
column28: A Quiet Room At Side Of Hotel  No Disturbances At All Perfect ..
column37: Superb Food  In Restaurant And In Bar Area.Wonderful Menu [I Do Believe We Have Tasted Everything On It Now ] But The Taster Menu Was Fantastic ....Thanks To Craig  Jake And The Very Talented Chefs There.
column46: We Think They Are All Very Special!  Thanks To Hayley And Francesca For Looking After[And Putting Up With!] Our Yorkie  The Lovely Front Of House Ladies And Gentlemen Who Served Us.To Craig And Jake [Who Spoilt Us With His New Taster Menu Dishes]And Fabulous Kitchen Staff .There Are Two In Particular Deserve A Mention ..Dom  For Enticing Us With The Offers! And Steve The Bar Man  He Is Such An Asset We Love His Sense Of Humour  Backchat Knowledge And Excellent Service.
column50: Nothing I Can Think Of ! Maybe Having James Martin To Join Us As A Guest..In My Dreams !![Couldn't Keep Him Out Of The Kitchen !!]
column51: See You On The 1St And 17Th December!!....Cannot Wait To Come And Stay !!

column20: An Enjoyable Break  Some Excellent Young Staff  Especially In The Restaurant. Food In Restaurant Fine But My Wife Would Have Preferred Some Plainer Choices.
column24: Room On Second Floor And Carried Our Own Luggage. Receptionist Asked If We Required Any Help But The Bags Should Have Been Taken To The Room Without Us Being Asked.

column37: We Would Be Most Likely To Stay Bed And Breakfast And Book A Meal Depending On The Menu Content For That Night. We Would Use The Restaurant For Special Occasions.
column46: Two Of The Restaurant Staff Were Exceptional  One Young Man And One Young Lady But I Regret That I Don't Know Their Names. A Young Lady On Reception Was Excellent. All Of These Were A Credit To The Talbot And Themselves. I Regret  That I Don't Know Their Names They Deserve Credit.
column50: Not That We Can  At This Time  Think Of
column51: I Thought That The Prices For Drinks In Bar Were Very Reasonable And The Selection Very Good

column20: Lovely Food In A Friendly  Relaxed Atmosphere
Wonderful.
First Class Lovely Rooms Great Service And Value For Money
column24: No Issues At All
column37: Probably My Fault For Not Stating How I Wanted It Cooked However I Found The Lambs Liver Extremely Undercooked
column46: Steve The Batman And Dominic (Wine Water) Excellent
column50: No
column51: A Very Enjoyable Break

column20: Very Friendly And Hospitable  Rooms Well Equipped Although Ours (9) Was On The Main Road  Is Poorly Lit  Dressing Table Mirror Height Is Poor And Room Has A Very Uneven Floor (Not Much You Can Do About The Last). Restaurant Veloutes  Starters  Desserts Excellent  But 3 Out Of 3 Main Courses (We Shared The Cote De Boeuf On Evening 2) Were Poor. My Wife's Halibut On Evening 1 Was Overcooked Enough For Her Not To Eat And For Us To Tell The Waitress  Who Said She'd Tell The Chef  But We Heard No More About It. Both Breakfasts Were Disappointing - Service Was Very Slow  Large Selection Of Teas Did Not Include Rooibos  Cooked Dishes Were Nothing Special.
column28: Room 9 - Already Commented On In General Impressions
column50: With Such A Small Menu  And James Martin's Influence  Expertise And Reputation  It Was Very Disappointing To Be Served Poor Main Courses And For Our Comments Not To Have Been Acknowledged.
column51: Wines By The Glass Excellent - Especially The South African Bon Courage Robertson Valley Shiraz. South Africa Has Only Recently Started Using The Shiraz Grape Variety  And This Wine Is A Real Find

column20: We Really Enjoyed Our Stay. The Hotel  Service And Food Were All Excellent.
column24: Reception Staff Were Very Helpful And Knowledgeable About The Hotel  Rooms On Offer Etc.
column37: The Food Was Fantastic. We Had The Taster Menu But We Didn't Realise That The Courses Did Not Come With Any Potatoes/Chips Or Vegetables. It Might Have Been Nice To Have A Side Order - The Waiters/Waitress Could Have Asked If We Wanted Any Side Orders.
column50: Would Have Been Nice To Have A Biscuit With Coffee/Tea In Room.
column51: We Had Breakfast In The Side Dining Room. There Were Only Three Couples In That Room And It Was Very Quiet. The Main Dining Room Looked More Inviting/Had More Of An Atmosphere/Music Playing.  It's A Minor Point Really - The Breakfast Was Excellent As Was Dinner.

column20: Excellent But Found The Menu Not To My Taste  I Don't Think The Menu Would Suffer From Having A Simple Steak Dish On It. The Menu As It Stands Will Prevent Me From Staying At The Talbot Again.
column37: See Previous Comments.

column20: We Really Enjoy Our Stays With You. The Atmosphere Is Lovely  Nothing Pretentious Or Stuffy. The Staff Are  Warm And Welcoming  Making Us Feel Very Much 'At Home'.  The Food Is Excellent  But We Would Have Liked To See A    More Lunchtime Focused Menu Rather Than Choosing From The Same Evening Menu. That Apart  Wonderful!!
column24: We Were Delighted To Be Given An Upgrade To A Suite  And Were Taken To Our Accommodation By A Most Pleasant  And Helpful Receptionist And Who Apologised For The Lack Of A Lift! Such A Beautiful Old House Would Be Spoilt By Such An Addition. On Booking We Were Immediately Sent Details Of Our Stay. Very Efficient.
column28: We Stayed In Room  24  Fitzwilliam Suite (An Up- Grade) Although There Was A Television In The Small Sitting Room With A Sofa  This  Room Did Seem A Little Spartan  In Contrast To The Main Bedroom. We Thought That Perhaps A Sofa At The Foot Of The  Four Poster Would Have Been A Pleasant Addition To The Two Somewhat Hard Side Chairs In The Bedroom. But These Observations Apart   The Room Was Beautifully Decorated . We Loved The Heavy Interlined Curtains And Matching Scatter Cushions   Crisp White Linen And The Huge Four Poster Bed. The Side Lighting Was A Little Dim And Would Have Liked The Lamps To Have Been A Bit Brighter For Reading. The Lack Of A Walk-In Shower Cubicle Was An Issue As Neither Of Us Is Able To Climb Into A Bath With A Shower Over  But As This Was Only An Overnight Stay We Managed With The Washbasin.
column37: Lovely Room To Dine  For Whatever Event.
column46: Unfair To Select Individuals As Our Experience Was Of Exceptional Service From All Members Of The'team' Our Congratulations To All Who Made Our Stay So Special
column50: No;Our Stays With You Are Wonderful ( And We Have Stayed And Dined In Many Top Hotels Throughout The Uk )
column51: We Would Just Like To Say  Please  Don't Lower Your Standards. We Think You Have Got The Formula Just Right.  We Have Known Hotels Where They Have Overstretched Themselves And In Consequence Standard Have Fallen Eg People Waiting For Long Periods In The Dining Room To Be Served.

column20: Great Stay Fantastically Attentive Staff. Warm Rooms  Very Comfortable Dining Room.
column24: Helpful Staff Who Called Me Back Within A Half Hour Time Slot. Very Efficient.
column28: Would Have Preferred Tea And Coffee Making Facilities With The Room.
column37: My Husband Ordered A Further Glass Of Wine To Accompany His Main Course. This Did Not Arrive And Was Questioned. It Was Brought During The Desert Course. We Felt The Staff Worked Hard Were Polite And Friendly But Having All Staff Covering All Tables Ended With Either Duplication Of Questions I.E. We Were Asked By 3 Different Members Of Staff If We Had Ordered Wine And Whether We Wanted Water On The Table. We Had Already Ordered These In The Bar. Maybe Designating Staff To Tables May Help. Or We Didn't Receive What We Ordered At An Appropriate Time
column50: I Would Like To See Vegetables Served With The Main Meal Or It Pointed Out The Vegetables Are Not A Part Of The Main Meal And Side Orders Should Be Considered.
column51: We Are Returning On 28Th December For 5 Nights With A Friend. We Are Looking Forward To This . Really Appreciate How Dog Friendly The Hotel Is 5 Stars For That Alone

column20: Excellent Service & Quality. Would Recommend Highly!
column24: No

column20: Outstanding Hotel & Service  With The Very Nice Surprise Of A Free Room Upgrade  Which Was Unexpected  But Really Appreciated As The Stay Was For A Birthday Present.  All The Staff Were Extremely Attentive & Will Definately Be Returning In The Future.
column24: All Aspects Of The Stay Were Exemplary  From Booking & Check-In  Restaurant & Bar Service  Right The Way Through To Checking Out.
column28: Room #4  As Previously Stated  An Unexpected  But Very Much Appreciated Free Upgrade To A Suite. Really Well Appointed & One Of The Best Hotel Rooms/Suites I Have Stayed In.
column37: This Was The Main Reason For Our Stay At The Hotel  Being James Martin Fans & Having Eaten At His Other Restaurants  The Talbot Hotel Restaurant & Menu Did Not Dissappoint!
column46: All Members Of The Hotel & Restaurant Staff Were Really Helpful & Nothing Was Too Much Trouble.  Special Note To The Gentleman That Was Serving In The Bar & Arranging Restaurant Tables/Bookings (Sorry  Didn't Notice His Name)  But Was Very Attentive & Remembered Our Room Number & Drinks Order. Excellent
column50: I Find It Difficult To See How Our Experience Could Have Been Made Any Better.
column51: A Very Enjoyable Stay & Will Definatley Be Returning To The Talbot.

column20: We Had Another Very Enjoyable Stay At The Talbot. The Hotel Is So Comfortable  Rooms Are Very Well Equipped  The Staff Are Very Pleasant And Welcoming  Yet Always Professional. The Food Was Very Good  With A Decent Selection Of Wines To Accompany.
column24: The Arrival And Departure Dates On The Confirmation Email Seemed To Be Inverted. I Made A Quick Call To Confirm The Correct Details And Your Helpful Receptionist Informed Me That This Was An Occasional Quirk Of The System.
column28: Room 3 Was Very Comfortable And Well Appointed With A Particularly Beautiful Bathroom.
column46: All The Staff Were Extremely Helpful  But The Barman Has Been Particularly Entertaining On Both Our Visits  Whilst Still Being Knowledgeable And Attentive. I'm Sorry That I Can't Remember His Name.
column50: A Pinot Noir By The Glass Would Have Been Great  Although The Selection Of Wine By The Glass Was Otherwise Good.
column51: We Really Enjoy Staying At The Talbot  To The Extent That We Have Booked Our Son's Wedding Here In 2015. The Ambience Is Wonderful  Bedrooms Are Very Well Appointed   Food And Drink Very Good  And Staff Professional Yet Welcoming. We Will Continue To Recommend It To Friends

column46: Steve In The Bar  Was Excellent At His Job And Very Knowledgable He Was Very Informative On The Selection Of Drinks Available In Particular The Different Types Of Gin. Overall We Felt Very Well Looked After By All The Staff At The Talbot.

column20: Very Good
column24: When I Originally Booked (Which Was For My 50Th Birthday Which I Was Paying For) I Asked For Everything To Be On One Bill  On Arrival It Had Been Split Onto 5 Bills  Luckily I Noticed And Changed It
column28: Bathrobes Not In Room
column37: The Plates Were Cold For The Beef  Which Made The Food Cold Very Quick  Also Had To Ask "Numerous" Times For Ketchup And Butter (There Were 10 In Our Party)
column51: Even Though I Had A Few Complaints  I Would Definitely Come Back Again And Would Recommend  I Just Feel At The Price These Things Should Be Noted

column20: Brilliant. It Was A Treat For My Mother's Birthday She Is Now 91 - And She Looked Forward To It For Weeks. Her Only Disappointment Was That It Was Not One Of The Occasions When James Martin Was Present! But I Had Explained To Her That Like Me He Is An Exile From Yorkshire Who Now Lives Near Winchester. What A Coincidence. (My Mother Lives In York Where I Grew Up. I Now Live In The Centre Of Winchester.))
column24: Everything Ran Like Clockwork.
column28: I Think It Was 27? My Mother Got A Little Breathless Getting There. That Was My Fault. I Should Have Requested A Ground Floor Room. But Then - I Assumed There Would Be A Lift. I Realise Now Of Course That The Hotel Is A Listed Building.
column37: Yes. I Thought The Tables Were Well Spaced. There Was Soft Background Music - Not At All Intrusive - So We Could Hear What We Were Saying To Each Other Without Having To Listen To Other People's Conversations.
column50: Well - A Minor Whinge. I Would Have Liked A Hospitality Tray In My Bedroonm. I Mentioned This At Reception And Was Told That The Aim Was That We Should Be Looked After And Not Have To Do Anything Other Than Ring Down With A Request. But When I Am Away From Home I Like To Have A Cup Of Tea In Bed And Watch Breakfast Tv - Not Open The Door To Greet Room Service In My Dressing Gown!
column51: No. Just Thank You Very Much For A Wonderful Break. I Hope To Bring Mum Again.

column20: A Comfortable Stay  Staff Very Attentive And Pleasant. A Mild Criticism  Perhaps It Needs To Be A Little More Obvious As Far As Evening Meals Are Concerned What Is Included As Part Of Any Package Deal .On Our First Evening We Were Unaware That Side Dishes Were Available.Otherwise We Very Much Enjoyed The Food. Sorry We Were Unable To Stay Longer.
column24: Efficient Throughout
column37: See Previous. Red Wine Served By The Glass Was Much Too Warm ( An Ice Cube Served With The Water Solved The Problem !!!).
column50: We Noted An Absence Of Information Regarding The Surrounding Area.

column20: Perfect

column37: Again Perfect

column20: Service Was Excellent.  Do You Use Different Food To The Rest Of Us To Get It Tasting So Good?
column24: Everything Was Handled Very Efficiently And With Friendliness.

column20: Wonderful.  My Husband And I Loved Every Minute.  We Felt We Had The Red Carpet Treatment From The Moment We Arrived.  Wonderful Room And Wonderful Food And Wonderful Staff.  Well Done.
column46: The Waitress (Polish/Yorkshire) Was Very Helpful And Attentive.
column51: Please Put More Offers On Like The Autumn Getaway.  It Really Caught My Eye For The Value.  Mid Week Offers Like That Would Always Appeal To Me As I Work For Myself.

column20: What Struck Me Most Was The Pleasant And Welcoming Manner From All The Staff.  From The Moment We Walked In At Reception  To Being Taken Care Of By The Young Porter Through To The Bar And Restaurant.  We Were Made To Feel At Home And That Nothing Was Too Much Trouble.    As The Restaurant Was Fully Booked And We Were Taking The Tasting Menu We Were Fearful That The Service May Suffer.  This Wasn't The Case Everything Was Served With Perfect Timing By The Friendly Waitresses.    We Anticipated The Food To Be Good  But We Did Not Expect It To Be So Outstanding.  The Belly Port Was The Best I Have Ever Tasted And Would Return To The Talbot Just For That!  Excellent Experience And Have Recommended To Friend Who Is Looking For A Special Gift For His Wife  So More Wakey Folk Heading Your Way.  Many Thanks.  Gail Glover
column24: Warm  Friendly And Helpful.
column37: As Per My Previous Comments  Outstanding!
column46: The Young Man  Porter  Who Was So Welcoming.  The Bar Tender Who Made A Real Effort In Engaging Everyone In The Bar Having Pre-Dinner Drinks.  The Young Waitresses Who Served Us  Both Were Friendly And Mature Beyond Their Years.
column50: Perhaps A Little Background Music In The Restaurant.  Not Loud But Very Aware Of Everyone's Conversations As The Room Was Extremely Quiet.  I Understand This Is A Personal Preference And It Did Not Detract For Me But I Would Have Preferred.
column51: Well Done And Thank You!

column20: Thoroughly Enjoyable. Excellent Food. Friendly Staff. Upgraded Room Just Added To The Overall Experience   Making It A Very Special Birthday Treat For My Husband. Loved It.
column24: Slight Confusion When Trying To Book On Line  As The Email Would Not Send From Our Computer   So My Husband Made Reservation By Phone. Not Sure All Other Hotels Would Have Done That  So Well Done To That Person.
column28: Lovely Comfortable Bed. Pretty View From Window. Only Comment Re Bathroom  Which Was Luxurious  Was Lack Of Bath/Shower Gel. On Request Some Was Provided But Surprisingly Only One Sample  And There Were 2 Of Us. This Was Very Minor Point  But May Be Of  Consideration For Future Guests.
column37: We Had The Tasting Menu With Wines Which Was Delightful. The Wines Were Very Well Matched To The Food. The Service Was Efficient And Friendly.

column20: Booked Over The Phone  And Tried To Reserve A Table In The Restaurant And Was Not Possible Due To Being Fully Booked. Asked If We Could Eat In The Bar And That Was No Problem To Reserve Room For Us. On Arrival I Asked If There Were Any Cancellations In The Restaurant And They Were Non  And Said We Would Be Happy Eating In The Bar Still To Be Told There Was No Room In The Bar Area Either  Which Is Unfair And Not Acceptable. That Was Partly The Reason For Staying With You To Try The Food. Ended Up Eating In Town Which Was Great  And Our Room Was On The Landing To Be Woken Up Around 11Pm By Lots Of Guests Shouting And Messing Around On The Landing. Easy To Get To And Lady On Reception Helpful. Breakfast Was Nice And The Room Was Ok Too.
column28: Room 5 Bathroom Was Big With A Good Shower. Comfortable Bed. Had To Turned The Heating Completely Off As The Room Heated Up Very Quickly But That Was Not A Problem. The Room Was Nicely Decorated.

In A Quality Hotel His Feet Would Not Touch The Ground

column20: Very Good Experience.

column20: Amazing Food  Very Helpful And Friendly Staff  Good Value For Money.
column24: Very Helpful Staff. Poor Traffic On The Way Up Meant We Were Late Arriving. We Called Ahead To Say We Might Not Be In Time For Our Dinner Reservation. Staff Were  Extremely Accommodating And Kept Our Table For Us.
column37: Food Was Amazing. Jay Rayner's Review Of The Restaurant In The Observer Was The Main Reason We Visited The Hotel In The First Place

column20: We Had An Extremely Enjoyable Time Staying At The Talbot. The Staff Were Excellent  The Perfect Balance Of Friendliness And Professionalism.  The Decor Of The Hotel Was Charming  Welcoming And Comfortable. The Bedrooms Lovely With Quality Linen. The Food Was Very High Quality. Overall An Excellent Stay.
column24: It Was Very Professional And Although Our Dinner Booking Had Been Put In On The Wrong Day  It Was Changed Without Fuss Or Fluster.
column28: The Bedroom Was Charming With A Very Good Quality Bed And Linen. The Soft Furnishing Were Excellent Quality And The Bathroom A Good Size And Quality. The Only Reason I Didn't Strongly Agree Is That I Wouldn't Have Called The Room Luxurious. I Was In A Malton Room. I Thought The Room Was Of A High Standard And Very Good Value.  I Did Not Have Bathrobes But On Request They Appeared Immediately. Again Excellent Service.
column37: Our Dining Experience Was Excellent  The Room  Staff And Food Were All Really Fantastic. My Only Comments Would Be That The Tables Took A Long Time To Clear Once People Had Finished. Whilst It Is Horrible To Be Rushed  The Plates Were Left For Quite A While. Also The Wine Was Not Replenished At All During The Meal. It Is Not Nice To Be Bothered All The Time But A Couple Of Times Would Have Been Appreciated. However These Are Minor Things And Did Not Affect Our Enjoyment Of The Evening. I Must Stress The Waiters And Waitresses Were All Charming And Made A Huge Effort To Ensure Our Evening Was Pleasurable. The Comments Are Merely Observations Not Complaints.
column46: Steve - Bar Manager/Duty Manager - He Was Excellent  Professional  Friendly And Charming Emily - Waitress - A Really Charming And Friendly Young Lady - Really Made That Extra Effort With The Customers Jeremy - Gm - Although On A Night Off  He Took Time To Chat To Us When We Bumped Into Him At A Local Hostelry And Kindly Remembered Us In A Message To Steve.
column50: Had Some Marmite For My Toast At Breakfast!
column51: I Would Just Like Thank Jeremy And His Team For A Really Super Two Night Stay.

column20: Our Two Night Stay At The Talbot Was Excellent. The Rooms Were Fitted Out To A Very High Standard; The Staff Were Very Good Indeed  Without Being Over-Bearing; And The Food - Especially The Tasting Menu Was Superb  And Very Good Value. The Telegraph's Recent Review Of The Hotel Does Not Reflect The Realities On The Ground And Does Your Hotel A Dis-Service. My Only Disappointment Was That The Staff Did Nothing To Acknowledge We Were On Our Honeymoon  Not Even A 'Congratulations' (Even Thought I Ordered Flowers And Champagne For My New Wife Through The Hotel When I Made The Booking). I Would Have Expected More Of A Personal Touch From The Talbot.
column28: Tea Making Facilities Would Be A Welcome Addition  As Would Bathrobes.
column50: As Mentioned Earlier  It Would Have Been Nice If Your Staff Had Acknowledged We Were Honeymooning - If Only With A 'Congratulations'. The Service/Treatment We Received Was Excellent - But  Sadly  There Was Nothing To Set It Apart From A Large Hotel Chain In This Particular Respect.

column20: It Was Our Wedding Anniversay We Had A Complimentary Upgrade The Room (Watson)Was Lovely We Also Had The Tasting Menu With The Flight Of Wine It Was Delicious. You Have Things Right We Have No Negative Comments. Only To Say We Will Look Forward To Staying With You Again

column37: We Had Booked The Gourmet Experience And 'Wine Flight'.  Wines Seemed To Arrive A Few Moments Before The Food Which Was Good.  However  One Course Was Missing Wine Altogether Until Waiting Staff Were Prompted.  Coffee & Brandy Were Not Offered At All And We Were Told That Some Guests Don't Want Coffee.  We Thought We Should At Least Be Asked.  When Coffee Was Served In The Sitting Room There Was No Brandy And This Had To Be Requested Again Separately.  It Was These Issues Plus The One Related To Checking Out That Stopped Our Stay Being Exceptional.
column50: The Dining Experience Could Have Been Better In Respect Of Wines Coffee Etc.  On Checking Out Wines Were Added As An Extra Item As Well As Being Included In The Overall Cost.  The Item Was Removed But No Apology Was Forthcoming.  With Missing Wines  Brandy And Double Charging I Was Left With The Feeling That I Was A Means Of Increasing Pure Profit.
column51: Other Than The Comments Here The Overall Stay Was Excellent  The Food Was Beyond Expectations As Were The Wines.

column37: There Were A Few Stand Out Courses During The Meal But I Felt The Service Could Have Been To Higher Standard. Etc

The Setting In Malton Is Lovely.  We Were Warmly Welcomed By The Bar Manager When We Arrived At About 14:00 Although Our Room Wasn't Ready Until About 15:30.  The Room Was Fine.  Our Main Gripe Is About The Restaurant.  We Had A Drink In The Bar Beforehand.  Outside The Bar On A Table Were Dishes Of Olives And Nuts.  No-One In The Bar Was Offered Or Given These - So Not Really Sure What They Were For.  When We Came Back Into The Bar After Our Meal  The Tray Full Of Olives And Nuts Were Still There.  The Service In The Restaurant Wasn't Particularly Attentive.  At The End Of The Meal  Our Dessert Plates Were Left; No-One Offered Us Coffee Or An After Dinner Drink Or Asked Us If Everything Was Ok.  Eventually  After About 20 Minutes Waiting  We Left The Restaurant And No-One Acknowledged Us Leaving.  It Was A Bit Disappointing  Particularly As It Very Obviously Wasn't The Treatment Everyone In The Restaurant Was Receiving.  We Will Come Back To The Talbot As The Positives Outweighed The Negatives But We Were Disappointed On Our First Visit  Particularly As Some Very Good Friends Had Been So Effusive About Their Stay.

column20: Very Relaxing And Welcoming. A Great Atmosphere Of Ease Pervades The Talbot.  Nothing Apparently Too Much Trouble For Staff - Who Give Attentive Yet Unobtrusive Service. We Have Lunched Several Times At The Talbot. This Was The First Overnight Stay. Very Comfortable Rooms  Excellent Wifi And Quality Bathrooms. Would Only Say We Have Noticed An Increasing Tendency With The Menu To Get 'Over-Interesting/Eclectic' So That A Bit Limited Dinner Menu Choice For Those For Who Do Not Like Game Or Birds Or Beef Cheek  Especially Given The Chef's Style Of Cooking A Point Or  For Our Taste  A Bit Underdone. But Thoroughly Enjoyed The Whole Experience And This Is Only Meant As Constructive Feedback.
column24: Efficient E Mail Contact After Initial Phone Call. A Problem With Our Room (Not Separated Twin Beds And On The 2Nd Floor With A Bit Too Many Stairs For My Elderly Mother) Was Willingly And Easily Sorted Out Without Fuss. A Nice And Appreciated Touch Was That The Receptionist Actually Showed Us To Our Room On Arrival.
column28: Room 23. No Tissues Or Cotton Wool Left Out - Just The Empty Tissue Box And Cotton Wool Bowl In Cupboard Under Sink As Though Forgotten. Not An Issue Though. Bathroom Standard Very Good - Eg Plenty Of Hot Water And Good Shower). Penhaligon Products A Good Touch.
column37: See Earlier Comment Re Menu Which Is Getting A Bit Eclectic. My Mother's Liver Was Slightly Underdone. Appreciated Being Able To Have Getting  A Steak 'Off Menu' Which Was Fine Since I Have Learned From Previous Meals At The Talbot That When You Want A Steak Medium You Have To Ask For Well Done Otherwise It Comes A Bit Red. The Chairs Have Quite A Lean Back And Are Much More Comfortable With A Cushion. But Overall We Much Enjoyed The Dinner. Again Am Only Wishing To Give Constructive Feedback As We Like The Talbot So Much. It's Just That We Think The Menu Could Do With A Little Tweaking So As To Offer A More Balanced Choice For The Presumably Wide Range/Different Types Of Guests You Have/Wish To Attract. Being Able To Have Coffee Afterwards In The Drawing Room Adds Greatly To The Relaxed And Enjoyable Experience.
column46: I'm Afraid I Don't Know His Name  But The Gentleman Who Is In Charge Of The Bar/Tea Service Etc Is Splendid. We Have Met/Been Looked After By Him Several Times When Coming For Lunch As Well As Most Recent Overnight Stay. He Has Such A Good Touch - Combining Authority With Geniality. Discreetly Observant  He Anticipates One's Needs. All Staff Are Good - Cheerful And Efficient.
column50: Not Really (Apart From Menu - See Earlier Comments). We Think The Talbot Has A Winning Formula.
column51: I Have Noted With Interest Some Of The Events And Offers That The Talbot Does. I Hope To Attend Some Of Them When They Coincide With My Being In Yorkshire. Also Your Christmas House Party Looks Tremendously Appealing And I Have It In Mind For Next Year Should You Be Repeating It. Meanwhile Well Done With Your Recent (2012) 'Relaunch' And Restoration.

column20: Lovely Experience - Highlight Was The Restaurant Food  Service And Atmosphere. Whilst Accomodation Was Promising - We Became Very Disappointed In The Noise From The Kitchen Fans Heard In Room 23. My Husband Is A Light Sleeper - We Needed To Request The Fans Were Switched Off At 10.45 On Both Nights Of Our Stay - They Were His 'Wake Up Call' On Both Mornings  So Not The Most Restful Break Away. We Still Await The Promised Apology Call !!
column24: All Fine With This Service
column28: Room 23 Is Luxurious But For Us Sadly  Not So Well Appointed In Respect Of Noisy Kitchen Fans - As Previously Mentioned ... We Were Advised Of A Call By Way Of Apology From The Manager  But This Has Not Transpired...We Are Not People To Make A Fuss But This Did Put A Damper On An Otherwise Happy Wedding Anniversary Celebration.I Am A Great Fan Of James Martin And Hope To Return ... But Not To Room 23 !!
column37: Splended - Hope To Meet James Martin When In Residence At Some Point In The Future
column46: Waiter In The Bar Was Particularly Friendly - Young Dining Room Staff Were Particulary Courteous And Helpful.
column50: Would Have Exceeded ... But Was Let Down With Noise Issues In The Room And Lack Of Promised Follow Up Call !

column20: Lovely  Friendly Hotel  Food Exceptional
column46: Bar Manager And Waitress Were Exceptionally Helpful
column50: When Booking In They Could Advise You That There Are No Tea And Coffee Facilities But They Could Be Ordered Separately. Different Glasses Could Be Provided For Red & White Wines  We Used The Same Glasses For Both.

column20: Fantastic!  The Food  Room  Service And Ambience Exceeded Our Expectations. It Was A Wonderful Weekend And We Wished We Could Have Stayed Longer!
column28: 24 - It Was Stunning!
column37: It Was That Good That We Discussed Whether We'd Take The 4 Hour Round Trip Just To Eat The Beef Again!
column46: Everybody We Met Were Fabulous   All Polite  Helpful  Knowledgeable And Friendly.

column20: Very Enjoyable Mini'break.
column24: On Arrival The Receptionist Was On A Telephone Call  Which Lasted For Several Minutes  Before She Acknowledged Us. In My Opinion It Would Have Been Much Better Had She Put The Caller On Hold  For A Couple Of Seconds  To Greet Us And Tell Us She Would Be Able To Deal With Us Shortly. Only A Minor Point  But We Weren't The Only People Waiting And It Would Have Been More Welcoming Had She Done As I Suggest.
column28: Silverfish Seen In Bathroom During The Night
column37: Slightly Disappointed To Be Given The Same Menu For Dinner That We Had Had For Lunch During The Previous Week

column20: Very Comfortable And Good Food. Staff Were Very Friendly And Helpful
column24: The Hotel Phoned To Inform Us That It Would Be Busy And Offered Alternative Dates Should We Not Wish To Be Disturbed By The Event.
column28: The Sash On The Window Was Broken  And It Did Not Seen Possible To Open The Double Glazing To Allow Air In
column37: The Food Is Excellent  And Other Friends Dine There Regularly Too And Comment On The Standard

column20: I Would Like To Say Faultless As You Tried So Hard And This Was Obvious. We Have A Couple Of Unusual Moans Which We Would Never Have Raised  But Since You Ask: Our Room Was Splendid But It Was Too Hard For Me To Shave And For My Wife To Apply Make Up Due To The Distance To The Mirror In The Bathroom. I Would Suggest For Our Room A Stand Alone Mirror. You Have A Tea/Coffee On Request Policy Which For Me Is Great But My Wife Likes To Have A Cuppa Before I Awake And Would Never Bother Anyone With Such A Request From Reception So Whilst This Is A Nice Touch Left Us Don't Wish To Bother Anyone British Folk Thirsty. But These Items Did Not Spoil Our Visit So Will Not Appear On Trip Adviser.
column28: Please See Previous Comments  Cannot Recall Number But My Surname Is May And We Stayed On 2Nd Dec 13

column20: We Stayed Specifically For The James Martin Gourmet Evening And Enjoyed The Experience Very Much
We Wanted A Nice Relaxing Weekend Away In A Nice Hotel And That Us Exactly What We Had
Very Enjoyable Also Warm And Friendly Staff
Lovely Place Slightly Erratic Service Very Friendly
column46: Bar Manager Very Welcoming

column20: Most Enjoyable From Start To Finish. The Staff Are Attentive Without Being In Your Face And The Food And Accommodation Were Excellent As Always
column51: Look Forward To Seeing You Again In The Not Too Distant Future

column20: Very Relaxing Place To Come To With Attentive Staff And Good Food. The Offer That We Accepted Was Very Good Value For Money.
column24: Staff Attitude Was Very Relaxed But Attentive.
column37: Good Value For Money In The Tasting Menu.

column15: Many Of The Above Plus Tv And Radio! I Have Heard About The Hotel And Restaurant For So Long And Was Waiting Forthe Opportunity To Come!
column20: I Cannot Begin To Put Into Words The Amazing Time We Had. The Food Was Out Of This World And The Staff Were Amazingly Friendly. We Felt Incredibly Cared For Yet It Was Not Intrusive And I Have Never Felt So Relaxed. We Also Could Not Believe How Welcoming You Were To Our Dog. Walking In And Seeing The Hotel I Was Incredibly Nervous About Bringing Our Dog In As It Was Immaculate But Nothing Was A Bother.To Be Able To Enjoy Such Amazing Surroundings  Such A Fabulous Room And Fine Dining And Allow A Dog In Tow - I Did Not Think We Would Ever Get To Stay Like That Once Pooch Was Around! To Say You Are Dog Friendly Is An Understatement. We Cannot Thank You And Your Team Enough.
column24: I Emailed In Advance To Check About Out Dog Coming And The Positive Response Was Incredibly Quick! Friendly  Welcoming - We Were Bowled Over From Arrival.
column28: 25 For A Dog Friendly Room It Was Immaculate And Far More Luxurious Than We Were Expecting!  View From The Bath And Shower Is Incredible!  My Better Half Would Have Gladly Stood In The Shower All Day And Rated It As The Best Shower Ever!!!
column37: Words Cannot Describe!! Food Was Out Of This World And We Do Not Believe It Can Be Topped Anywhere. Incredibly Menu That Was An Experience Rather Than Just Food. To This Day We Do Not Know How It Was Done But That Is All Part Of The Magic. The Taste Buds Just Kept Tingling! Only Problem Is..Whatever We Eat Now Is Just Not The Same. What We Thought Was Good Food Pales Into Insignificance. For 2 Hours We Simply Enjoyed And Lost Ourselves In The Food  For 2 Avid People Watchers We Did Not Even Notice There Was Anyone Else In The Restaurant - It Was Just Us And That Amazing Food! Thank You Is Not Enough!!
column46: Chef - For Obvious Reasons!  But The Whole Team Were Amazing And Work Incredibly Hard. Thank You
column50: Nothing At All! Best Experience Ever
column51: We Will Be Back As Soon As We Can!!

column46: Best Food I Ever Eaten

column20: Very Good
column28: Shower Head Too Close To Taps Toilet Roll Holder In Wrong Position
column37: Portion Size A Bit Too Small

column20: Very Comfortable - Nice To Have Fresh Tea/Coffee Served In Room When Wanted And Not 'Do It Yourself'  Also Nice To Be Able To Bring Our Dog.  The Only Area Of Slight Disappointment Was The Bar Area - Did Not Have The Same Atmosphere As The Rest Of The Hotel And Not As Comfortable.
column28: 4.  We Booked The Sunday Night Deal  Couldn't Get A Standard Room So Booked The Next Grade  However We Were Given A Suite Which Was Very Nice.  Double Glazing Would Have Helped In The Bedroom Part Of The Suite - Very Noisy Corner.
column37: Would Have Preferred To Be In The Main Dining Room For Sunday Lunch.

column20: Absolutely Lovely.  A Very Relaxed And Welcoming Atmosphere With A Feel More Of Staying At Someone's Country Home Than At A Hotel.
column24: Having Had A Long Journey With Traffic Hold-Ups It Was Really Lovely To Be Offered Tea Or Coffee Brought To Our Room By The Member Of Staff Who Booked Us In.  There Was No Pressure Over Our Late Arrival  And The Staff Member Said That She Was Just About To Call Us To Check Whether We Were Still On Our Way.  She Then Made Every Effort To Accomodate Us With Fitting Us In For Dinner At A Time That Suited Us.  This All Made Us Feel Like Valued Guests Rather Than Paying Customers.
column28: Room 15.  The Bedside Tables Weren't Quite Level  So Whenever You Put A Glass On Them It Started To Slide Off.  The Large Double Bed Was Really Comfortable And I Was Pleased To Find That It Was Actually One Mattress Rather Than Two Single Mattresses Pushed Together Which Always End Up With A Gap In The Middle.
column46: The Girl On Reception When We Arrived Was Particularly Friendly And Welcoming.  That Really Set Us Up For A Great Weekend At The Hotel.
column50: We Booked On A Special Offer Deal Through The Website And It Would Have Been Nice To Have Had More Specific Detail On What Was Included As Part Of The Package:  Although Dinner Was Included  It Didn't Say What Exactly Was Covered Within That.  I Did Have To Check About The Bottle Of Champage That Was Included On Arrival  As There Was No Mention Of This By Staff.  If I Hadn't Remembered  I Don't Think We Would Have Been Given It.  We Really Enjoyed The Tea Brought To Our Room Over The Weekend:  It Was Nice To Have It Brought Up  Rather Than Having A Travel Kettle In The Room.  The Only Addition That Would Have Been Nice Would Have Been A Biscuit With The Tea.
column51: The Email Asking Me To Complete This Questionnaire Was Addressed To Mr Williams  Not Ms Williams.

column20: Booking In Quick And Efficient . Room Was Lovely But Would Benefit From Tea / Coffee Making Facilities . Staff Were Friendly And Helpful . Afternoon Tea Not As Per Pictures In Your Brochure ( Eg Lacked Sandwiches ) And Orange Saffron Cake Very Heavy And Not Eatable . No One Cleared Away Our Tea Things Nor Queried Why Cake Was Left - Despite Frequent Trips Past Us By Staff . Dinner Menu Needed A Translator Which Is Disappointing As Designed By A Yorkshire Man ! I  Had A Steak Specially Cooked For Me Which Was Delicious - Strange It Was Not On The Menu To Start With !  The Liver Was Nothing Special . The Goat Cheese Mousse Was Excellent As Was The Veloute . The Cheesecake Was Very Good Whereas The White Chocolate Croissant Was A Disappointment After Reading And Hearing So Much About It As It Was Stodgy As If Cooked Much Earlier In The Day .
column24: Reception Staff Not All Aware Of What The Deal We Had Entailed And They Had To Keep Checking - Which Is Better Than Guessing But Given Your Website Extols The Virtue Of The Tea   Dinner   Bed And Breakfast Deal I Am Surprised It Was Not Better Known .
column28: The Room Would Be Improved By Tea And Coffee Making Facilities .
column37: Please See Earlier Comments Food .
column46: The Lady With Her Arm In The Sling Was Very Helpful And Did Not Let It Stop Her  Doing Every Thing She Could To Do Things For Us .
column50: Obviously When Ordering From A Menu Only One Main Course Is Sampled And I Thought The Liver  As Already Stated  Lacked Any Wow Factor. It Was Just Liver And Mashed Potato With A Small Amount Of "Sauce" Served With It. Starter Was Very Good  As Was The Veloute Served In Small Glasses But The Main Course And The Dessert Were Both Disappointing. I Thought The Standard Fell Below That Of A Professional Chef.
column51: Already Stated Earlier .

column20: Much Needed Night Away
column37: On Previous Visits The Food Has Been Excellent. However It Was Disappointing Considering We Were The Only Two Diners That One Of The Main Courses The Food Was Cold. This Was Brought To The Attention Of The Waitress And The Chef Who Sent His Apologies
column51: We Trust This Was A One Off Blip In Catering But If It Had Been Our First Visit We May Not Have Returned

column20: The Staff We Encountered Were All Excellent.
Had A Very Enjoyable Stay In A Proffesional But Relaxed Atmosphere.Staff Were All Pleasent.Enjoyed Both The Evening Meal And The Following Days Breakfast.Left Very Satisfied
Very Pleasant  Lovely Staff  Food  Drinks And Atmosphere!
Friendly Homely Experience
column50: It Would Be Nicer To Have Later Breakfast Option On The Weekend Even To 10.30 10 Is So Out Of Date
column51: Sometimes There Were No Members Of Staff On The Reception And No One Around To Ask For Them Perhaps A Bell Could Be Put On The Desk To Alert Staff That You Are There?

column20: Excellent
column24: Looked After Very Well
column51: Wonderful Stay

column20: A Wonderful Relaxing Time With Excellent Food
column37: Only Slight Complaint Was The Limited Breakfast Hot Food Menu Which Was Even More Reduced As You Had No Crumpets

column20: I Felt That The Hotel Was Very Overpriced For What My Party Received  I Also Felt That The Hotel Did Not Cater For Elderly Residents  Ie Lift  And Most Importantly The Shower Access In The Bathrooms Were Very Dificult For Elderly People To Acess  On The Morning We Left We Had Breakfast Which I Thought Was Of Poor Value. The One Point That I Have To Commend Is The Staff Were Excellent Throughout Our Stay.
column51: On The Day We Arrived The Girl On Reception Was So Helpfull   Polite And Showed An Eagerness To Assist Us With All Our Needs  The Person Who Eorked In The Bar Area I Think His Name Was Steve Was By All Account An Asset To Your Hotel   He Seen Straight Away That My Parents Were Elderly And He Wrnt Out Of His Way To Make Not Just My Parents But Myself And My Wife So Welcome

column20: Good Food  Comfortable  Friendly Staff.
As Usual A Wonderful Stay  Fabulous Room Food And Service.We Cannot Praise Everyone Highly Enough Just Wish We Could Have Stayed Another Night
column24: Wonderful To Be Welcomed By All The Staff
column28: 27 Beautiful Spacious  Luxurious Room With View Over The Car Park And Beyond
column37: Fabulous Food Created By Exceedingly Talented Chefs  Cannot Fault It.Great Atmosphere In The Bar Area Thanks To Steve.And A Very Cosy  Calm And Relaxed Atmosphere In The Dining Room .
column46: Steve For His Humour Advice And Cheekiness.Craig And Team For The Food And Jeremy For Just Being Around  Being Available To Talk To [Unlike A Lot Of Hotels Where You Never See The Manager]
column50: For Us Everything Was Perfect ...
column51: Looking Forward To Our Next Visit ...

column20: Unforgettable. Very Professional Service.
column24: Keep It Up!
column28: Room 23 - Hope That We Will Always Enjoy The Standard You Have Shown Us On This Occasion
column37: Cant Dispute That There Is Nothing To Match Our Experience At The Talbot
column46: Lots Of Congratulations To Your Team
column50: We Were Extremely Happy
column51: For The Moment No Other Comments  Everything Pretty Good

column20: It Was A Wonderful Two Days With Amazing Food And The Best Service.
column24: I Didn't Get Any Written Confirmation Of My Booking Either Email Or Hard Copy Which I Found Slightly Disconcerting.
column50: No. It Was Wonderful.

column20: Stayed Here To Celebrate My Husband's Birthday.  Friendly Staff  Our Room Was A Good Size With A Lovely Bathroom (Rm 12).   Enjoyed Dinner And Breakfast.   Overall A Pleasant Stay.   Unfortunately  A Couple Of Negative Comments - I Checked In At 2.30Pm (A Couple Of Hours Before My Husband) Then Went Out For An Hour.   On My Way Out I Told Reception There Was No Loo Roll In The Room.   When I Got Back There Was Still No Loo Roll  And I Also Then Noticed There Was No Tv Remote - But When I Phoned Reception They Quickly Brought These Items To The Room.   Ordered Tea And Biscuits Which Was Brought Promptly - But Just One Biscuit!   If I Had Visitors At Home I Would Offer Them A Selection  And I Expect A Hotel To Do The Same.   On Checkout  I Noticed On My Confirmation Booking Form Which Was Emailed To Me That Our Deal Included "A Glass Of Fizz" So I Showed It To The Receptionist.   She Stated She Did Not Know Why It Said That As It Was Not Included In The Deal!   I Just Said "Never Mind" As She Was Very Pleasant And Polite  But I Think We Missed Out There!   The Above Comments Are Not Major  But "Niggle" And I Think You Should Know So Things Like This Hopefully Do Not Recur  As Overall I Think Your Staff Are Very Pleasant  Professional And Hardworking.
column28: Room 12 - Lovely Sized Room  Great Bathroom With Freestanding Bath And Shower.   No Plastic Bin Liners In The Bins In Both The Bathroom And Bedroom.
column46: All The Staff We Spoke To  Ie  Receptionist  Bar Staff  Dining Room Staff  Without Exception Very Courteous And Friendly.
column50: As Previously Mentioned.

column20: Love Staying At The Talbot  Great Food And Excellent Service
Staff Were Always Helpful And Friendly And The Food And Rooms Were Perfect.
column28: 7 - Couldn't Get The Phone To Work To Ring Between Rooms But A Very Minor Point.
column37: Please Tell Us What Each Course Of The Tasting Menu Is When You Bring It. It Adds To The Experience.
column46: All The Staff Were Extremely Helpful. The Lady Who Served Breakfast And The Barman Were Particularly Friendly And Attentive.

column20: I Arranged Our Stay For 10 Friends  By Email From Spain. The Staff I Corresponded With We're Very Accommodating. Our Stay Exceeded My Expectations. The Staff Were Friendly And Helpful. The Food Was Fantastic  My Calves Liver Was The Best I Have Ever Tasted!  We All Agreed That We Would Definitely Stay With You Again.
column24: Because We Were A Large Party I Was Asked To Choose Dishes From The Menu For Our Party  However A Couple Of Days Before We Arrived I Was Informed The Chef Had Changed The Menu  So My Original Choices Were Redundant. It Seemed That There Was A Slight Lack Of Communication Between The Kitchen And Front Of House. However  That Was A Minor Issue And Did Not Spoil Our Enjoyment.
column37: I Have Already Recommended The Talbot To Friends. Great Food.
column50: No
column51: Thank You For A Lovely Birthday Treat For My Friends. I Will Certainly Be Back In The Future. Could You Arrange For The Gorgeous James Martin To Be There Next Time!!!!

column20: Very Good  But The Service In The Restaurant Itself Was Lacking. We Had The Taster Menu With Wine. We Had No Explanation Of The Dishes  If The Food Had Been Sources Locally  Why The Wine Being Served Had Been Picked To Compliment To Food. That Was Disappointing As It Should All Be Part Of The Experience Of A Taster Menu
column37: Please See Earlier Comments About Service On The Restaurant.

column20: We Had An Excellent Time  The Food Was Absolutely Amazing! Our Room Was Very Large And Comfortable  The Bar Cozy And All Staff Were Very Helpful Friendly And Attentive Without Ever Being Intrusive.
column28: The Bed Was Very Comfortable And The Shower Was Powerful And Easy To Use.
column37: It Was One Of The Best Places I Have Ever Eaten  We Had The Taster Menu One Night And Ordered From The Main Menu Another. Both Meals Were Brilliant.
column51: This May Not Be A Practical Suggestion But It's Just A Thought. When I Booked I Had To Book For 2 Nights (I Booked The James Martin Gourmet Deal) But There Was Only One Taster Menu. If Possible It Might Be Good To Have 2 Taster Menus For People Staying More Than One Night On That Deal? Having Said That The Staff Were Very Accommodating In Sorting Our Meal From The Main Menu (Which Was Excellent As Well!) So It's Not A Complaint At All  Just A Thought!

column20: Staff Were Friendly Knowledgeable Yet Professional. Warm Welcome. Comfortable Clean Rooms. Best Part Was The Delicious Food
column37: Would Have Prefered To Eat Earlier Than The Alocated Time Of 9.30 But The Food Was Worth Waiting For.
column46: The Chefs For Their High Standards And Dedication To Maintain Those High Standards.
column50: Nothing. It Was Perfect
column51: We Will Be Back Next Year! We Found The Hotel Very Relaxing And Homely. The Food Far Exceeds The 2 Rossette Standard In My Opinion. Weldone Everyone!

column20: Overall A Really Good Hotel And The Food Was Outstanding
column24: Everything Top Notch

column20: Very Enjoyable  We Mainly Came For The Food And Were Not Disappointed
column37: We Could Have Had A Little More Help Selecting Wines And Sometimes The Service At The Bar Was A Little Slow
column50: Some Nice Magazines In The Bedrooms And Tea Making Facilities

column20: Very Good Ii Have Provisionally Booked The Whole Hotel For 2 Days To Bring A Golf Tour. See Ms Tanner
column46: All Very Good
column50: No

column20: A Very Comfortable And Welcoming Stay In Beautiful Surroundings  With Excellent Food And Friendly Helpful Staff.
column24: It Was A Little Difficult Arranging Some Alternatives To The Menu Prior To Our Stay  And I Think There Should Have Been Choices On The Christmas Eve Menu So This Wasn't Necessary.
column28: Number 17 - Minor Comments Only - One Flannel For 2 People Was Strange  And I Would Suggest You Replace All The Towelling Robes With Ones Like I Borrowed From My Sister In Room 1.
column46: I Would Not Like To Single Anyone Out Because All The Staff Went Out Of Their Way To Look After Us Well
column50: My One And Only Criticism Was That The Tables In The Lounge Were Not Cleared Following The Service Of Drinks (Glasses) Or Service Of Afternoon Tea. The Tables Were Left For Quite Long Periods With The Debris Left On 2/3 Tables And We Did Have To Ask In The End For Things To Be Removed. Just A Regular Check Is All That Was Needed. This Is The Only Reason I Have Not Scored Excellent Throughout This Questionnaire
column51: We Had A Really Lovely Stay And I Would Not Like My Previous Comment To Detract From How Excellent Everything Else Was. A Big Thank You To You And Your Staff.

column15: A Combination Of Infromation And Sources
column20: We Had An Enjoyable Stay.  We Informed Your Staff On Our Departure Of The Items That Would Have Improved The Experience.  Thank You.
column28: 15   Drinking Glasses Slipped Off The Side Table And Bedside Table Unless Preventive Measures Were Taken.    It Was Not Possible To Close The Bathroom Door From The Outside.  The Latch Would Not Hold The Door Closed.  There Was Much Noise From The Kitchen Below After 11Pm  It Sounded As If Large Pans Were Being Vigorously Cleaned.
column37: The Menu Should Indicate That Potatoes And Other Vegetables Are Not Included In Certain Main Course Dishes.
column46: Sadly  I Don't Recall Names Of Two Of The Female  Dining Room Staff Who Were Both Courteous And Helpful.
column51: Thank You For Permitting Space For Comments.  I Don't Wish To Add Anything On This  But I Think This Space Is Essential.  It Gives Guests The Very Important Opportunity To Express Their Own Views Unconstrained By The Previous Questions.  Again  Thanks.

column20: Enjoyed Our Stay Immensely And Found The Staff To Be Friendly And Attentive Without Being Intrusive. Food Was Excellent With Enough Variation For A 3 Night Stay. The Drawing Room Was Lovely And Cosy When The Fire Was Lit But Found Our Last Night To Be Quite Chilly In There With No Fire. Overall We Were Extremely Happy With Our Stay And Would Consider Staying Again.
This Is Our Second Trip To The Talbot In As Many Months Which I Think Should Tell You How Much We Love Your Hotel. We Plan To Return When We Can.
column24: Yes  We Were Due To Arrive Fri. 27Th But Due To The Bad Weather Our Flight Was Cancelled  And Then Our First Replacement Flight Was Cancelled So It Was An Ordeal Getting Over And We Didn't Arrive Until Sat. 28Th But We're Very Glad We Persevered. We Were Very Well Looked After Over The Phone When I Explained The Situation And Then Having Our Delayed Bag Brought To Our Room So That We Could Enjoy Dinner Uninterrupted Was A Very Nice Touch.
column28: 8. No Hair Dryer On Arrival  And Not Enough Towels - But As Soon As They Were Requested They Arrived Promptly. Would Also Have Liked 2 Shower Caps.
column37: We Are Both Very Well Travelled. We Would Consider Your Restaurant Among The Very Best We've Ever Dined In  Perhaps Even The Best.
column46: Whole Team Great.
column50: Please Note With Regard To The Answer Given To Question 18  As It Was Our Second Visit We Knew What To Expect So Therefore The Experience Met Our Expectations. It Exceeded Our Expectations The First Time We Visited.
column51: Just That We Look Forward To Coming Back.

column20: Far Too Many Minor Faults Which Taken Together Ruined The Stay. Forced To Park By Main Gate  Long Walk In Rain With Heavy Bags. Room Splendid But No Bath Mat Or Robes. Loo Seat Loose. Bar Service Poor I Had To Order The Drinks  No Tanqueray| No Menu Offered  No Wine List Offered  No Second Drink Offered. Daily Fish Special Not Available  Two First Choice Wines Unavailable  Third Choice At £70 Worse Than House Wine. Partner's Mackerel Ruined By The Broth. Poor Sized Helpings Of The Pheasant And  Yorkshire Blackberries.  Your Staff Were Pleasant And The Hotel Well Appointed. Out Of 10 As A Treat For My 74Th Birthday 3!!!
column24: Parking Poorly Organised  No "Drop Off" Zone Marked.
column28: An Excellent Room Spoiled By Loose Lavatory Seat  No Bathrobes And No Bath Mat
column37: Room Fine  Portions Small  The Wine Was Awful For The Price  (Your Deputy Removed This From The Bill  But The Occaision Was Obviously Spoilt) My Pheasant Was Undercooked And The Quantity Derisory. The Waitress Brought Carrots Instead Of Chips To The Table  (She Did Rectify The Mistake  But.....) The Bar Service Was Awful.
column46: No
column50: Just Do What You Should Do Properly. I Could Have Stayed At The Savoy For The Same Price And Left Feeling I Had Had A Treat.
column51: Yes  I Have Been A Company Director Since 1973 And Am Currently Chairmam Of Several Companies. If I Had Stayed At Company Expense I Would Not Have Paid The Bill. As It Is It Was A Private Booking With My New Partner And Was An Extreemly Poor Experience.

column20: A Very Relaxing Short Break In A Lovely Clean  Warm Hotel With Great Food  Room Service For Tea And Coffee Worked Very Well.
column28: 2  Bed Very Comfy  Reading Lights Not So Good  Windows Did Rattle Throughout Our Stay
column37: Decor In The Dining Room Could Do With Being Updated But It Was Very Warm And Relaxing
column46: All Staff That We Met Were Superb  Well Done Especially To The Young Ones In Training
column50: Fires Lit In The Drawing Room  This Was The Only Cold Room  We Left To Sit In The Bar

column20: As Always Very Relaxing  Our Yorkshire Home Away From Home
column28: Room 21 - A Lovely  Well Appointed Room But Some Noise Could Be Experienced From A Generator/Boiler (?) Most Audible In The Bathroom. Also The Room Is Close To The Housekeeping Area And We Could Clearly Hear Talking Outside The Room At About 7 - 7.30'Sh. We Were Awake At The Time  But It Could Possible Wake People Up.
column50: Breakfast On Both Days Was Nice  But I Think There Is Room For Improvement. I'll Be Happy To Provide Further Detail If Required.
column51: Can't Wait To Stay With You Again. See You Soon!

column20: Excellent - Deal Was Very Good Value And Welcome  Food And Facilities First Class
column37: Food Was Excellent  However  The Vegetarian Options Were Limited  Particularly At Breakfast
column50: Offer More Vegetarian Food Choices

column20: Lovely Environment With Welcome Staff  Had A Great Anniversary
column24: Reception Was Strange As Under The Stairs
column28: Great View
column37: Great Experience But Not Enough Choice For Longer Stay Than The Weekend  Great Breakfast Bap
column46: Steve Behind The Bar  Engaged People At The Right Level
column50: Let Me Make My Own Tea
column51: Make More Of Your Place In The Community Share What The Other Businesses Are Doing  Ideal Spot And Can See How You Are Going To Have Lovely Gardens.

column20: A Very Enjoyable Overnight Stay With Excellent Dinner
column24: Impressed That You Emailed Me Back As Soon As You Received My Booking Noting That I Hadn't Booked A Table For Dinner. We Were Able To Reply And Confirm A Table At Our Preferred Time
column28: Sloping Floors!
column50: My Breakfast (Full Talbot) Was Enjoyable But A Little Underwhelming. After The Excellence Of Dinner I Felt It Was Lacking Something On The Plate. I'm Afraid I Can't Put My Finger On What Was Missing. I Wish I'd Had The Egg And Smoked Salmon Which Looked Very Tasty. Please Take This As A Constructive Comment From What Was A Very Enjoyable Stay.
column51: We Will Be Back

column20: A Wonderful Way To Celebrate My Wife's Birthday
Good Quality Stay
column46: Two Girls On Reception During Our Stay On 27Th December. I Hadn't Brought A Dressing Gown So Asked If They Had One To Borrow. The Receptionist Apologised And Said That Laundry Was Delayed Due To Xmas Period. But When She Brought Our Tea Up  She Had Found One - Instant Warmth After A Lovely Hot Bath.
column50: Room Was Cold On Arrival. The Thermostat On The Radiator Was On The Highest No. (5) But Little Heat Coming Out. However  In The Morning It Was Pumping Out Heat.
column51: Will Be Back Next Year Around The Same Time. Is It Worth Booking Now To Get A Discount?!

column20: Enjoyable Occasion Over The Christmas Period With The Flexibility To Invite Family To Join Us
column28: Room 12 Room Was A Little Tired - Although Definitely Of A Comfortable Disposition And Well Appointed.
column37: A Children's Menu Should Have Been Offered.  We Were Lucky That Our Small Children Tried T Most Of The Food Presented To Them But It Would Have Been Good To Have Had A Choice Offered.
column50: Let Us Know Who Won The Quiz And What The Answers Were?   We Were Very Happy With The Overall Experience Although We Are More Used To A More Modern Interior.  The Hotel And The Team Were Courteous And We Really Enjoyed The Stay.

column20: Nice Rooms Quality Decor Added Bonus Been Able To Take Our Dog. The Food Was Excellent Both Evening And Breakfast. Lovely Friendly Staff Only Too Glad To Help And Nothing Was A Problem To Them Which Made Our Stay A Great Pleasure. Thank You.
column50: Not Really

column20: I Have Sent An E Mail With My Comments  To Frances.  All Complementary.
column28: A Brighter Form Of Lighting Would Have Been Preferable For Completing Completing Makeup Etc.

column20: Great Hotel  Lovely Room  Very Comfy Bed  Wonderful Crisp Sheets! Friendly Staff.
column24: Only Thing Not 100 Percent Was The Seal On Shower Door Was Very Mouldy Underneath  And A Grapefruit Came Without A Knife Or Bowl   I Think You Had A New Girl But The Chef Should Have Overseen The Little Details. Otherwise 1St Class.

column20: Overall It Was Good.  The Hotel Was Lovely And The Room Was Very Comfortable.  The Food Was Fantastic And Faultless But The Service We Thought In The Restaurant Was Average.  Although We Were Having The Gourmet Experience  With Wine Flight  3 Of Our First 4 Wines  Did Not Arrive Before Our Food And We Had To Request And Wait For The Wine.  The First Member Of Staff Apologised And Brought The Wine  The Second Member Of Staff Was Going To Bring Over The Wine List And In The Final Instance  The Restaurant Manager  Apologised And Brought Us A Complimentary Glass Of Champagne Each At The End Of The Meal.  Also  The Restaurant Manager Was The Only Person Who Described What The Wine Was.  The Other Staff Either Just Put It Down In Front Of Us (Late) And When We Did Ask What Wine It Was  No Description Was Given. We Have Done Wine Flights Before And Best Part Is The Drama In Understanding The Wines And How They Compliment The Food.  Aside From The Restaurant Manager No-One Managed To Achieve This. Again  The Food Was Faultless  But To Compete With Places Like Rockliffe Hall  I Felt The Talbot Restaurant Service In Delivering The 'Experience' Fell Someway Behind.

The Products In The Bathroom Were Acceptable  But Basic (In Comparison To Other Hotels Of This Standard).  Cotton Wool Pads And Cotton Buds Should Be Provided (Especially If You Aren't Going To Provide Face Flannels!) I Personally Find The Lack Of A Chain Or Additional Lock On The Inside Of The Door Makes Me Feel Slightly Vulnerable  Especially As There Was No "Do Not Disturb" Sign  So It Feels As If Someone From Housekeeping Could Wander In At Any Time

column20: Our Experience Was Pleasant  The Rooms And Decor Were Lovely. Whilst The Restaurant Was Pleasant Enough We Felt The Ambience Could Be Worked Upon. For The Aim Of The Hotel  Which I Believe To Be Boutique With Fine Dining Experience We Felt That The Service Failed To Deliver On Many Levels.     For Instance Initially I Liked The Idea That Tea And Coffee Facilities Were Not Available In The Room  But That Presumably Better Quality Refreshment Could Be Obtained By Ringing Reception.  This Service Failed To Impress When We Ordered Coffee  Which Did Not Arrive  And When Two Hours Later I Called Reception To Enquire About Its Whereabouts It Took Me Five Attempts Where The Phone Rang Out To Get Through To Reception.  I Am Pleased To Report That The Coffee Ordered The Following Morning Arrived Promptly.
column28: Room 3. The Shower Door Leaked Badly And You Could Not Turn The Shower On Without Getting Soaked Because The Door Was Installed To Open By The Shower Head  Not By The Controls.  Whilst There Was Not A Good Selection Of Products In My Bathroom  The Quality Was Excellent.
column37: My Husband And I Chose The James Martin Tasting Menu  With Wine.  We Found The Food Quality Very Good  And Particularly Enjoyed The Goat's Cheese Mousse And The Pork  And Thought That The Wines Were Excellently Paired With The Food.  We Were Both Extremely Disappointed By The Smoked White Chocolate Ganache  Which Neither Of Us Ate More Than A Mouthful Of.  This Was In The Main Because It Was So Heavily Smoked That When The Waiter Placed It In Front Of Me  My Initial Thought Was That He Had In Fact Recently Been For A Cigarette.  This May Just Have Been Our Palates  However What Surprised Me Most Was That No One On The Waiting Staff Enquired As To Why Both Of Us Had Barely Touched It.  In General We Both Found The Restaurant Service Poor  For The Fine Dining Aim And Price Point (In North Yorkshire).  To Deliver At This Level The Service Is Paramount  And I Have Bored Many Friends With Tales Of Excellent Service In Other Establishments That I Have Eaten  I Am Afraid That This Will Not Be Happening For The Talbot.  Our First Course Was Delivered Beautifully - We Were Told About The Wine That Had Been Paired With Our Food  And It Arrived Shortly Before The Food  Which Was Also Described To Us On Delivery.  Our Fish Course Wine Was Delivered Before The Food  But Without Comment  And Our Food Was Also Delivered Without Comment.  I Found Myself Wishing That I Had Memorised The Menu  Or That Someone Would Bring It To Me So I Could Remember The Detail - Because When You Order A Tasting Menu You Do Not Memorise Everything That You Have Ordered Because You Have Ordered An Experience That The Chef Has Designed  Which May Not Be Dishes You Would Normally Choose.  Our Meat And Fourth Courses Arrived Before The Accompanying Wines  Reducing Us To Waiting Until The Maitre'd Noticed And Had Them Served To Us So That We Could Enjoy With Our Course.  Our Dessert Wine Arrived So Far Before The Dessert We Actually Thought That It Had Been Forgotten.  After The First Course And Wine All Items Were Served To Us Politely  But Without Comment.  Not Once Did Anyone Ask If We Had Enjoyed Our Food.  Everyone Was Very Friendly  And Polite  But The Service Was So Far Away From The Polish That I Would Expect From A Meal Costing £160 For Two In North Yorkshire As To Be Extremely Disappointing.    The Following Day We Had Lunch In The Crab And Lobster In Asenby Near Thirsk And The Experience And Professionalism Of The Staff There Was Stark In Contrast To That At The Talbot  Despite The Fact That We Did Not Have A Restaurant Reservation And Ate Only In The Bar.  I Noted On Leaving That There Was A Country Life Article In A Frame Near The Reception Christmas Tree  Declaring The Talbot To Be One Of The Top Ten Restaurants With Rooms In The Country To Stay Whilst Enjoying Country Sport - I Am Not Familiar With The Quality Of The Shooting In The Area But I Imagine It Is Excellent  I Am Afraid That The Quality Of Service Is Unlikely To Impress That Particular Range Of Clientele  And Indeed I Would Not Expect An Establishment Such As The Talbot To Be Displaying Cut Out Magazine Articles Declaring It To Be One Of The Best In Reception - Surely  If You Are Staying There Already - You Don't Need To Be Told This?

column20: Our Room   Food And Staff Were Excellent.  We Just Had A Couple Of Niggles In That On The First Night Of Our Stay (We Booked For Two Nights) The Room Wasn't Cleaned The Next Day. Someone Had Been In Our Room Because The Lights Were On When We Got Back And The Do Not Disturb Sign Had Been Put On The Door. Neither I Or My Husband Had Done This.  When We Pointed Out To Reception That The Bed Hadn't Been Made Or Cleaned They Were V Apologetic And Saw To It Straight Away But It Did Hinder Our Timetable For The Evening. On The First Evening We Were Given Olives And Snacks With Our Pre Dinner Drinks  The Second Night We Were Not Offered Any (Different Bar Manager?) Which Was Disappointing. We Ordered A V Good Bottle Of Wine On The Same Night And Were Disappointed To Find It Was Unopened When We Arrived At Our Table. The Wine Would Have Benefited From Having Time To Breathe. It Is Unclear When You Arrive  Where To Go As There Are No Signs For Reception And A Desk Tucked Under The Stairs Does Look Like Someone Just Manning The Phones And Enquires.   Overall We Had A Lovely Stay And Our Dog Was Catered For V Well But Just A Few Inconsistencies.

I Was Appaled By The Bad Manners Of The Manager Who When I Asked To See Him Sent The Waiter To Say He Was Busy When My Son Could See Him Standing By The Reception Not Being Busy  I Would Have Liked To Order More Food As The Main Course Was Mostly Potato And 38 Carrots And 3 Slices Of Beef Each.  The Silent Gesture Of £20 Off The Bill Was An Insult.  He Made Nineffort The Following Morning To Introduce Himself And Say Anything He Just Lurked In The Shadows Around Reception And It  Really Spoilt The Stay .
