column20: I Posted This On Tripadvisor Which Pretty Much Sums It Up. It Was Fantastic!!   “Great Hotel  Lovely Staff  Awesome Restaurant!” 5 Of 5 Starsreviewed 3 Days Ago New We Had Nothing Short Of An Excellent Stay At Talbot Hotel And A Fantastic Meal In The Restaurant.   All The Staff Were Really Friendly And Obliging - Nothing Too Much Trouble. Thanks To The Friendly Gent Behind The Bar For Recommending The Local Pubs  And Later In The Evening Helping Us Choose The Spirits!   We Stayed With Friends And Both Of Us Had Complimentary Room Upgrades. Our Room (Lambton) Was Lovely With Lovely Views. The Taster Menu With Wine Flight Was Excellent  And I Would Highly Recommend It.   Having Experienced Some Poor Service Recently At The Star Inn The City In York  It Was Lovely To Be Treated With Such Care And Attention Here. Restaurant Staff Were A Fantastic Team And We Were Treated Like Royalty.  All In All  One Of The Best Hotel/Dining Experiences In A Very Long Time. Just Excellent. We All Agreed We Want To Return And We Can't Wait To Go Back!  P.S. We Loved The Fudge  I Wish I Could Have Brought Some Home!!!!  Stayed January 2014  Travelled As A Couple

column20: It Was Fault Less From The Moment We Stepped Through The Door On Friday Until We Left On Sunday. Lovely Room Again  Warm And Very Welcoming Toiletries And Dressing Gowns To Use  King Sized Bed  Lovely Bathroom. Great Breakfast With Plenty To Eat From The Cereals  Fruit  Ham And Cheese Selection + Orange  Apple Drinks To The Main Cooked Breakfast Which Was Again A Good Variety. The Staff Appeared To Want Us To Be There Unlike Many Other Places I Have Stopped At Over Many Years  They Always Had A Smile And A Cheery Demeanour  And Could Not Be Faulted. A Big Thanks To All Especially Clare And Steve. We Will Be Back.
column24: When I Originally Booked Through Your Website I Was Directed To A Booking Agency Which I Knew Nothing About Until I Had Booked And Then When I Printed The Booking Confirmation I Saw It Had Hotel-Rez On The Bottom And The Price Was Increased From £244 To £303.56 Which I Was Not Happy About. I Rang The Agency To Cancel And Had To Speak To 5 Different People Who Obviously Did Not Want To Cancel The Booking So Kept Cutting Me Off Or Said They Could Not Access The Booking. The 5Th Person I Spoke To Told Him I Would Go To Their Senior Management If He Did Not Sort The Problem  Suddenly It Was Sorted.... The Booking Was Cancelled And I Was Able To Ring The Talbot Direct And Speak To Clare Who Then Booked Me Into The Hotel For The £244 Deal I Thought I Was Getting Originally. Many Thanks Clare.

We Have Been Coming To The Talbot For Nearly A Year Now. All The Staff Are Friendly And Attentive  Especially Steve In The Bar. The Food Is Lovely  Surroundings Totally In Keeping With The Era Of The Property. We Have Been For Lunches  Evening Meals  Popped In For A Drink  Stayed A Weekend For Our Anniversary And This Last Experience Was The Celebration Of My Grandmas 90Th Birthday. Hopefully Things Won't Change With The Arrival Of A New Manager And We Look Forward To Our Next Visit  Probably A Birthday Celebration In About 4 Weeks Time!

column20: Our Second Stay In This Beautiful And Friendly Hotel.   The Evening Meal We Had Was Amazing And We Both Said That It Was Possibly The Best Meal We Had Ever Had Anywhere. The Rooms Throughout The Hotel Are Pretty And The Staff Helpful And Friendly.  We Found The Bedroom Lovely And Extremely Clean  But Our Only Negative Comment Would Be That The Bedroom Again Was Very Hot And Found Sleeping Difficult Even With The Window Wide Open  Which Was A Shame.   An Lovely Break Thank You And One Which Could Have Only Been Made More Memorable By Bumping Into Mr Jame Martin ( My Husband Thinks I Only Book At The Hotel So Might Catch A Glimpse Of James   Only Semi True I Promise).

However I Cracked Up And Wondered F He Had Ever Read Any Of James Menu's Or Seen Him Cook On Saturday Morning.

column28: 2 Spectacular Bathroom Limited Tv Channels But Not A Big Problem
column37: Food Was Of A Much Higher Standard Than Expected. Only Small Complaint Was The Wine By The Glass Selection. I Think This Could Be Improved.
column46: Sorry I Cannot Remember Any Names. However The More Mature Waitress In The Dining Room Was A Breath Of Fresh Air With Her More Genuine Approach With Diners.

column20: My Wife And I Stayed At The Talbot In February 2013 For The First Time And Were So Impressed That In January 2014 We Decided We Would Make Another Journey To Yorkshire And Stay Again At The Talbot. However  Whilst We Generally Enjoyed Staying At The Malton Again  We Were Very Disappointed To Find That The Evening Menu Had Changed Very Little If Any From The Previous Years' Visit. We Had Prior Knowledge Of The All The Dishes That Were On The Menu And Due To Be Served. Disappointed Enough To Maybe Look Elsewhere On Our Next Visit To Yorkshire.
column24: No Other Comments.
column28: Hoovering Was Questionable  As Some Bits Of Paper Remained On The Floor Throughout Our Stay  Which Were Present Upon Arrival.
column37: See My Previous Comments Regarding The Repetitive List Of Menu Options From The Previous Stay Some 12 Months Ago.
column46: All Members Of Staff Were Equally As Courteous As Each Other  I Do Not Feel It Would Be A Fair Judgement To Single Out One Individual.
column50: Change The Evening Menu From The Previous Year  And Also Add An Option Such As A Fine Steak Or Similar  To Break The Possible Monotony Of Fine Gourmet Cooking.

column20: Fabulous Food  Clean And Spacious Accommodation  Friendly  Professional And Polite Staff - Everyone Says Hello And Smiles. Great Place.
column28: Room 11. We Felt The Room Was Too Warm  Even After We Had Turned The Radiator Down. I Found The Matress Hard But My Partner Thought It Was Superb So It's Probably A Matter Of Personal Preference  Rather Than Anything Wrong.
column37: Amazing

column20: It Was Our First Visit But Definitely Won't Be The Last. The Hotel Is Very Elegant And Well Appointed And Our Room Was Lovely. We Also Thought The Communal Areas Such As The Bar And Drawing Room Were Excellent  And The Staff Were Very Polite  Well Informed And Friendly. But Without Doubt The Highlight Was The Exceptional Food We Experienced In Your Beautiful Restaurant. The Room  The Ambience And The Service All Added To The Enjoyment. You Should Be Very Proud Of What Has Been Achieved Here - It Is Superb.
column24: The Entire Experience From Booking To Checking Out Was Superb.
column28: We Stayed In Room 27. It Was Very Elegant And In Keeping With The Age And Period Of The Building. Plenty Of Room  A Beautiful Comfy Bed And Very Nice Furniture. The Bathroom Was A Very Good Size And Also Beautifully Appointed. The Only Very Minor Thing We Encountered Was That The Hairdryer In The Bathroom Cabinet Didn't Work! Trivial  I Know  But Perhaps Worth Noting For The Future. Whilst There Were Some Fine Toiletries In The Bathroom  I Would Suggest Perhaps A Broader Selection Of Items For The Calibre Of The Hotel? We Have Stayed In Other Hotels Of Lower Standing  And There Have Been More Items Available For Use. This Is A Very Minor Criticism  However  And It Really Didn't Matter Personally To Us But You Should Perhaps Consider This In Response To The Type Of Guest Who Would Complain About It.....They Are Out There!! We've Seen Them Before!! :-)
column37: Without A Doubt  It Is The Finest Dining Experience We Have Had In England. I Can't Think Of A Single Thing That Wasn't To Love. The Food Was Exceptional  The Room Is Beautiful  The Staff Are Very Attentive And Courteous And The Whole Experience Was A Delight. My Husband Particularly Loved The Style And Delivery Of The Cheese Board!! Well Done To All Your Kitchen Staff And To Mr Martin For Delivering Such A Fantastic Menu!
column46: We Particularly Liked The Service We Received Form The Young Man Who Served Us In The Restaurant - I Am Sorry We Did Not Get His Name. We Also Found Your Senior Concierge Lady Very Friendly And Of Very Good Humour - She Served Us For Breakfast The Following Day. But To Be Fair  All Your Staff Were Lovely And It Would Be Difficult To Have A Negative Opinion About Any Of Them.
column50: No - We Had A Fantastic Time. It Is A Visit That We Will Remember For A Long Time To Come And We Have Already Recommended You To Our Friends/Family.
column51: My Husband Loves Pol Roger Champagne......We Ordered A Bottle Of Champagne In The Bar  But The Bar Menu Didn't Include The Pol Roger!! Oh  How He Cried!! Haha!! Perhaps Next Time We Will Ask To See The Full Wine List....And He Can Be A Happy Bear! Damn That Lousy Laurent Perriere That We Had To Drink Instead!! :-)) Thank You For A Wonderful And Memorable Stay. Keep Up The Good Work!!

Room 7 Was Very Disappointing With A Tiny Bathroom Although On Line These Are Described As Luxurious! Booking Two Rooms We Would Expect Them To Be Of An Equal Standard.

No Staff Were Around To Ask  I Had To Go Looking Into The Hall To Find One. When I Said That I Expected 'Treats' I Was Told That Treats Were Only Served In The Evening. I Did Get Them But The Tone Was Reluctant And I Felt I'd Had To Make A Fuss.
column2: I Overheard (He Was Talking Quite Loudly) One Of Your Staff Telling Some Customers That He's Known James Martin For Some Time  He Thinks Jm's 'Bitten Off More Than He Can Chew'  He 'Can Be Nice'  He Earns About £150K At The Bbc And It Would Be Nice If He Came To The Hotel A Bit More Often. I Thought That He Also Treated One Of His Older Colleagues Who Came To Ask Him A Question With Very Little Respect Asking 'What Do You Want?'. It May Have Been A Joke But I Was Offended By The Tone.

column20: Wonderful Stay And Outstanding Food

As I Am Disabled ( Back Problems) And Had Just Spent Prev. Week In Bed On High Dose Morphine  Only Been On My Feet A Few Days I Was Initially Shocked When Found Out No Lift ! Your Lady On The Desk Did However Change Our Room On Arrival To The Suite ( 4 Poster) Pictured Above  So I Only Had 1 Flight Of Stairs Which My Husband Assisted Me With. The 2/3 Steps After This Do Need Some Sort Of Rail On At Least On Side Though As I Had Nothing But My Husband To Hold ! Other Than That I Found The Room To Be A Delight  And Was Very Grateful For The Upgrade Under The Circumstances. Everything Else Was Very Accessible To Me Including The Large Walk In Shower ( A Must For Me). The Hotel Was Very Cozy And Had A Nice Atmosphere. The Staff Went Out Of Their Way To Make Ours And Everyone Else's Stay By The Look A Pleasure. ( As It Was Only The 2Nd Time My Husband And I Have Stayed Away Without The 2 Children In Last 5 Years It Was Lovely To Feel Looked After)  They Usually Come With Us Everywhere. The Tasting Menu Which Was Part Of Our Groupon Voucher Deal We Purchased Back In November 2013 Was In Most Parts Very Nice. Personal Taste  But I Was Rather Looking Forward To Dessert And Didn't Like The Smoked White Choc. Granache At All  My Husband Was So So  We Have A Wide Tasting Palate  This Just Wasn't Really For Us  And I Left Mine  So Made Do With The Petit Fours And Coffee By The Fire In The Drawing Room. Service In The Restaurant Was Generally Prompt  We May Have Slowed Down Dessert Poss. As We Were Chatting To Your Staff !  Rest Of It Was Very Prompt!. Despite The Weather Being Awful On The Saturday Meaning We Didn't Go Into Malton  We Relaxed Around The Hotel From 3Pm Ish Onwards  We Had A Lovely Stay ( Everywhere Shut On The Sunday Of Course When Weather Much Nicer). All Staff Were Delightful And A Credit To The Hotel. Breakfast Was Served Timely  And Was Beautiful  Not Fatty At All And Perfect Size.

column1: Any Recommendations I Could Make ;- Even If Small....1. An Orchid Was In Our Room On The Fireplace In A Plastic Container As They Are Bought  Would Have Looked Much Better In A Plant Pot !!

2. Just Fyi ( Not A Bother To Us) There Are A Lot Of Ladybirds I Think Living In The Wood Of The Windows In The Bay Of The Room We Stayed In  We Noticed Sunday Morning When We Tried To Let Some Air In. Sadly We Could Not Open The Right Side Bay Window ( Painted Shut ?/ Stuck) So I Had To Shoot A Photo Through The Glass Of The View.
3. I Appreciate It Was A Pre Decided Tasting Menu But It Would Have Been Nice To Have Been Offered An Alternate Choice Of Dessert. I Have Never Had Choc. Granache Smoked Before ! Nor Will Again .

4. Extra Towels In The Bathroom  Are Always Welcome  I Don't Like To Have To Trouble People Ringing Up For These Things. Perhaps This Is Just From Stays At Other Hotels  But A Pair Of Dressing Gowns In The Bathroom Of A Suite Of This Calibre Always Is A Welcome Addition. The Fireplace In The Bedroom/Suite Made A Lovely Addition  But The One In The Bathroom Was Of Most Character  With The Other One Being Boarded Up. I Think This And The Up-Potted Lilly Drew My Eye To It. The Screen In Front Of It Was Beautiful  But A Larger One To Cover Up More Of The Cream Boarding Would Perhaps Be More Suitable/ Attractive.  Also  I Do Have Long Hair And Had Forgot My Own Shampoo  We Made Do With The 1 In The Room  But Perhaps Leaving 2 Might Seem A Little More Generous. I Was Past The Point Of Ringing Down When I Realized.! All In All  These Remarks Are Small In Comparison With The Fantastic Stay We Had With You. I Do Have A Flickr Account Where I Post Shots I Take ( A Hobby Of Mine)  And I Do Write Reviews For Trip Adviser To Help Other Travellers Make An Informed Choice. I Hope You Find This Info. Useful  It In No Way Spoilt Our Stay  But Please If Your Grade Ii Listing Allows Could You Put A Small Handrail On The Small Steps Up To The Room.

column9: Maybe 2 Of Everything  Shampoo And Towels Left In The Bathroom  For A Shower / Bath The Night Before And Another In The Morning Before Breakfast.

column1: ( Suite In Photo Above)
column10: Tasting Menu Whilst Good Value For Us And Very Nice  - I Would Not Choose Again As I Did Not Like The Dessert At All And Had Been Really Looking Forward To It.

column1: We Did Order A Side Of Hand Cooked Chips Which Were Delicious Between Us  To Go With The Pork Main Course. Personally I Think It Needed It  As Did My Husband.

Good Choice Of Non-Alcoholic Drinks Such As Fentimens And Bottle Green   May I Also Rec. Belvoir Too. I Have Not 'Drank' In Over 2 Years As I Live On Morphine To Control My Back Pain And It Is Def. A No No !! I Did Not Ask For Any Other Drinks So Not Sure Re. You Beers  But I Personally Rec. Becks Blue As Best On The Market. I Think This Is Good Not Only For Non-Drinkers Like Me For Medical Reasons  But Also People Driving Home  Mum's Breastfeeding Their Babies Etc And These Drinks Are Very Popular With 30-45 Years Old Group That I Fit Into Along With A High Number Of My Friends Who Drink Them. The Rose Lemonade Is Also An Interesting And Pleasant Choice  As Is Straight Elderflower Presse.  ( Perhaps Your Rep. Could Do You A Sampling !) ( M And S So A Wonderful Apple And Mirabelle Presse  But I Don't Suppose That Is Easily Sourced By Yourselves !)
We Came As A Couple So Made Perfect Venue For Us In Terms Of Size.
column10: I Am Sorry To Say I Am Dreadful At Remembering People's Names ! The Lady Who Checked Us In / Out At The Desk Was Lovely And Very Helpful When Realized My Needs ( Re Stairs ).

I Chatted To Again Next Morning (Sunday) And Found Him A Pleasure To Talk To. We Had A Good Chat With One Waitress Serving Us Who Was Lovely   But Sadly I Forget Her Name.

column20: The Atmospher Of The Hotel Very Welcoming. The Staff Professional  Friendly And Helpful. Both Lunch And Breakfast Service Efficient.  Bar Staff Very Friendly. It Was A Family Treat And We Had A 13 Month Old Baby With Us At No Point Were We Made To Feel Uncomfortable. The Rooms Are Lovely.

column24: Had To Get Directions From A Friendly Local Once In Malton - Perhaps A Few Signs Would Be Useful.  Reception Area Is A Little Under-Stated.
column28: Room 14. Two Light Bulbs Not Working On Arrival - Main Ceiling Light And Standard Lamp. Bulbs Were Changed Whilst We Were In Dinner Which Unfortunately Meant We Had To Dress For Dinner In The Gloom. The Member Of Staff Who Changed The Ceiling Bulb Clearly Had Stood On The Chair To Do This And Left It In The Middle Of The Room Afterwards.  A Brief Guide To Hotel Services Would Be Useful. The Sloping Floor/Occasional Table Created A Fun Game Of 'How Far Will The Bottle Of Water Slide?' Before We Had To Catch It To Prevent It Ending Up In My Bag! Very Comfortable Bed And The Decor Was Appropriate For The Age And Style Of Building. The Quality Of The Furnishing Fabrics Through Out The Hotel Was Impressive.
column37: We Sampled The Taster Menu. There Was A Considerable Delay Between The First And Second (Wreckfish) Courses  With The Waitress Clearly Appearing With The Third (Pork) Course Then Realising That We Hadn't Had The Fish Yet. We Eventually Had To Enquire As To Where The Fish Course Was. The Wine Appeared After The Fourth (Rhubarb) Course Rather Than With It. We Were Presented With Two Sets Of Soup Spoons To Eat Our Desserts With  And Had To Ask For These To Be Exchanged For Dessert Spoons. Between The Fourth And Fifth Courses A Strong Smell Of Cigarettes Wafted Into The Room  From The Archway Through To The Kitchen. One Of The Waitresses Then Appeared Smelling Strongly Of Cigarette Smoke  Which Was A Little Off-Puting. The Food Was Excellent And The Staff Were Always Friendly And Quick To Respond To Our Requests.
column50: We Provided Feedback To The Receptionist On Our Departure Which She Assured Us Would Be Passed To The Manager.
column51: We Had Previously Read Excellent Reviews Of The Hotel And Restaurant  And Were Looking Forward To Our Visit With High Expectations. We Hope Our Feedback Will Allow You To Fine Tune Your Service For Our Next Visit!

column1: We Booked The Taster Menu With Wine Flight  Our First  Course Came  But No Wine  As No One Was About We Ate Our Food. When Someone Came To Clear Our Plates We Asked About The Wine  To Be Greeted With A Quizzical Look And Oh  I Will.Check That You Are On That. Later To Return With 2 Glasses Of Wine After We Had Completed Our Food! So We Had 2 Full.Glasses To Go With Next Course   Hardly Complimenting The Food  And Surely They Should Have Known. We Substituted A Course  For The Cheese Trolley  Hmmm More Or A Board  We Were Offered A Selection Of 5 Cheeses. 3 Of Which Were Similar. The Food All Evening Was Only Average  We Did Expect Better.
She Asked -How Was Your Stay   To Which I Replied Alright.
If You Truly Value Your Guests Opinions Surely You Would Have Expected Her To Probe A Little To That Reply  But Sadly No.
I Waited  Then Offered Sone Information About Our Stay   Her Response Was I Will Pass Your Comments On. I Did Not Leave Feeling We Had Been Listened To.
column5: In Addition To My Comments Throughout The Survey Please See Below   I Hope You Will Take My Feedback As Constructive.  We Stay At Hotels On A Regular Basis As My Husband Works Abroad For 6 Months Of The Year So We Like To Go Away To Spend Quality Time Together. The Previous Night We Stayed At The Feversham Arms And Over The Previous Few Days Ate At The Black Swan And The Star In Harome  I Must Say That We Enjoyed All 3 More Than The Talbot  Which Is A Shame As We Were Looking Forwards To.Our Stay.

column20: I Used It As A 'Destination Hotel' The Reason For The Trip Was Primarily To Eat There. Other Aspects Of The Hotel Were Merely Ancillary To That Purpose. Because The Meal Was A Disappointment This Had A Knock On Effect To My Experience As A Whole. Whilst I Have Stated That I Would Not Stay Here Again That Is Because The Purpose For Revisiting Does Not Exist I.E. Would Not Eat Here Again  It Is Not A Reflection Of The Quality Of The Hotel. I Am Somewhat Reluctant To Recommend For The Same Reason  I Would Adopt The Attitude Of 'This Is My Experience  Give It A Try...'
column28: Room 5. Noisey From Traffic. Noisey From Staff On The Corridor.
column37: We Had Taster Menu With Flight Of Wines X 4.  I Accept That Whoever Puts This Toghether Is Technically More Accomplished Than I Am And Have Not Put The Menu Toghether By Accident. However From My Point Of View I Found The Portions Way Too Small ( I Actually Considered Having A Sandwich When I Had Finished) And Whilst The Food Was  Well Cooked It Lacked The 'Ooomph' Of Taste To Compensate For Those Small Portions. There Was A Lack Of Balance In The Wines With The Pinot Noir Being Particularly Unwelcome. The Wreck Fish Had Bones In  Two To Be Precise. The Staff Are Very Pleasant  However I Would Trade A Little Pleasantness For A Little More Professionalism  There Were Four Of Us Eating The Same Meal And Not On Any Single Course Did Plates Come Toghether There Was Always One Waiting And To Compound That It Was Always The Females On The Table Left Waiting (Why Not Two Waiters?)  There Was No Uniform Explanation Of What The Dishes Were.My Entertainment Is Dining And The Cost Of That Experience Is Never An Issue  I Would Go As Far As To Say That It Is An Irrelevance  But In Summary  I Ieft Thinking That I Had Ever So Slightly Been Ripped Off. I Do Not Wish This Feedback To Sound Harsh Nor Unduly Critical It Is My Perception Of The Evening And I Am Sure You Have Equally As Many Customers Who Find It Very Agreeable.

Our Overall Experience Was Very High But Little Things Can Make A Huge Difference. The Food Itself Was Exceptional In Our Opinion. Well Done.

column20: Very Enjoyable Overnight Stay  Room Clean & Comfortable. Only Downside Was The Restaurant Service  We Were Onto The Main Course Before We Got Our Wine & There Was A Delay With The Side Orders. There Was No Restaurant Manager In Sight & The Waiting Staff Were Bringing Dishes Out With No Idea Which Table They Were For. There Was Also A Long Delay In Taking Our Dessert Order & When It Eventually Came  The Ice Cream Had Melted. However  The Staff Were Very Polite & The Deputy Manager Gave Us A Voucher For A Complimentary Dinner For Two When We Discussed The Above Issues  Although We Simply Wanted To Make The Point That Such A High Standard Of Food Was Being Let Down By Front Of House. Breakfast Service Was Excellent  So Maybe It Was Just A Bad Night!

column20: It Was A Thoroughly Enjoyable Stay. We Came For My Husband's 60Th Birthday  And Booked For The 5-Course Tasting Menu  And An Overnight Stay In One Of The River-Facing Rooms. We Spent A Very Leisurely Day There  And Really Enjoyed The Break. I Have Already Spoken About It To Many Friends  And Would Love To Come Back. However  It Is A Bit Beyond Our Normal Budget For 'Regular' Visits  And As Such  It Did What I Wanted - Provided A Very Memorable One-Off Experience To Mark A Special Birthday !   The Room Was Very Clean And Comfortable  And The Food Exquisitely Presented And Really Delicious. Well-Chosen Wines - And No Worries About The Need To Drive Afterwards !   Excellent Choice Of Breakfasts The Following Morning.
column24: I Telephoned; I Discussed My Requirements With The Receptionist; I Made The Booking Immediately. It Was Acknowledged By Email Very Promptly  And All Went Smoothly From Then On. We Were Greeted Courteously  And Shown To Our Room.
column28: Bedroom Fine. I Have Just One Comment About The Bathroom: I Used The Shower In The Morning - Which Worked Beautifully - But Found I Couldn't Undo The Door Afterwards. It Seemed Stuck Fast  And I'm Not Tall Enough To Reach To The Top Of The Door To Pull That  So I Had To Call For My Husband To Help. He Thought I'd Pulled It Shut A Little Too Firmly. I Did Find Myself Wondering What Would Have Happened If I'd Been On My Own ?!?  I Didn't Have A Phone In There With Me  Of Course  And There Wasn't An Alarm Bell Of Any Sort. Maybe A Small Warning Notice On The Door Would Help ?
column37: It Is Wonderful For That Special Treat !   Unusual - But Local - Ingredients  And Imaginative Blending Of Flavours. Really Appreciated The Soft Background Jazz And Gentle Buzz Of Conversation. And For The First Time In Many  Many Months Of Experience In Other Venues  Absolutely No-One In The Room Had Or Used A Mobile Phone During The Course Of The Meal !!   Altogether Very Civilised.
column46: They Were All Extremely Helpful And Willing.  We Were Amused (Not Annoyed) By The Young Lady Who Took Our Liqueur Order: She Was About To Go In Search Of Some "Spiced Whisky"  Having Heard My Husband's Request For The "Speyside Whisky" He'd Noticed In The Bar !  I Keep Telling Him He Needs To Speak More Clearly...
column50: I Don't Think So.
column51: The Very Strong  Howling Winds During The Evening And Night Made The Room Noisy At Times - But We Can Hardly Expect You To Be Able To Control That !
